Sense.DEF: the seventh letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第七个字母

Sense.DEF: the fifth note in the musical scale of C major or the musical key based on this note
Sense.TRAN: G音〔C大调音阶的第五音〕﹔G调

Sense.DEF: used to describe a film that has been officially approved as suitable for people of any age
Sense.TRAN: G级〔指经官方审看批准适合所有年龄段观众观看的电影〕

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring the force caused by gravity on an object as it starts to move faster and faster﹐or slower and slower
Sense.TRAN: 〔一个〕G力〔物体加速或减速时因重力作用所受力的单位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Astronauts endure a force of several G’s during take-off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宇航员在起飞时要承受数G的力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: high g-forces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很高的G力

Sense.DEF: a grand $1,000

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= gram or grams 克

Sense.DEF: to talk continuously, usually about things that are not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: You two were gabbing so much you didn’t even see me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们俩聊得那么起劲﹐甚至都没有看到我！

Sense.DEF: a strong material which does not allow water to go through and is often used for making coats
Sense.TRAN: 轧别丁﹐华达呢〔一种防水布料﹐多用于做外套〕

Sense.DEF: a coat made from gabardine
to say something so quickly that people cannot hear you clearly or understand you properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just calm down, stop gabbling, and tell me what has happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷静一下﹐说话别太急﹐告诉我发生了什么事。

Sense.DEF: a lot of talking that is difficult to understand, especially when several people are talking at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔几个人同时的〕混杂的说话声
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gabble of voices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘈杂的人声

Sense.DEF: another spelling of gabardine
an occasion when people talk to each other a lot
the upper end of a house wall where it joins with a sloping roof and makes a shape like a triangle
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gable end of the barn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谷仓有山墙的一端

Sense.DEF: having one or more gables
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gabled cottage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有山墙的小屋
Sense.EXAMPLE: gabled roofs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有山墙的屋顶

Sense.DEF: to go out and enjoy yourself, going to many different places, especially when you should be doing something else
Sense.TRAN: 闲荡﹐外出寻乐〔尤指本应做点别的什么事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: While I’m at home cooking, he’s gadding about with his friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在家做饭﹐而他却跟他的朋友一起在外头寻欢作乐。

Sense.DEF: someone who goes out a lot or travels a lot in order to enjoy themselves
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢游荡的人﹐常外出游玩的人

Sense.DEF: someone who annoys other people by criticizing them
Sense.TRAN: 〔爱批评别人而〕惹人讨厌的人

Sense.DEF: a fly that bites cattle and horses
a small, useful, and cleverly-designed machine or tool
Sense.TRAN: 设计精巧的小机械[工具]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a neat gadget for sharpening knives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精巧的磨刀工具

Sense.DEF: modern gadgets in general – sometimes used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 小巧的机械[工具]〔有时含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t understand how all this electronic gadgetry works.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不懂这种电子玩意儿是怎么工作的。

Sense.DEF: one of the Celtic languages, especially spoken in parts of Scotland and in Ireland
Sense.TRAN: 盖尔语〔一种凯尔特语﹐尤用于苏格兰部分地区和爱尔兰〕

Sense.DEF: a game played in Ireland between two teams of 15 players, using a round ball that can be kicked or hit with the hands
Sense.TRAN: 盖尔足球〔爱尔兰的一种15人制足球运动﹐球员可用脚踢球或用手击球〕

Sense.DEF: the place where someone lives
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wretched dirty gaff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脏兮兮的破屋子

Sense.DEF: a stick with a hook at the end, used to pull big fish out of the water
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于将大鱼拖出水面的〕手钩﹐挽钩

Sense.DEF: an embarrassing mistake made in a social situation or in public
Sense.TRAN: 〔在社交场合或大庭广众下的〕出丑﹐失礼﹐失言
Sense.EXAMPLE: The consul’s comments were a major diplomatic gaffe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领事的评论是一次重大的外交失言。

Sense.DEF: the person who is in charge of the lighting in making a cinema film
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影拍摄时负责照明的〕灯光师

Sense.DEF: an old man – used humorously
a man who is in charge of people, especially in a factory
to be unable to swallow and feel as if you are about to bring up food from your stomach
Sense.EXAMPLE: The foul smell made her gag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那股臭味让她想吐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He almost gagged on his first mouthful of food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他才吃一口就差点吐了出来。

Sense.DEF: to put a piece of cloth over someone’s mouth to stop them making a noise
Sense.TRAN: 用布堵住〔某人的嘴﹐使其不能出声〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thugs gagged her and tied her to a chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴徒用布堵住她的嘴﹐把她绑在一把椅子上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left his victim bound and gagged tied up and with something over their mouth that stops them speaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把受害者绑起来﹐堵住嘴。

Sense.DEF: to stop people saying what they want to say and expressing their opinions
Sense.TRAN: 压制〔某人〕的言论自由﹐限制〔某人〕发言
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to gag political activists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压制政治活动家言论的企图

Sense.LEXUNIT: be gagging to do sth/be gagging for sth
Sense.DEF: to be very eager to do or have something
Sense.TRAN: 急切地想做某事/急切地想要某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were gagging to sign the contract.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们急切地想把合同签下来。

Sense.DEF: to be very eager to have sex
a joke or funny story
Sense.EXAMPLE: He told a few gags.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲了几个笑话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a bit of a running gag a joke which is repeated in the show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是该档节目里一个有点老掉牙的笑话。

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth put over someone’s mouth to stop them making a noise
an insulting word used to describe someone who is confused because they are old
Sense.TRAN: 年老糊涂的〔侮辱性用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sid keeps forgetting my name. I think he’s going a bit gaga.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锡德老是忘记我的名字﹐我看他有点老糊涂了。

Sense.DEF: having a strong but often temporary feeling of love for someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t imagine why Susan is so gaga about him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想不通苏珊为何对他如此着迷。

Sense.DEF: an American spelling of gauge
a noisy group of people
Sense.TRAN: 一群叽叽喳喳的游客/小孩等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gaggle of teenage girls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群叽叽喳喳的少女

Sense.DEF: a group of geese
an order made by the court to prevent any public reporting of a case which is still being considered by a court of law
Sense.TRAN: 〔指法庭禁止公开报道正在审理的案件的〕禁言命令

Sense.DEF: a rule or law that stops people from talking about a subject during a particular time or in a particular place
when someone or something is cheerful and fun
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lars enjoyed the warmth and gaiety of these occasions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉斯喜欢这类场合温馨而欢乐的气氛。

Sense.DEF: enjoyable events or activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elaine missed the gaieties of life in Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莱恩怀念巴黎的快乐生活。

Sense.DEF: in a happy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Morning, Albert,’ she called gaily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “早安﹐艾伯特。”她快乐地喊道。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you do not care about, or do not realize, the effects of your actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: They gaily went on talking after the film had started.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影开演后他们继续毫无顾忌地说话。

Sense.DEF: having bright cheerful colours
Sense.TRAN: 色彩鲜艳的/涂上艳丽油漆的/装饰花哨的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: gaily coloured tropical birds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色彩艳丽的热带鸟

Sense.DEF: to obtain or achieve something you want or need
Sense.TRAN: 获得﹐赢得﹐取得〔想要或需要的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Radical left-wing parties gained control of local authorities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 激进的左翼政党控制了地方当局。

Sense.EXAMPLE: After gaining independence in 1957, it was renamed ‘Ghana’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1957年获得独立后﹐该国改名为“加纳”。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gained a doctorate in Chemical Engineering.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得了化学工程博士学位。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say get rather than gain.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说get﹐而不说gain
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She got a degree in English.

Sense.DEF: to gradually get more and more of a quality, feeling etc, especially a useful or valuable one
Sense.TRAN: 逐渐获得〔有用或宝贵的品质﹑感觉等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has gained a reputation as a good communicator.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获得了善于沟通的美名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of his ideas have gained popular support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的许多主张都得到了广泛支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an opportunity to gain experience in a work environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在工作环境中获得经验的一个机会
Sense.EXAMPLE: The youngsters gradually gain confidence in their abilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年对自己的能力越来越有信心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sport has gained in popularity in recent years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项体育运动近年来日益普及。

Sense.DEF: to get an advantage from a situation, opportunity, or event
Sense.TRAN: 〔从局势﹑机会或事件中〕受益﹐获得(好处)

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is much to be gained from seeking expert advice early.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽早征求专家意见大有好处。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to gain a competitive advantage over their rivals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得竞争优势超越对手的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who really stands to gain is likely to get an advantage from these tax cuts?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁才是这些减税计划的真正获益者？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing to be gained it will not help you by losing your temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发脾气无济于事。

Sense.DEF: to increase in weight, speed, height, or value
Sense.TRAN: 增加〔体重﹑速度﹑高度或价值〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carrie’s gained a lot of weight recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡丽的体重最近增加了很多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dollar has gained 8% against the yen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元对日元升值了8%。

Sense.DEF: to manage to enter a place, building, or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: New ramps will help the disabled gain better access.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新建的坡道将方便残疾人进出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: methods used by burglars to gain entry to houses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼入室使用的方法

Sense.DEF: to learn or find out about something
Sense.TRAN: 有所了解/领会/获得印象等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are hoping to gain a better understanding of the underlying process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望能对基本过程有一个更好的了解。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This enabled me to gain an overall impression of the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这使我对这所学校有了一个总体的了解。

Sense.DEF: to make steady progress and become more popular, more successful etc
Sense.TRAN: 稳步发展﹐变得更受欢迎[更成功]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The anti-smoking lobby has steadily gained ground in the last decade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反吸烟游说团体在过去十年中持续发展壮大。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately do something to give yourself more time to think
if a clock or watch gains, or if it gains time, it goes too fast
to reach a place after a lot of effort or difficulty
Sense.TRAN: 〔经过很大努力或困难之后〕到达
Sense.EXAMPLE: The swimmer finally gained the river bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那人终于游到了河岸。

Sense.DEF: to gradually get closer to a person, car etc that you are chasing
Sense.TRAN: 逼近﹐赶上〔被追赶的人﹑汽车等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quick – they’re gaining on us!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快——他们要赶上我们了！

Sense.DEF: an advantage or improvement, especially one achieved by planning or effort
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指靠计划或努力得到的〕好处﹐利益﹔改进
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party made considerable gains at local elections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党在地方选举中的成绩明显提高了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: substantial gains in efficiency
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 效率的大大提高

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the potential gains from improved marketing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 营销方法改进后的潜在好处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are obvious gains for the student.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名学生有明显的进步。

Sense.DEF: an increase in the amount or level of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a gain in weekly output
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每周产量的增加

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Retail sales showed a gain of 0.4%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 零售额显示有0.4%的增长。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Democratic Party needed a net gain of only 20 votes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党只需要增20张选票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eating too many fatty foods could cause weight gain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过多食用高脂食物会导致体重增加。

Sense.DEF: financial profit, especially when this seems to be the only thing someone is interested in
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指某人一味追求的〕收益﹐获利

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are seeking to realize the maximum financial gain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们追求实现财务收益最大化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pre-tax gain of $20 million
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 2,000万美元的税前收益

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Such research should not be for personal gain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的研究不应该是为了个人利益。

Sense.DEF: money or advantages obtained dishonestly – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 不义之财﹔以不义的手段获得的好处〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: work or activity for which you are paid
to say that something is not true, or to disagree with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one dared to gainsay him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人敢反驳他。

Sense.DEF: the way someone walks
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slow shuffling gait
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟缓拖沓的步子

Sense.DEF: a cloth or leather covering worn below the knee by men in the past, or now by walkers to keep their legs dry
a girl or woman – used especially by older people
Sense.TRAN: 女孩﹐女子〔尤为年长者使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a great gal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个好女孩。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= gallon or gallons 加仑

Sense.DEF: a public entertainment or performance to celebrate a special occasion

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Society’s Gala Dinner
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 协会举办的盛宴

Sense.EXAMPLE: a charity gala evening
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场慈善晚会

Sense.DEF: a sports competition, especially in swimming
relating to a galaxy
one of the large groups of stars that make up the universe
the large group of stars which our Sun and its planets belong to
a large number of things that are similar

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a galaxy of British artistic talent
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 灿若星汉的英国艺术人才

Sense.DEF: a very strong wind
Sense.EXAMPLE: a severe gale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵狂风

GramExa.GLOSS: it’s very windy

Sense.DEF: a sudden loud sound of laughter
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bar erupted into gales of laughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧里爆发出阵阵哄笑。

Sense.DEF: a gale force wind is strong enough to be dangerous or cause damage
Sense.TRAN: 〔风〕大风级的〔指具有危险性或破坏性〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: have the gall to do sth
Sense.DEF: to do something rude and unreasonable that most people would be too embarrassed to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: He even had the gall to blame Lucy for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事他居然有脸责怪露西。

Sense.DEF: anger and hate that will not go away
a swelling on a tree or plant caused by damage from insects or infection
a painful place on an animal’s skin, caused by something rubbing against it
to make someone feel upset and angry because of something that is unfair
Sense.TRAN: 〔因某事不公正而〕使恼怒﹐激怒
Sense.EXAMPLE: It really galled him to see Anita doing so well now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到安妮塔现在干得那么好﹐他心里实在恼火。

Sense.DEF: a man who is gallant is kind and polite towards women
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gallant young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个殷勤的小伙子

Sense.DEF: brave
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gallant attempt to save lives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救人的勇敢之举

Sense.DEF: a well-dressed young man who is kind and polite towards women
Sense.TRAN: 时髦绅士〔指穿着考究﹑对女子殷勤的年轻男子〕

Sense.DEF: courage, especially in a battle
Sense.TRAN: 英勇﹐勇敢〔尤指在作战中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a medal for gallantry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英勇勋章

Sense.DEF: polite attention given by men to women
the organ in your body in which bile is stored
a sailing ship used mainly by the Spanish from the 15th to the 17th century
Sense.TRAN: 〔15至17世纪主要为西班牙人所用的〕帆船

Subsense.DEF: a large building where people can see famous pieces of art
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an exhibition of African art at the Hayward Gallery
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海沃德美术馆的非洲艺术展览

Subsense.DEF: a small privately owned shop or studio where you can see and buy pieces of art
Subsense.TRAN: 〔陈列并出售艺术品的私人拥有的〕画廊

Subsense.DEF: an upper floor or balcony built on an inner wall of a hall, theatre, or church, from which people can watch a performance, discussion etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔大厅﹑剧场或教堂里的〕楼座﹐楼上旁听席
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the public gallery in Congress
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会的公共旁听席

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could only afford seats up in the gallery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只买得起楼座里的位子。

Subsense.DEF: the people sitting in a gallery

Sense.DEF: to do or say something just because you think it will please people and make you popular
a level passage under the ground in a mine or cave
Sense.TRAN: 〔矿坑或洞穴里的〕水平巷道[坑道]

Sense.DEF: a kitchen on a ship
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fire extinguishers are stored in the galley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灭火器存放在船上的厨房里。

Sense.DEF: a long low Greek or Roman ship with sails which was rowed by slaves in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔古希腊或古罗马由奴隶划桨的〕桨帆船

Sense.DEF: technical

Subsense.DEF: a tray used in the process of printing books etc which holds type
a sheet of paper on which a new book is printed, so that mistakes can be put right before divided into pages

Sense.DEF: relating to or typical of France or French people
Sense.TRAN: 高卢的﹔法国的﹔法国人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gallic charm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国人的魅力

Sense.DEF: making you feel upset and angry because of something that is unfair
Sense.TRAN: 〔因某事不公平而〕使人恼怒的﹐令人生气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The most galling thing is that the guy who got promoted is less qualified than me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最令人气愤的是﹐那个得到晋升的家伙资历还不如我。

Sense.DEF: to spend time enjoying yourself and going from place to place for pleasure – used humorously in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 闲逛﹐游荡﹐寻欢作乐〔幽默用法﹐含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She should be home with children, not gallivanting around.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她应该在家里带孩子﹐而不是到处去玩。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring liquids, equal to eight pints. In Britain this is 4.55 litres, and in the US it is 3.79 litres.
Sense.TRAN: 加仑〔液量单位﹐英制合4.55升﹐美制合3.79升〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 20 gallon fish tank
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个20加仑的鱼缸
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car does about 50 miles per gallon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车每加仑油能开50英里左右。

Sense.DEF: a lot of a liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: We drank gallons of coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们畅饮了不少咖啡。

Sense.DEF: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together
Sense.EXAMPLE: A neighbour’s horse came galloping the road, riderless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一匹邻居家的马在路上飞奔﹐上面没人骑着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a galloping horse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一匹奔驰的马

Sense.DEF: if you gallop, you ride very fast on a horse or you make it go very fast

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I watched as Jan galloped away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着简策马奔驰而去。

Sense.DEF: to move very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ian came galloping down the stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩从楼上飞奔下来。

Subsense.DEF: the movement of a horse at its fastest speed, when all four feet leave the ground together
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The horses broke into a gallop begin to go very fast.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马儿飞奔起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mounted police charged at full gallop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 骑警策马全速冲去。

Subsense.DEF: a ride on a horse when it is galloping

Sense.DEF: a very fast speed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The project began at full gallop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项目开始全速推进。

Sense.DEF: increasing or developing very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 快速增加的﹐飞速发展的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: galloping inflation of 20 to 30%
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20%到30%的高速通货膨胀

Sense.DEF: a structure used for killing criminals by hanging from a rope
humour which makes very unpleasant or dangerous things seem funny
Sense.TRAN: 绞刑架下的幽默﹐大难临头时的幽默

Sense.DEF: a hard stone which can form in your gall bladder
someone who is not at all graceful and does not dress neatly
Sense.TRAN: 衣冠不整﹑行为粗俗的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: You clumsy galoot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这笨手笨脚的粗人！

Sense.DEF: in large amounts or numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: bargains galore in the sales
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大减价时的许多廉价商品

Sense.DEF: rubber shoes worn over ordinary shoes when it rains or snows
Sense.TRAN: 〔雨雪天套在普通鞋外面的〕橡胶套鞋

Sense.DEF: to move in a noisy, heavy, and awkward way
Sense.TRAN: 脚步沉重地行进﹐笨拙地行进

Sense.DEF: making people react suddenly with strong feelings or actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bomb warning had a galvanic effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹袭击警告引起了一场恐慌。

Sense.DEF: relating to the production of electricity by the action of acid on metal
Sense.TRAN: 〔酸和金属起反应而〕产生电流的

Sense.DEF: a British spelling of galvanize
the production of electricity by the use of chemicals, especially as in a battery
to shock or surprise someone so that they do something to solve a problem, improve a situation etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The possibility of defeat finally galvanized us into action.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能到来的失败威胁最终促使我们采取行动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The report galvanized world opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇报道一出﹐世界舆论一片哗然。

Sense.DEF: metal that has had a covering of zinc put on it so that it does not rust
something that you do or say which is intended to give you an advantage in an argument
Sense.TRAN: 〔争辩中〕争取优势的招数﹐策略
Sense.EXAMPLE: a clever debating gambit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧妙的辩论策略
Sense.EXAMPLE: These questions are often an opening gambit the thing you say first for a negotiation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题往往是谈判的开场白。

Sense.DEF: a planned series of moves at the beginning of a game of chess
to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their religion forbids them to drink or gamble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的宗教禁止饮酒和赌博。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack loves gambling on the horses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克喜欢赌马。

Sense.DEF: to do something that involves a lot of risk, and that will not succeed unless things happen the way you would like them to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re gambling on Johnson being fit for Saturday’s game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把赌注押在约翰逊身上﹐指望星期六的比赛他能够出场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Potter gambled everything on his new play being a hit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 波特把一切都押在他的新戏上﹐希望它卖座。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was gambling that he wouldn’t read it too carefully.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抱着侥幸的心理﹐觉得他不会看得太仔细。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can’t relax our safety standards – we’d be gambling with people’s lives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能放松安全标准——否则就是拿人的生命来冒险。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂文斯是一个嗜赌成癖的家伙。

Sense.DEF: to lose the whole of an amount of money by gambling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nielsen gambled his inheritance away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼尔森把继承的遗产都赌光了。

Sense.DEF: an action or plan that involves a risk but that you hope will succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a big gamble for her to leave the band and go solo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她离开乐队单飞是巨大的冒险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gamble on the harvest had paid off succeeded.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在收成上冒的这次险算是成功了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Ellen had to admit the gamble had paid off succeeded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦不得不承认这一次赌赢了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a depressed market, we cannot afford to take a gamble on a new product.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在市场不景气的情况下﹐我们不能在新产品上冒险。

Sense.DEF: when people risk money or possessions on the result of something which is not certain, such as a card game or a horse race
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lottery is probably the most popular form of gambling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩票可能是最普遍的一种赌博形式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: gambling debts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赌债
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police raided a number of illegal gambling dens places for illegal gambling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方突击搜查了几个非法赌窟。

Sense.DEF: to jump or run around in a lively active way
Sense.EXAMPLE: lambs gambolling in a field
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在田野里蹦蹦跳跳的小羊

Subsense.DEF: an activity or sport in which people compete with each other according to agreed rules
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We used to love playing games like chess or backgammon.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以前喜欢玩国际象棋或双陆棋这样的游戏。

Subsense.DEF: an occasion when a game is played
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Did you see the game on TV last night?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你昨晚看了电视转播的那场比赛吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you like to have a game of tennis?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想打一局网球吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: England’s World Cup game against Holland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰对阵荷兰的世界杯赛

Subsense.DEF: a large organized sports event
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Olympic Games
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥林匹克运动会

Subsense.DEF: organized sports as a school subject or lesson
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We have games on Thursdays.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期四上体育课。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a games lesson
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堂体育课

Sense.DEF: one of the parts into which a single match is divided, for example in tennis or bridge14
Sense.EXAMPLE: Graf leads, two games to one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格拉芙以局分2比1领先。

Sense.DEF: a children’s activity in which they play with toys, pretend to be someone else etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a game of hide-and-seek
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 捉迷藏游戏

Sense.EXAMPLE: The boys were playing a game in the backyard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩们在后院里玩游戏。

Sense.DEF: how well someone plays a particular game or sport
Sense.TRAN: 某人的比赛技巧﹐某人的运动技能

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Liam’s taking lessons to improve his game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利亚姆在参加课程提高运动技能。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the strongest aspect of his game
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他比赛技巧中最强的一面

Sense.DEF: to spoil a surprise or secret by doing or saying something that lets someone guess what the secret is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lynn gave the game away by laughing when Kim walked in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林恩在金走进来的时候笑出了声﹐泄露了秘密。

Sense.LEXUNIT: beat sb at their own game

Variant.LEXVAR: play sb at their own game

Sense.DEF: to beat someone or fight back against them by using the same methods that they use
Sense.TRAN: 以其人之道还治其人之身

Sense.DEF: to be something that you do to enjoy yourself rather than for a serious purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just a game to them. They don’t care what happens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对他们来说只是儿戏﹐他们并不在乎会有什么样的后果。

Subsense.DEF: to behave in a dishonest or unfair way in order to get what you want
Subsense.TRAN: 欺骗（某人）﹐（跟某人）耍花招
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are you sure he’s really interested, and not just playing silly games with you?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你确信他是真的感兴趣﹐而不是在跟你耍鬼把戏？

Subsense.DEF: to not be serious about doing something
Subsense.TRAN: （跟某人）玩游戏﹐（跟某人）闹着玩
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We want a deal. We’re not interested in playing games.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要的是达成协议﹐没有兴趣闹着玩。

Sense.DEF: wild animals, birds, and fish that are hunted for food, especially as a sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: game birds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被捕猎的鸟

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is the only possible choice in a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Church of England is no longer the only game in town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰圣公会不再是唯一的选择。

Sense.DEF: an area of work or business
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been in this game for over ten years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我干这一行已经有十多年了。

Sense.DEF: used to ask what the true reason for someone’s behaviour is
Sense.TRAN: 她/你等为什么这样做？她/你等在搞什么名堂？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reg is being very nice all of a sudden. What’s his game?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷吉一下子变得非常友好﹐他在耍什么花招？

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that something wrong or dishonest that they have done has been discovered
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come out, Don. The game’s up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出来吧﹐唐﹐戏该收场了。

Sense.DEF: a game in which you risk money on the result
Sense.TRAN: 碰运气的游戏﹐赌钱的游戏
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poker is a game of chance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扑克牌是一种碰运气的游戏。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is very skilful at doing something, especially a sport
Sense.TRAN: 某人很在行〔尤指体育运动〕

Sense.DEF: to be a prostitute
Sense.TRAN: 干那种行当﹐当妓女﹐卖淫

Sense.DEF: said when the balance of a sports match or competition changes, and both sides suddenly have a chance of winning
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛或竞赛中因形势突变〕输赢尚未见分晓﹐胜负难料

Sense.DEF: said to emphasize that an event or activity is completely finished
Sense.TRAN: 游戏结束了〔用于强调某个事件或活动已全部结束〕

Sense.DEF: to make fun of someone
Sense.TRAN: 取笑某人﹐跟某人开玩笑

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They explained how to play the game.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们解释了这游戏怎么玩。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Did you see the game last night?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看昨晚的比赛了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were having a game of pool.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在打普尔台球。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A.C. Milan won the game with a last-minute goal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: AC米兰队在最后一分钟进了球﹐拿下这场比赛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: both teams or players had the same score
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The game was tied 10-10 at halftime.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半场结束时比分为10比10平。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: end the game with the same score as the opposing team or player

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was up all night playing computer games.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他通宵不睡玩电脑游戏。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Bridge is a card game for four people.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 桥牌是一种四人纸牌游戏。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: board games such as Monopoly and Scrabble
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大富翁﹑拼字游戏等棋盘游戏

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t very good at team games when I was at school.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上学时不大会玩团队游戏。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What’s your favourite party game?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最喜欢什么聚会游戏？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: played at a team’s own sports field
played at an opposing team’s sports field
played as part of a league competition
played as part of a cup competition

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s against the rules of the game to pick up the ball.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 捡球是犯规的。

Sense.DEF: willing to try something dangerous, new, or difficult
Sense.TRAN: 愿意尝试〔危险﹑新鲜或困难的事〕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Okay. I’m game if you are.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐你上我也上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always game for a laugh.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是愿意找点乐子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Who’s game to have a try?’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “谁愿意试一试？”

Sense.DEF: an injured or painful leg
to use rules or laws to get what you want in an unfair but legal way
someone whose job is to look after wild animals and birds that are kept to be hunted on private land
a group of Indonesian musicians who mainly play percussion instruments such as drums and gongs
Sense.TRAN: 加美兰乐队﹐甘美朗〔流行于印度尼西亚﹐以锣﹑鼓等打击乐器为主〕

Sense.DEF: a game reserve
Sense.TRAN: 禁猎区﹐野生动物保护区

Sense.DEF: a plan for achieving success, especially in business or sports
Sense.TRAN: 方案﹐策略〔尤指商业或体育比赛方面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has his game plan all worked out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把行动方案全都制订出来了。

Sense.DEF: the way that a computer game is designed and the skills that you need to play it
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is packed with brilliant graphics and gameplay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个游戏的画面和情节都很精彩。

Sense.DEF: the situation in a game such as tennis in which one player will win the game if they win the next point
Sense.TRAN: 局点〔指网球等比赛中一方再赢一分即赢下一局的时刻〕

Sense.DEF: someone who plays computer games
a person who is very good at a sport and helps their team to win games
Sense.TRAN: 〔擅长某一体育运动﹑帮助本队获胜的〕比赛高手﹐得分王

Sense.DEF: a large area of land that is designed for wild animals to live in safely
Sense.TRAN: 禁猎区﹐野生动物保护区

Sense.DEF: an electronic machine that is used for playing games on a screen
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re bringing out a new games console this Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个圣诞节他们要推出一种新型游戏机。

Sense.DEF: a television programme in which people play games or answer questions to win prizes
the ability to succeed by using the rules of a game or activity to your own advantage
a type of cell which joins with another cell, starting the development of a baby or other young creature
Sense.TRAN: 配子〔与另一细胞结合形成胚胎的细胞〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to look after wild animals in a game reserve
having the strong taste of wild animals that are hunted for food
Sense.TRAN: 腥臊的﹐有浓烈野味味道的

Sense.DEF: a small thin girl or woman who looks like a boy
Sense.TRAN: 男孩气的瘦小女子﹐假小子

Sense.DEF: the activity of playing computer games
Sense.EXAMPLE: online gaming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网络游戏

Sense.DEF: the activity of playing cards or other games of chance for money
Sense.EXAMPLE: gaming tables
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赌桌

Sense.DEF: the third letter of the Greek alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 伽马〔希腊字母表的第三个字母﹐即 Γ﹐γ〕

Sense.DEF: a beam of light with a short wavelength, that can pass through solid objects
meat from a pig’s leg, preserved using salt
Sense.EXAMPLE: gammon steak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猪腿排

Sense.DEF: a gammy leg or knee is injured or painful
the complete range of possibilities

GramExa.EXAMPLE: College life opened up a whole gamut of new experiences.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学生活提供了各种全新的体验。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her feelings that day ran the gamut of emotions included all the possibilities between two extremes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那天百感交集。

Sense.DEF: another spelling of gamey
a male goose1
to look at something
a popular alcoholic drink served with ice and a thin piece of lemon
Sense.TRAN: 金汤力〔掺奎宁水的杜松子酒﹐加冰和柠檬片〕

Subsense.DEF: a group of young people who spend time together, and who are often involved in crime or drugs and who often fight against other groups
Subsense.TRAN: 一帮年轻人﹐帮派〔尤指犯罪团伙〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: two rival street gangs
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个敌对的街头流氓团伙

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The parents have denied that their son is a gang member.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那对父母否认自己的儿子是流氓团伙的成员。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: the problem of inner-city gang violence
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老城区的团伙暴力问题
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a victim of gang warfare
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮派斗争的受害者

Subsense.DEF: a group of young people together in one place, especially young people who might cause trouble
Subsense.TRAN: 一帮﹐一群〔尤指可能肇事的年轻人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were always gangs of kids hanging around the mall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 购物中心一带总有一帮帮的年轻人在游荡。

Sense.DEF: a group of criminals who work together
Sense.TRAN: 黑帮﹐〔犯罪分子的〕一帮﹐一伙
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several gangs were operating in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有好几个犯罪团伙在这个地区活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Armed gangs have hijacked lorries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装犯罪团伙劫持了卡车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a gang of smugglers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个走私团伙

Sense.DEF: a group of friends, especially young people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole gang will be there next weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下个周末大伙儿都会去那里。

Sense.DEF: a group of workers or prisoners doing physical work together
Sense.TRAN: 〔一起干活的〕一群工人﹐一群囚犯

Sense.DEF: if people gang together, they form a group in order to do something together, especially to oppose something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smaller shopkeepers ganged together to beat off competition from the supermarkets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 规模较小的店家联合起来对抗超市的竞争。

Sense.DEF: if people gang up on someone, they join together to attack, criticize, or oppose them, especially in a way that seems unfair
Sense.EXAMPLE: School-children are quick to gang up on anyone who looks or behaves differently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小学里谁要是外表或者行为与众不同﹐其他学生很快就会群起而攻之。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when several people have sex with each other at the same time
a gang rape
very eagerly and with a lot of energy, or very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 热情洋溢地﹐精力充沛地
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were going like gangbusters, then all of a sudden everything went wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正干得起劲﹐突然间一切都乱了套。

Sense.DEF: a killing etc relating to the world of organized and violent crime
Sense.TRAN: 黑社会凶杀/谋杀/枪击等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sharp may have been the victim of a gangland revenge killing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏普可能是黑社会报复杀人的受害者。

Sense.DEF: unusually tall and thin, and not able to move gracefully
Sense.TRAN: 又高又瘦而动作笨拙的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an awkward gangling teenager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个竹竿似的﹑笨手笨脚的少年

Sense.DEF: a painful raised area of skin that is full of liquid, often on the back of your wrist
a mass of nerve cells
another form of gangling
someone who is in charge of a large group of foreign labourers people who work outdoors, using their physical strength, especially labourers who do not have official permission to work in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在英国非法打工的外国人的〕工头﹐工长

Sense.DEF: a board for walking on between a boat and the shore, or between two boats
Sense.TRAN: 〔船和岸之间或船与船之间的〕跳板﹐步桥

Sense.DEF: an occasion when several men attack a woman and force her to have sex with them
a condition in which your flesh decays in part of your body, because blood has stopped flowing there as a result of illness or injury
someone who is a member of a gang
Sense.EXAMPLE: gangstas in South Central L.A.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛杉矶中南部的帮派分子

Sense.DEF: a type of rap music with words about drugs, violence, and life in poor areas of cities
a member of a violent group of criminals
a space between two rows of seats in a theatre, bus, or train
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧场﹑公共汽车或火车上两排座位间的〕过道

Sense.DEF: a large board or steps between a boat and the shore for people to walk down
used to tell people in a crowd to let someone go through
a large sea bird that lives in large groups on cliffs
Sense.TRAN: 鲣鸟﹐塘鹅〔群居在悬崖上的一种大海鸟〕

Sense.DEF: someone who eats a lot
a large metal frame which is used to support heavy machinery or railway signals
Sense.TRAN: 〔支承重型机器或铁路信号灯的〕台架

Sense.DEF: a British spelling of jail
a British spelling of jailbird
a British spelling of jailer
a space between two objects or two parts of an object, especially because something is missing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The neighbors’ dog got in through a gap in the hedge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻居的狗从树篱的缺口钻了进来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a gap in the traffic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车流中的一个空档

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the gap between the two rows of seats
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两排座位之间的间隔

Sense.DEF: a big difference between two situations, amounts, groups of people etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the widening gap between the rich and the poor
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越大的贫富差距

Sense.DEF: something missing that stops something else from being good or complete

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are huge gaps in my knowledge of history.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的历史知识有很大的欠缺。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Frank’s death has left a big gap in my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克的去世给我的生活留下一大片空白。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He filled the gap left by Hirst’s retirement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫斯特退休后﹐他填补了空缺。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when nothing is happening, that exists between two other periods of time when something is happening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an awkward gap in the conversation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈话中间一次令人尴尬的冷场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gaps between his visits got longer and longer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他探望的时间隔得越来越长了。

Sense.DEF: a low place between two higher parts of a mountain
a product or service that does not exist, so that there is an opportunity to develop that product or service and sell it

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There’s a big gap between the two test scores.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两次测验成绩之间差距很大。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There’s only a narrow gap between the two candidates in the polls.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位候选人在民意测验中仅有微小的差距。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very big difference
the difference between the amount a country imports and exports
the difference in attitudes, tastes etc between older and younger people
a difference in age between two people
reduce the amount or importance of a difference
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The book aims to bridge the gap between theory and practice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书旨在架起理论与实践间的桥梁。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Polls show the gap between the two candidates has narrowed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 民意测验显示两名候选人之间的差距缩小了。

Sense.DEF: to look at something for a long time, especially with your mouth open, because you are very surprised or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 瞠目结舌[目瞪口呆]地注视

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are all these people gaping at?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人目不转睛地都在看什么呀？

Sense.DEF: to open widely or be wide open
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan stood at the door, his shirt gaping open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹敞着衬衫站在门口。

Sense.DEF: a gaping hole, wound, or mouth is very wide and open
Sense.TRAN: 〔洞〕豁开的﹔〔伤口〕敞开的﹔〔嘴巴〕张大的

Sense.DEF: having wide spaces between your teeth
a year between leaving school and going to university, which some young people use as an opportunity to travel, earn money, or get experience of working
Sense.TRAN: 空档年﹐间隔年〔指中学毕业后上大学前的一年﹐有的年轻人利用这一年旅游﹑挣钱或积累工作经验〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some students choose to work in high-tech industries during their gap year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些学生在上大学前的间隔年选择到高科技行业工作。

Sense.DEF: a building for keeping a car in, usually next to or attached to a house
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常紧靠房屋的〕车库﹐停车房
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll just go and put the car in the garage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把车停到车库去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their house had a double garage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的房子有一个双车位车库。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an automatic garage door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车库自动门

Sense.DEF: a building in a public place where cars can be parked
Sense.EXAMPLE: We parked in an underground garage near the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把车停在酒店附近的一个地下车库里。

Sense.DEF: a place where motor vehicles are repaired
Sense.EXAMPLE: My car’s at the garage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的车正放在汽修厂修理。

Sense.DEF: a place where you buy petrol
a type of popular music played on electronic instruments, with a strong fast beat and singing
Sense.TRAN: 车库乐〔一种电子音乐﹐节奏很快很强〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a collection of the latest dance and garage hits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新舞曲和车库乐金曲合辑

Sense.DEF: to put or keep a vehicle in a garage
Sense.TRAN: 将〔汽车〕开进[停放在]车库

Sense.DEF: a group of musicians who play rock music and practise in a garage
Sense.TRAN: 车库乐队〔在车库排练的摇滚乐队〕

Sense.DEF: a sale of used furniture, clothes etc from people’s houses, usually held in or near someone’s garage
Sense.TRAN: 车库旧物出售〔指将家里的旧家具﹑旧衣物等摆在自家的车库里或车库附近出售〕

Sense.DEF: a mixture of spices which gives a hot taste to food, used especially in Indian cooking
Sense.TRAN: 印度什香粉〔有辣味的混合香料﹐尤用于印度烹调〕

Sense.DEF: a particular style of clothing, especially clothes that show your type of work or look unusual
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指显示工作类型或样式特别的〕制服﹐服装﹐装束
Sense.EXAMPLE: priestly garb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牧师装束

Sense.DEF: waste material, such as paper, empty containers, and food thrown away
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you take out the garbage when you go?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你走的时候把垃圾带出去好吗？

Sense.DEF: stupid words, ideas etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re talking garbage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在胡说八道。

Sense.DEF: used to say that if the data information you put into a computer is bad, the results you get back will be bad, even if the computer program you use works properly
Sense.TRAN: 无用输入﹐无用输出〔即如果向计算机中输入错误数据﹐那么输出的也是错误数据〕.

Sense.DEF: a container with a lid for holding waste until it can be taken away
someone whose job is to remove waste from garbage cans
a small machine in the kitchen sink which breaks vegetable waste into small pieces so that it washes down the drain of the sink
a garbage collector
a large vehicle which goes from house to house to collect the contents of garbage cans
a chickpea
to be dressed in a particular type of clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: singers garbed in costumes of gold
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身穿金色演出服的歌手

Sense.DEF: a garbled statement or report is very unclear and confusing
Sense.TRAN: 〔陈述﹑报告〕含混不清的﹐极其混乱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The papers had some garbled version of the story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸上对这件事的报道有些混乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a garbled phone message
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含糊不清的电话留言

Sense.DEF: a waiter in a French restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 〔法国餐馆里的〕男服务员﹐男侍者

Sense.DEF: the area of land next to a house, where there are flowers, grass, and other plants, and often a place for people to sit
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s outside in the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在外面花园里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grace brought us some flowers from her garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷丝给我们送来一些她花园里的花。

GramExa.GLOSS: at the back or front of the house

Sense.DEF: a part of the area next to a house, which has plants and flowers in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house has a beautiful herb garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那房子有一个美丽的百草园。

Sense.DEF: a large area of land where plants and flowers are grown so that the public can go and see them
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Botanical Gardens at Kew
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基尤的植物园

Sense.DEF: used in the name of streets
Sense.EXAMPLE: 211 Roland Gardens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗兰街211号

Crossrefto.REFLEX: lead sb up the garden path

PIC.HEADING: GARDEN EQUIPMENT 园艺用具
PIC.PICCONTENT: wheelbarrow 独轮手推车；rake耙子；watering can洒水壶；lawn mower割草机；spade铁锹；gardening gloves园艺手套；fork叉；trowel小泥铲；shears 大剪刀；sprinkler 洒水器；flowerpot 花盆

Sense.DEF: to work in a garden, keeping it clean, growing plants etc
a place that sells plants, flowers, and equipment for gardens
Sense.TRAN: 〔出售植物﹑花卉和园艺用具的〕园艺中心﹐花卉市场

Sense.DEF: a town that has been designed to have a lot of trees, areas of grass, and open spaces
someone whose job is to work in gardens
someone who enjoys growing flowers and plants
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom has always been a good gardener.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈一直很擅长侍花弄草。

Sense.DEF: a bush with large white pleasant-smelling flowers
the activity of working in a garden, growing plants, cutting a lawn etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I might do a bit of gardening this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午我可能会干些园艺活。

Sense.DEF: a name for the county of Kent in southeast England, because of the fruit and vegetables it produces
Sense.TRAN: 英格兰花园〔指英格兰东南部的肯特郡﹐因盛产水果和蔬菜而得名〕

Sense.DEF: a formal party for a lot of people which is held in a large garden in the afternoon
Sense.TRAN: 园会﹐花园招待会〔指午后在大花园里举行的有许多人参加的正式聚会〕

Sense.DEF: very ordinary and not very interesting
Sense.TRAN: 非常一般的﹐平淡无奇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is not one of your garden-variety cases of fraud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不是那种一般的欺诈案。

Sense.DEF: extremely large
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meal of gargantuan proportions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丰盛的大餐
Sense.EXAMPLE: gargantuan task
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰巨的任务

Sense.DEF: to clean the inside of your mouth and throat by blowing air through water or medicine in the back of your throat

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gargling with salt water may help your sore throat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用盐水漱口可能对你的喉咙痛有好处。

Sense.DEF: liquid that you gargle with
the act of gargling
a stone figure of a strange and ugly creature, that carries rain water from the roof of an old building, especially a church
Sense.TRAN: 〔教堂等古老建筑物屋顶上的石雕怪兽状的〕滴水嘴﹐滴水兽

Sense.DEF: very brightly coloured in a way that is unpleasant to look at
Sense.TRAN: 颜色过分鲜艳的﹐过于花哨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the rugs are too garish for my taste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多地毯色彩太花哨﹐不合我的口味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: garish colors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过分花哨的颜色

Sense.DEF: a ring of flowers or leaves, worn on your head or around your neck for decoration or for a special ceremony

GramExa.EXAMPLE: garlands of flowers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 花环

Sense.DEF: to decorate someone or something, especially with flowers

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tree was garlanded with strings of coloured lights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 树上挂着一串串彩灯。

Sense.DEF: a plant like a small onion, used in cooking to give a strong taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add a crushed clove of garlic single section of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加一瓣压碎的大蒜。

Sense.DEF: a tool used to crush garlic
a piece of clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pulled the garment on and zipped it up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿上衣服并拉好拉链。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She works in the garment district of Manhattan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在曼哈顿的服装加工区工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The outer garment was a loose-fitting robe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外套是一件宽松的长袍。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Garment is used in business contexts, especially in American English, to talk about the business of making and selling clothes. In everyday English, people usually say clothes (plural).
F2NBox.TRAN: garment是商业用语﹐美国英语中尤用于谈论服装的生产和销售。在日常英语中﹐人们一般用clothes（复数）
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What kind of clothes was she wearing?

Sense.DEF: a special bag used to carry clothes such as suits and dresses
Sense.TRAN: 放置衣服的旅行袋﹔衣罩
Sense.EXAMPLE: I packed the dresses in a black garment bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把衣服装进一个黑色的专用衣袋里。

Sense.DEF: to take or collect something, especially information or support
Sense.TRAN: 得到﹐收集〔尤指信息或支持〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party garnered 70 percent of the vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党得到了70%的选票。

Sense.DEF: a dark red stone used as a jewel
a dark red colour
a small amount of food such as salad or fruit that you place on food to decorate it
Sense.TRAN: 〔放在食物上的色拉﹑水果等〕装饰菜

Sense.DEF: to add something to food in order to decorate it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Garnish each dish with a slice of lemon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在每盘菜上配一片柠檬。

Sense.DEF: a small uncomfortable room at the top of a house, just under the roof
a group of soldiers living in a town or fort and defending it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garrison was called out when news of the enemy’s advance was received.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收到敌人推进的情报后﹐卫戍部队奉命出动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a garrison town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有部队驻防的城镇

Sense.DEF: the buildings where a garrison of soldiers live
to send a group of soldiers to defend or guard a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our regiment will garrison the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们团将驻防在这个镇上。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone by pulling a metal collar or wire tightly around their neck
Sense.TRAN: 〔用金属环或金属丝〕勒杀﹐勒死

Sense.DEF: always talking a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ian isn’t normally this garrulous!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩一般不这么唠叨！

Sense.DEF: a band of elastic material that stretches worn around your leg to keep a sock or stocking up
one of four pieces of elastic fixed to a woman’s underwear and to her stockings to hold them up
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子内衣上用以固定长筒袜的〕吊袜带

Sense.DEF: a piece of women’s underwear with garters hanging down from it which fasten onto stockings and hold them up
a harmless American snake with lines of colour along its back
Sense.TRAN: 袜带蛇〔美洲一种无毒蛇〕

Sense.DEF: a substance such as air, which is not solid or liquid, and usually cannot be seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: hydrogen gas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 氢气

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a cloud of toxic gas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一团毒气

GramExa.GLOSS: for storing gas

Sense.DEF: a clear substance like air that is burned for heating or cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you light the gas for me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮我点燃煤气好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The explosion was caused by a gas leak from the water heater.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次爆炸是热水器燃气泄漏造成的。

Sense.DEF: a measurement of the temperature of a gas oven
Sense.TRAN: 〔测量燃气烤箱温度的〕燃气刻度 4/5/6 等

Sense.DEF: a liquid made from petroleum, used mainly for producing power in the engines of cars, trucks etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I probably spend over $200 a month on gas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一个月大概要花200多美元汽油钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mechanic found a hole in the gas tank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车修理工发现油箱上有一个洞。

Sense.DEF: the gas pedal of a car
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stepped on the gas pushed down the gas pedal and made the car go faster and sped away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们踩下油门﹐迅速开走了。

Sense.DEF: a clear substance like air that is used for medical reasons, for example to make people feel less pain or make them sleep during an operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: an anaesthetic gas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麻醉气体

Sense.DEF: a type of gas used as a weapon, because it harms or kills people when they breathe it in
Sense.EXAMPLE: mustard gas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芥子气

Sense.DEF: the condition of having a lot of air in your stomach
something that is fun and makes you laugh a lot
Sense.TRAN: 有趣的事﹐令人发笑的事

Sense.DEF: to poison or kill someone with gas
to talk for a long time about unimportant or boring things
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were just gassing away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们聊个没完。

Sense.DEF: to put petrol in a car
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d better gas up before we go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走之前最好加点油。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: George gassed up the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治给汽车加了油。

Sense.DEF: someone who talks too much
Sense.TRAN: 夸夸其谈的人﹐喋喋不休的人

Sense.DEF: a large room in which people or animals are killed with poisonous gas
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于毒死人或动物的〕毒气室

Sense.DEF: like gas or in the form of gas
using gas as a fuel
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gas-fired central heating system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃气中央供暖系统

Sense.DEF: a car that uses a lot of petrol
a large deep cut or hole in something, for example in a person’s skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blood poured from a deep gash in her forehead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲜血从她额头上一道很深的伤口汩汩地流出来。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: One day Frank gashed his hand on a bit of broken glass.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天﹐弗兰克的手被一块碎玻璃划了道大口子。

Sense.DEF: a very large round metal container or building from which gas is carried in pipes to buildings
a flat piece of material, often rubber, placed between two surfaces so that steam, oil, gas etc cannot escape

Subsense.DEF: if a vehicle blows a gasket, steam or gas escapes from the engine
to become very angry

Sense.DEF: the light produced from burning gas
a lamp in a house or on the street which gives light from burning gas
someone whose job is to come to your home to see how much gas you have used or to repair your gas system
Sense.TRAN: 燃气抄表员﹔燃气设备修理工

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment worn over your face to protect you from poisonous gases
a piece of equipment that measures how much gas is used in a building
petrol with a small amount of alcohol in it, which can be used in cars and is cheaper than petrol
Sense.TRAN: 乙醇汽油〔即加有少量乙醇的汽油〕

Sense.DEF: a liquid obtained from petroleum, used mainly for producing power in the engines of cars, trucks etc
a gasholder
to breathe in suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain
Sense.TRAN: 〔因惊讶或疼痛而〕大声吸气﹐倒抽气

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ollie gasped with pain and slumped forward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥利疼得直抽气﹐往前栽倒下去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The audience gasped at the splendour of the costumes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 华丽的服装令观众惊叹。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘My leg!’ he gasped. ‘I think it’s broken!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我的腿！”他倒抽一口气喊道﹐“我觉得腿断了！”

Sense.DEF: to breathe quickly in a way that can be heard because you are having difficulty breathing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brendan climbed slowly, gasping for breath.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布伦丹上气不接下气地缓慢攀爬。

Sense.DEF: to feel that you urgently need something such as a drink or cigarette
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m gasping for a pint!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好想喝一大杯啤酒啊！

Sense.DEF: when you take in a breath suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指惊讶或疼痛引起的〕大声吸气﹐倒抽气

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With a gasp of pure horror, Lewis jumped up and ran.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯吓得倒抽了一口气﹐跳起来就跑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave a little gasp and clutched George’s hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻地倒抽一口气﹐抓住了乔治的手。

Sense.DEF: when you breathe in air quickly because you are having difficulty breathing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her breath came in shallow gasps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的呼吸浅而急促。

Sense.DEF: the time when someone is about to die, or when something is about to stop happening or existing
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某物的最后一口气
Sense.EXAMPLE: the last gasp of an industry in decline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个没落行业的最后一口气

Sense.DEF: the thing that you press with your foot to make a car go faster
a metal ring that gets hot when gas passes through it, used for cooking food
a place where you can buy petrol and oil for motor vehicles
a gassy drink has too much gas in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: This beer is really gassy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种啤酒含气实在太多。

Sense.DEF: relating to your stomach
Sense.EXAMPLE: gastric ulcers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胃溃疡

Sense.DEF: the acids in your stomach that break food into smaller parts
an illness that makes you vomit and gives you diarrhoea
a medical operation done to treat a fat person, in which the top part of the stomach is divided from the rest of it and connected to the middle of the small intestine
a band that is put around someone’s stomach, so that they feel full and eat less
Sense.TRAN: 胃束带﹐胃箍〔一种箍在腹部让人产生饱腹感而少吃东西的束带〕

Sense.DEF: an illness which makes the inside of your stomach become swollen, so that you feel a burning pain
a painful illness which makes your stomach and intestine become swollen
of or relating to the stomach and intestines
relating to the art of cooking good food or the pleasure of eating it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gastronomic delights of Thailand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰国美食

Sense.DEF: the art and science of cooking and eating good food
a pub that serves very good food
an engine in which a wheel of special blades is driven round at high speed by hot gases, producing a lot of power
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ship’s four gas turbine engines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船上的四个燃气涡轮发动机

Sense.DEF: a place where gas is made from coal so that it can be used to produce heat and energy
the part of a fence or outside wall that you can open and close so that you can enter or leave a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went through the gate into the orchard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们穿过大门进了果园。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wrought-iron gates of the palace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宫殿的锻铁大门

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I left the engine running and ran back to close the gate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没让发动机熄火﹐跑回去关上了大门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure that the back gate is locked, please.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 后门请一定锁好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children poured out of the school gates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们涌出校门。

Sense.DEF: the place where you leave an airport building to get on a plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: Air France flight 76 leaves from gate 6A.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法航76号航班从6A登机口起飞。

Subsense.DEF: the number of people who go in to see a sports event, especially a football match
Subsense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛﹐尤指足球赛的〕观众人数

Subsense.DEF: the amount of money that these people pay
Subsense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛﹐尤指足球赛的〕门票收入

Sense.DEF: to prevent a student from leaving a school as a punishment for behaving badly
Sense.TRAN: 〔作为对学生不良行为的处罚〕禁止…离校外出

Sense.DEF: used after the name of a place, person, or thing to give a name to an event involving dishonest behaviour by a politician or other public official …
Sense.TRAN: 门事件〔用于以地名﹑人名或事物名命名的政治丑闻〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Irangate when members of the US government sold weapons to Iran in exchange for the return of American hostages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊朗门事件〔美国政府官员向伊朗出售武器以换回美国人质的事件〕

Sense.DEF: a large sweet cake, often filled and decorated with cream, fruit, chocolate etc
to go to a party that you have not been invited to
Sense.TRAN: 不请自到﹐擅自参加〔未受邀请的聚会〕

Sense.DEF: an area of houses and sometimes also shops, tennis courts etc, where a fence or wall surrounds the area and the entrance is guarded
Sense.TRAN: 〔有栏或围墙且有门卫的〕封闭式社区

Sense.DEF: a small building next to the gate of a park or at the entrance to the land surrounding a big house
someone whose job is to open and close a gate, and to allow or not allow people to go through it
someone in an organization who has a lot of influence over what products the organization buys, who it buys them from etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构里有采购决定权的〕当家人

Sense.DEF: someone in an organization who tells customers or people with questions which people in the organization should be able to help them
one of two strong upright poles set in the ground to support a gate

Sense.LEXUNIT: between you, me, and the gatepost
Sense.DEF: spoken used to say that you are going to tell someone your opinion, but you want it to be a secret
the opening in a fence, wall etc that can be closed by a gate
Sense.TRAN: 〔栅栏或围墙上的〕出入口﹐大门口

Subsense.DEF: a place, especially a city, that you can go through in order to reach another much bigger place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: St. Louis is the gateway to the West.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣路易斯是通往西部的门户。

Subsense.DEF: a way of achieving something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: To me a home in the country is a gateway to happiness.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说﹐乡间有个家就是通往幸福之路。

Sense.DEF: a way of connecting two computer networks
Sense.TRAN: 〔连接两个计算机网络的〕网关

Sense.DEF: a drug such as cannabis which is not very dangerous, but which some people believe leads to the use of more dangerous drugs such as heroin
Sense.TRAN: 入门毒品﹐诱导性毒品〔如大麻﹐此类毒品危险性不是很大﹐但可能诱使人吸上海洛因等更危险的毒品〕

Sense.DEF: to come together and form a group, or to make people do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crowd gathered to watch the fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群人聚拢来围观打架。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of people gathered outside the embassy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大使馆外面聚集了数千人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gather round, everyone, so that you can see the screen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都聚过来﹐好看到屏幕。

Sense.EXAMPLE: During the air raids, we gathered the children around us and sang songs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空袭期间﹐我们把孩子们聚集在身边唱歌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could the bride’s family all gather together for a photo?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请新娘一家人聚在一起拍个照﹐好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dozens of photographers were gathered outside Jagger’s villa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好几十名摄影记者聚集在贾格尔的别墅外面。

Sense.DEF: to believe that something is true because of what you have seen or heard
Sense.EXAMPLE: You two know each other, I gather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你们俩认识。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gather you’ve had some problems with our sales department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我猜你和我们的销售部有过一些争执。

GramExa.PROPFORM: from what I can gather/as far as I can gather
GramExa.GLOSS: this is what I believe to be true
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s his niece, from what I can gather.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据我所知﹐她是他的侄女。

Sense.DEF: to get things from different places and put them together in one place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The researcher’s job is to gather information about people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位研究人员的工作是收集人们的信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had gathered 440,000 signatures to support their demand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们征集了44万人的签名来支持他们的要求。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Debbie gathered up the clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛比把衣服收起来。

Sense.DEF: to move faster, become stronger, get more support etc
Sense.TRAN: 加快速度/加大力量/增强势头等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cart gathered speed as it coasted down the hill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手推车沿着山坡下滑﹐速度越来越快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The international relief effort appears to be gathering momentum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际救灾行动的力度似乎在日益加强。

Sense.DEF: if something gathers dust, it is not being used
Sense.EXAMPLE: books just gathering dust on the shelf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书架上闲置的书本

Subsense.DEF: to pull material into small folds
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The skirt is gathered at the waist.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条裙子的腰部打了褶裥。

Subsense.DEF: to pull material or a piece of clothing closer to you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Moira gathered her skirts round her and climbed the steps.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫伊拉提起裙子登上台阶。

Sense.DEF: to prepare yourself for something you are going to do, especially something difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: I took a few moments to gather my thoughts before going into the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整理了一会儿思绪才进去开会。

Sense.DEF: to gradually become more cloudy or get darker
Sense.EXAMPLE: Storm cloudswere gathering so we hurried home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风云开始积聚﹐我们便急忙回家了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the evening’s gathering shadows
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 渐深的暮色

Sense.LEXUNIT: gather sb to you/gather sb up
Sense.DEF: to take someone into your arms and hold them in order to protect them or show them love
a small fold produced by pulling cloth together
someone who gathers something
Sense.EXAMPLE: information gatherers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息收集者

Sense.DEF: a meeting of a group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a select gathering of 20 or 30 people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二三十名特邀人士的聚会

Sense.DEF: the process of collecting information from many different places
a fold or group of folds in cloth
an alligator
doing or saying wrong or impolite things, especially because you do not know the right way to behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be gauche to mention the price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提及价格是不得体的。

Sense.DEF: a South American cowboy
clothes, colours etc that are gaudy are too bright and look cheap – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服﹑颜色等〕俗丽的﹐花哨的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: gaudy jewelry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俗丽的珠宝

Sense.DEF: an instrument for measuring the size or amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The petrol gauge is still on full.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽油表显示油箱依然是满的。

PIC.HEADING: GAUGE 计量器
PIC.PICCONTENT: pressure gauge / pressure gage AmE【美】压力计

Sense.DEF: a measurement of the width or thickness of something such as wire or metal
Sense.TRAN: 〔电线等的〕直径﹔〔金属等的〕厚度﹐宽度
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 27-gauge needle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根27号针
Sense.EXAMPLE: heavy gauge black polythene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厚规格黑色聚乙烯塑料

Sense.DEF: something that helps you make a judgment about a person or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Retail sales are a gauge of consumer spending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 零售额是衡量消费支出的一个标准。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tests will give parents a gauge of how their children are doing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些考试可以让家长对孩子的学习状况有一个衡量的尺度。

Sense.DEF: the distance between the lines of a railway or between the wheels of a train
Sense.EXAMPLE: a standard gaugerailway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 标准轨距的铁路

GramExa.GLOSS: with more/less than the standard distance between the rails

Sense.DEF: the width of the barrel of a gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 12-gauge shotgun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 12号口径的猎枪

Sense.DEF: to judge how people feel about something or what they are likely to do
Sense.TRAN: 判定﹐判断〔人们的情感或意图〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to gauge what the other party’s next move will be.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难判定对方的下一步行动是什么。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I looked at Chris, trying to gauge his reaction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着克里斯﹐琢磨着他会作出什么样的反应。

Sense.DEF: to measure or calculate something by using a particular instrument or method
Sense.TRAN: 〔用某种仪器或方法〕测量﹐测出
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thermostat will gauge the temperature and control the heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恒温器可测量温度并控制热量。

Sense.DEF: very thin and pale, especially because of illness or continued worry
Sense.TRAN: 〔因生病或长期烦忧〕瘦削的﹐憔悴的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the old man’s gaunt face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人那瘦削的脸庞

Sense.DEF: a building, mountain etc that is gaunt looks very plain and unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑山等〕平淡无奇的﹐难看的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gaunt cathedral
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难看的大教堂

Sense.DEF: to invite someone to fight or compete over a disagreement
to accept the invitation to fight or compete over a disagreement
to be criticized or attacked by a lot of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The foreign secretary ran the gauntlet of demonstrators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交大臣受到了游行示威者的围攻。

Sense.DEF: a long glove that covers someone’s wrist and protects their hand, for example in a factory
Sense.TRAN: 〔工厂等用的〕长手套﹐防护手套

Sense.DEF: a glove covered in metal, used for protection by soldiers in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时士兵戴的〕铁手套﹐金属手套

Sense.DEF: very thin transparent material with very small holes in it
thin cotton with very small holes in it that is used for tying around a wound
Sense.EXAMPLE: His hands were wrapped in gauze bandages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的两只手包着纱布。

Sense.DEF: a material made of thin threads of metal or plastic
Sense.EXAMPLE: They covered the tubes with wire gauze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用铁丝网把管子裹起来。

Sense.DEF: the past tense of give
a small hammer that the person in charge of a meeting, court of law, auction etc hits on a table in order to get people’s attention
Sense.TRAN: 〔会议主席﹑法官﹑拍卖人等用的〕小木槌

Sense.DEF: used in writing to represent the word ‘God’ when it is said in this way as an expression of surprise, fear etc
Sense.TRAN: 天哪〔书面语中用来代替God一词﹐表示惊讶﹑恐惧等〕

Sense.DEF: to look at something for a long time, in a way that looks stupid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t just stand there gawking at those girls!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别站在那儿盯着那些女孩傻看！

Sense.DEF: someone who is gawky moves or behaves in an awkward way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gawky long-legged teenager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个举止笨拙的长腿少年

Sense.DEF: to look at something for a long time, especially with your mouth open because you are surprised

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was carried out on a stretcher, with everyone gawping at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被人用担架抬了出来﹐大家都惊讶地张大了嘴盯着我看。

Sense.DEF: if someone, especially a man, is gay, they are sexually attracted to people of the same sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gay communityin London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦的同性恋群体
Sense.EXAMPLE: gay men and lesbians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同性恋男女
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gay bar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同性恋者酒吧
Sense.EXAMPLE: a campaigner for gay rights equal treatment for gay people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同性恋者权利的倡导者

Sense.DEF: bright or attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: gay colours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲜艳的色彩

Sense.DEF: cheerful and excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt excited and quite gay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到兴奋而快活。

Sense.DEF: in a careless way, without careful thought
someone who is homosexual, especially a man
your natural ability to know whether a man that you meet or see is gay sexually attracted to people of the same sex, based on your feelings rather than what you already know about the person
Sense.TRAN: 同性恋雷达〔指识别他人是否是同性恋者的本能〕

Sense.DEF: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nell was still gazing out of the window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 内尔依旧凝视着窗外。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Patrick sat gazing into space looking straight in front, not at any particular person or thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克坐着﹐茫然地看着前方。

Sense.DEF: a long steady look
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt embarrassed under his steady gaze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他持久的注视让她觉得很不好意思。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ellen smiled uncomfortably and lowered her gaze.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦很不自在地笑笑﹐垂下了目光。

GramExa.GLOSS: look directly at someone who is looking at you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t dare to meet her gaze.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不敢迎视她的目光。

Sense.DEF: a small building with open sides in a garden, where you can sit and look at the view
a type of small deer, which jumps very gracefully and has large beautiful eyes
an official newspaper, especially one from the government giving important lists of people who have been employed by them etc
used in the names of some newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 报〔用于某些报纸的名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ‘Phoenix Gazette’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《凤凰城报》

Sense.DEF: a list of names of places, printed as a dictionary or as a list at the end of a book of maps
Sense.TRAN: 地名词典﹔〔地图册后的〕地名索引

Sense.DEF: an extremely large number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have a gazillion things to do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一大堆事情要做。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: gazillions of dollars
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的美元

Sense.DEF: if you are gazumped, the person who is selling you a house sells it to another person who offers them more money
Sense.TRAN: 〔卖房者在房价议定后〕抬价改售他人﹐悔价
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were gazumped at the last minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在最后一刻遭遇卖家悔价。

Sense.DEF: if you are gazundered, someone who has agreed to buy your house says that they will only buy it for less than the amount originally agreed
Sense.TRAN: 〔卖房者在房价议定后〕被压价﹐遭遇买方悔价
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Great Britain 大不列颠
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= gigabyte or gigabytes 千兆字节

Sense.DEF: the serious crime of attacking someone and injuring them
an examination in a range of subjects, formerly done by students in schools in England and Wales at o level and a level.In 1988, GCE O levels were replaced by GCSEs.
Sense.TRAN: 〔英格兰和威尔士的〕普通教育证书〔分为普通级和高级﹐普通级于1988年被普通中等教育证书取代〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: two GCE A level passes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两科高级普通教育证书考试通过

Sense.DEF: a British government organization based in Cheltenham, which collects information about countries that may be enemies. This is done especially by listening to radio broadcasts and telephone calls from all over the world.
Sense.TRAN: 英国政府通信总部〔位于切尔滕纳姆的英国政府情报机构﹐主要通过监听世界各地的电台广播和电话收集潜在敌对国的情报〕

Sense.DEF: an examination in a range of subjects, done by students in schools in England and Wales, usually at the age of 15 or 16
Sense.TRAN: 〔英格兰和威尔士的〕普通中等教育证书

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Adam took his GCSEs last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当去年参加了普通中等教育证书考试。
普通中等教育证书考试/课程/课程作业/考试成绩等

Sense.DEF: the total value of all goods and services produced in a country, in one year, except for income received from abroad
the machinery in a vehicle such as a car, truck, or bicycle that you use to go comfortably at different speeds
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mountain bike had 18 gears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的山地自行车有18挡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andy drove cautiously along in third gear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安迪挂着三挡小心地行驶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does this thing have a reverse gear?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这玩意儿有倒挡吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any cyclist can climb a difficult hill; you just change gear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁都能骑上难爬的山坡﹐只要换挡就行了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t turn off the engine while you’re still in gear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还挂着挡的时候不要关发动机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good habit to take the car out of gear while you’re at a stoplight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等红灯时换空挡的习惯很好。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the amount of effort and energy that someone is using in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种情形下所花的〕精力﹐努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: During this period, Japan’s export industries were in top gear were as active as they could be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个时期﹐日本的出口工业如日中天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Republican’s propaganda machine moved into high gear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党的宣传机器开足了马力。

GramExa.GLOSS: increase the level of effort
GramExa.EXAMPLE: United stepped up a gear in the second half.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联队在下半场加强了拼抢。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something in a different way, especially using more or less energy or effort
Sense.TRAN: 改变做事方式〔尤指改变力度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boss expects us to be able to change gear just like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老板希望我们能够随时随地调整工作节奏。

Sense.DEF: a set of equipment or tools you need for a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某种活动的〕一套设备[工具]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s crazy about photography – he’s got all the gear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对摄影很着迷——所有的器材他都有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll need some camping gear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要带些宿营设备。

Sense.DEF: a set of clothes that you wear for a particular occasion or activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔为某个场合或活动而穿的〕成套服装
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bring your rain gear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带上你的雨具。
Sense.EXAMPLE: police in riot gear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着防暴服的警察

Sense.DEF: a piece of machinery that performs a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: the landing gear of a plane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机的起落架
Sense.EXAMPLE: heavy lifting gear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重型起重机

Sense.DEF: a word meaning illegal drugs, used by people who take drugs
used to tell someone to hurry
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better get your ass in gear – you’re late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好快点——要迟到了。

Sense.DEF: to be organized in a way that is suitable for a particular purpose or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The typical career pattern was geared to men whose wives didn’t work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种典型的职业模式是为妻子不工作的男性设计的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The course curriculum is geared to span three years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程设计为三年学完。

Sense.DEF: to prepare for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The organization is gearing up for a convention in May.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个机构正在筹备5月份的一个会议。

GramExa.PROPFORM: gear up/be geared up to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fast food restaurants are geared up to serve thousands of people daily.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 快餐店每天可以接待数千顾客。

Sense.DEF: the system of gears in a vehicle
the relationship between the amount of money that a company is worth and the amount that it owes in debts
Sense.TRAN: 资产负债比率﹐杠杆比率

Sense.DEF: a metal rod that you move in order to control the gears of a vehicle
a gear lever
a gear lever
a type of small lizard
used to show that you are surprised or annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 哎呀﹐哇〔用来表示惊讶或生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aw, gee, Mom, do we have to go?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐妈妈﹐我们非去不可吗？

Sense.DEF: to encourage someone to try harder
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team needs a captain who can gee them up a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个球队需要有个能够推他们一把的队长。

Sense.DEF: used to tell a horse to go faster
a horse – used especially by children or when you are talking to children
someone who is not popular because they wear unfashionable clothes, do not know how to behave in social situations, or do strange things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a computer geek
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑迷

Sense.DEF: the plural of goose
used to show that you are surprised or annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 哎呀﹐哇〔用来表示惊讶或生气〕

Sense.DEF: very good, in a way that is impressive and exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: gee-whiz graphics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝对棒的图像

Sense.DEF: another spelling of jeez
a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know this geezer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认识这个家伙。

Sense.DEF: an old man
an instrument that finds and measures radioactivity
Sense.TRAN: 盖革计数器〔探测放射性的一种仪器〕

Sense.DEF: eight of the most important industrial nations in the world (Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Russia, and the US) who meet regularly to discuss the world economic situation
Sense.TRAN: 八国集团〔指英﹑加﹑法﹑德﹑意﹑日﹑俄﹑美八个主要工业国〕

Sense.DEF: a Japanese woman who is trained in the art of dancing, singing, and providing entertainment, especially for men
a thick wet substance that is used in beauty or cleaning products
Sense.TRAN: 〔美容或清洁产品中的〕凝胶﹐冻胶
Sense.EXAMPLE: hair gel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发胶
Sense.EXAMPLE: shower gel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沐浴露

Sense.DEF: if a thought, plan etc gels, it becomes clearer or more definite
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t start writing until the idea has gelled in your mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脑子里有了明确的想法后再动笔写。

Sense.DEF: if two or more people gel, they start working well together as a group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He did not gel with Chapman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和查普曼没能顺利合作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: After two days, the group gelled into a team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两天之后﹐这群人就组成了一支团结的团队。

Sense.DEF: if a liquid gels, it becomes firmer or thicker
to put gel into your hair

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上过发胶的头发

Sense.DEF: used to represent the word ‘girl’, when it is said in this way
a clear substance obtained from boiled animal bones, used for making jelly
in a state between solid and liquid, like a gel
to remove the testicles of a horse
a horse that has been gelded
Sense.TRAN: 阉割过的公马﹐去势的马

Sense.DEF: very cold
a powerful explosive
Sense.TRAN: 葛里炸药〔一种烈性炸药〕

Sense.DEF: a beautiful stone that has been cut into a special shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: precious gems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍贵的宝石

Sense.DEF: something that is very special or beautiful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every single ad in the campaign has been a gem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次活动中的每一个广告都是精品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Fortune is a tiny gem of a theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时运剧院是一座小巧精致的剧院。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: little gems of advice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 金玉良言

Sense.DEF: a very helpful or special person
Sense.TRAN: 难能可贵的人﹔特别好的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben, you’re a real gem!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本﹐真是难得有你这样的好人！

Sense.DEF: the third sign of the zodiac, represented by twins, which some people believe affects the character and life of people born between May 22 and June 21
someone who was born between May 22 and June 21
Sense.TRAN: 属双子座的人〔即5月22日至6月21日之间出生的人〕

Sense.DEF: information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has all the gen on cheap flights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对各种廉价航班信息了如指掌。

Sense.DEF: to learn a lot of information about something for a particular purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gen up on the company’s product before the interview.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试前全面了解一下该公司的产品。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= General 将军
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gen. Philippe Morillon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普·莫里永将军

Sense.DEF: a French police officer
the fact of being male or female
Sense.EXAMPLE: people of the same gender
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同性别的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Discrimination on grounds of race or gender is forbidden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严禁种族歧视和性别歧视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There may be gender differences in attitudes to paid work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对待有偿劳动的态度可能存在着性别差异。
Sense.EXAMPLE: traditional gender roles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的性别角色

GramExa.EXAMPLE: in books
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 书本中的性别偏见

Sense.EXAMPLE: toys that do not reinforce gender stereotypes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不强化性别模式化观念的玩具
Sense.EXAMPLE: a science fiction story dealing with gender issues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以性别问题为题材的科幻故事

Sense.DEF: males or females, considered as a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: differences between the genders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两性差别

Subsense.DEF: the system in some languages of marking words such as nouns, adjectives, and pronouns as being masculine, feminine, or neuter
Subsense.TRAN: 性〔指某些语言中名词﹑形容词和代词分为阳性﹑阴性或中性的语法体系〕

Subsense.DEF: a group such as feminine into which words are divided in this system

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves or dresses in a way typical of the opposite sex
Sense.TRAN: 性别扭曲者〔指举止或穿着不符合自身性别特点的人〕

Sense.DEF: when men and women are treated differently, in a way that is unfair
relating only to males or only to females
Sense.TRAN: 只与特定性别有关的﹔只适用于一个性别的
Sense.EXAMPLE: gender-specific language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有性别限定的用语

Sense.DEF: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents
Sense.EXAMPLE: human genes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类基因
Sense.EXAMPLE: the genes that regulate cell division
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制细胞分裂的基因

Sense.DEF: the study of the history of families
a drawing or description that explains how each person in a family is related to the others

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a useful source of genealogical information

Sense.DEF: the act of finding out the position of one or more genes on a chromosome the part of every living cell that contains genes
all of the genes available to a particular species
the plural of genus
describing or relating to only the main features or parts of something, not the details
Sense.EXAMPLE: a general introduction to computing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机应用概论
Sense.EXAMPLE: I skimmed through it to get a general impression of the text.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把文章浏览了一下﹐让自己有个大致的了解。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have a general idea of what I want to express.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对自己想要表达什么有个大致的想法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke in general terms about greater competitiveness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大致地说了说要加强竞争力。

Subsense.DEF: usually or in most situations
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In general, about 10% of the candidates are eventually offered positions.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般说来﹐大约10%的申请者最终能获得职位。

Subsense.DEF: used when talking about the whole of a situation, group, or thing, rather than specific parts of it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a feeling of dissatisfaction with life in general
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对生活总体的不满
Subsense.EXAMPLE: These policies are unpopular with politicians and people in general.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些政策在政治家和老百姓中普遍不受欢迎。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re trying to raise awareness about the environment in general and air pollution in particular.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在努力提高人们总体的环境意识﹐尤其是对空气污染的意识。

Sense.DEF: involving the whole of a situation, group, or thing, rather than specific parts of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has been a general decline in standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道德水准普遍下降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ways to improve your general health
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全面提高身体素质的方法
