Sense.TRAN: 看上去/感觉有病[烦恼﹐不高兴]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you all right? You look ghastly!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没事吧？脸色这么差！

Sense.DEF:
melted butter made from the milk of a cow or
buffalo
, used in Indian cooking
Sense.TRAN: 〔印度烹饪中用牛奶或水牛奶制成的〕酥油﹐奶油

Sense.DEF:
a small type of
cucumber
that has been preserved in
vinegar
to make a type of
pickle
a part of a city where people of a particular race or class, especially people who are poor, live separately from the rest of the people in the city. This word is sometimes considered offensive.
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常条件很差的〕少数民族聚居区﹐贫民区〔有时被认为具有冒犯性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: unemployment in the ghetto
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫民区里的失业问题

Sense.DEF: a part of a city where Jews were forced to live in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Warsaw ghetto
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华沙的犹太人居住区

Sense.DEF:
a large radio and
tape recorder
that can be carried around, and is often played very loudly in public places. This word is sometimes considered offensive in American English.
Sense.TRAN: 大型手提式收录机〔在美国英语中有时被认为具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: to force people to live in a ghetto
Sense.TRAN: 强迫…居住在聚居区[贫民区]

Sense.DEF: to make part of a town become a ghetto
the spirit of a dead person that some people think they can feel or see in a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ghost of Old Tom Morris
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老汤姆·莫里斯的鬼魂

Sense.EXAMPLE: They say the young girl’s ghost still haunts often appears in the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说那个少女的鬼魂依旧在那房子里出没。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked as if he’d seen a ghost he looked very frightened .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去像见到了鬼似的。

Sense.DEF: the memory or effect of someone or something bad that lived, existed, or happened in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ghost of poverty still haunts the lives of people who lived through the Depression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫困依然阴魂不散﹐影响着那些经历过经济大萧条的人们。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the ghost of a smile/sound etc
Sense.DEF: a smile etc that is so slight you are not sure it happened
Sense.TRAN: 隐约的一丝微笑/一点声音等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ghost of a smile flitted across her sad features.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她忧愁的面容上隐隐掠过一丝微笑。

Sense.DEF: a second image that is not clear on a television or computer screen
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或计算机屏幕上的〕重像﹐重影

Subsense.DEF: if a machine gives up the ghost, it does not work any more and cannot be repaired – used humorously
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, my car’s just given up the ghost.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可惜我的汽车刚刚报废了。

Subsense.DEF: to die

Sense.DEF: not even a slight chance of doing something, or of something happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: They don’t stand a ghost of a chance of winning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们根本没有获胜的希望。

Sense.DEF:
to write something as a
ghost writer
slightly frightening and seeming to be related to ghosts or spirits
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ghostly figure in a white dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幽灵似的穿着白裙子的身影

Sense.DEF: a story about ghosts that is intended to frighten people
a town that used to have a lot of people living and working in it, but now has very few or none

a small train ride at a
funfair
, that is designed to frighten you by taking you through a dark place full of
skeletons and things that jump out at you
Sense.TRAN: 魔鬼列车﹐幽灵列车〔游乐场里的一种小火车﹐载着游客在黑暗中行驶﹐到处都有骷髅和怪物向他们身上扑〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is paid to write a book or story for another person, who then says it is their own work

an evil spirit in stories that takes bodies from
graves place in the ground where dead people are buried
and eats them
Sense.TRAN: 食尸鬼〔传说中从坟墓里挖尸体吃的魔鬼〕

Sense.DEF: someone who gets pleasure from unpleasant things such as accidents that shock other people
the place that a large military operation is controlled from
a soldier in the US army, especially during the Second World War
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指第二次世界大战时的〕美国兵

Sense.DEF: extremely big, and much bigger than other things of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: a giant electronics company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家电子产品巨头
Sense.EXAMPLE: a giant tortoise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨龟

Sense.DEF: an extremely tall strong man, who is often bad and cruel, in children’s stories
a very large successful company
Sense.EXAMPLE: the German chemicals giant, BASF
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国化工巨头巴斯夫公司

Sense.DEF: a very big man, animal, or plant
someone who is very good at doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Miles Davis, truly one of the giants of jazz
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈尔斯·戴维斯﹐一位真正的爵士乐大师

Sense.DEF: an extremely tall strong woman, who is often bad and cruel, in children’s stories
a person, sports team etc that defeats a much stronger opponent
Sense.TRAN: 巨人杀手〔打败强大对手的人﹑运动队等〕

Sense.DEF:
a
panda 1
to speak quickly in a way that is difficult to understand, especially because you are very frightened or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因害怕或受惊而〕说话急促不清

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘It was her,’ said Ruth, gibbering with fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “就是她。”露丝吓得话也说不清楚了。

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: someone who is very shocked or frightened

Sense.DEF: something you write or say that has no meaning, or is very difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re talking gibberish !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在胡扯！

Sense.DEF:
a wooden frame on which criminals were
hanged in the past with a rope around their neck
a small animal like a monkey, with long arms and no tail, that lives in trees in Asia

another spelling of
jibe

organs such as the heart and
liver
, that you remove from a chicken or other bird before you cook it
feeling slightly sick and unable to balance, because everything seems to be moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greg stared down from the seventh floor and began to feel giddy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格从七楼望下去﹐开始觉得头晕了。

Sense.DEF: feeling silly, happy, and excited, or showing this feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sheila felt giddy with excitement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉激动得忘乎所以。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you have a lot of success
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although she had been quite a successful model, she had never reached the giddy heights of the Paris fashion world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她虽然是一个很成功的模特﹐但是从来没有到达巴黎时装界那个令人眩晕的顶峰。

Sense.DEF: silly and not interested in serious things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fiona’s very pretty but a bit giddy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲奥娜很漂亮﹐但是有点轻浮。

Sense.DEF:
a type of computer
file
that contains images and is used on the Internet
Sense.TRAN: GIF文件﹐图形交换格式文件

Sense.DEF: something that you give someone, for example to thank them or because you like them, especially on a special occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earrings were a gift from my aunt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这副耳环是我姑姑送给我的礼物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a generous gift of £50
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份50英镑的厚礼

Sense.EXAMPLE: The clock was given as a retirement gift when he left the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个钟表是他退休离开警局时收到的礼物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: expensive wedding gifts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昂贵的结婚礼物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enjoy a free gift with any purchase of $20 or more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 购物满20美元奉送礼品一份。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This excellent cookbook would make an ideal gift for anyone just going away to college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本精美的烹饪书送给要离家上大学的人是很好的礼物。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, especially in British English, people usually say present rather than gift.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐尤其是在英国英语中﹐人们一般说present﹐而不说gift
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: These were a present from my boyfriend.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我男朋友送的礼物。

Subsense.DEF: a natural ability

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a gift for languages
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言天赋
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was a kind man, with a gift for forming lasting friendships.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一个好人﹐天生善于建立持久的友谊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has the rare gift of being able to laugh at herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有那种难得的能够自嘲的本领。

Subsense.DEF: an ability that is given to you by God

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was said to have possessed the gift of prophecy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说他有预言的能力。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: the use of spiritual gifts
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通灵能力的运用

Sense.DEF: something that is easier or cheaper than you expected
Sense.TRAN: 比预料容易[便宜]的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: The third goal was an absolute gift.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第三个进球简直不费吹灰之力。

Sense.DEF: something good you receive or something good that happens to you, even though you might not deserve it
Sense.EXAMPLE: This opportunity was a gift from God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个机会是上天的恩赐。

Sense.DEF: an ability to speak confidently and to persuade people to do what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo has always had the gift of the gab .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔一向口才很好。

Sense.DEF: if something is in your gift, you have the power to decide who it should be given to
Sense.TRAN: 决定权在某人手里﹐由某人决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: All appointments to military and administrative posts were in the gift of the King.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有军职和行政职务的任命全由国王决定。

Sense.LEXUNIT: never/don’t look a gift horse in the mouth

having a natural ability to do one or more things extremely well

Sense.DEF:
a

Sense.DEF: to laugh quickly, quietly, and in a high voice, because something is funny or because you are nervous or embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you can’t stop giggling you’ll have to leave the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你再咯咯地笑个不停﹐就给我离开屋子。

Sense.DEF: a quick, quiet, high-sounding laugh
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Catch me if you can,’ she said with a giggle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你来抓我呀。”她咯咯地笑着说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vicky suppressed a nervous giggle .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薇姬忍住了她紧张的傻笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked so ridiculous I got the giggles started to giggle .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去太滑稽了﹐逗得我咯咯直笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soon the whole group had the giggles .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快﹐组里所有的人都咯咯笑了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Margaret was seized by a fit of the giggles she could not stop giggling .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛格丽特忍不住咯咯笑了起来。

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone start giggling

Sense.DEF: something that you think is fun to do that will not hurt anyone or anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go on, it’ll be a giggle!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐很好玩的！

Sense.DEF: giggling a lot

Sense.DEF: a man who is paid by a rich woman, especially an older woman, to have sex with her
to cover something with a thin layer of gold or with something that looks like gold

Sense.DEF: to make something look as if it is covered in gold

Sense.DEF: to spoil something by trying to improve it when it is already good enough
one of the organs on the sides of a fish through which it breathes
completely full

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期一﹐酒吧里人满为患。

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring liquid, equal to 1/4
pint
. In Britain this is 0.14 litres, and in the US it is 0.12 litres.

a

or
share
that is

covered with gilt

gilt-edged
stocks
or

do not give you much
interest additional money
but are considered very safe as they are sold mainly by governments
a tool that is used to make small holes in wood so that you can put screws in easily

Sense.DEF: if someone is gimlet-eyed, or has gimlet eyes, they look at things very hard and notice every detail
Sense.TRAN: 目光敏锐的/敏锐的目光

Sense.DEF: a way of writing the non-standard spoken short form of ‘give me’
Sense.TRAN: 给我〔give me非标准略读的书面写法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gimme the ball!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把球给我！

Sense.DEF: something that is so easy to do or succeed at that you do not even have to try

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次获胜对纽约扬基队来说轻而易举。

Sense.DEF: a trick or something unusual that you do to make people notice someone or something – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 引人注意的花招﹐噱头〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: advertising gimmicks

an alcoholic drink made with gin and
tonic a special type of bitter-tasting water
, served with ice and a thin piece of
lemon
or
lime
Sense.TRAN: 金汤力﹝加奎宁水的杜松子酒﹐一种常见的酒精饮料﹐饮用时加冰和一片柠檬或来檬〕

Sense.DEF: a root with a very strong hot taste, or the powder made from this root, that is used in cooking
the plant that this root comes from
a bright orange-brown colour
hair or fur that is ginger is bright orange-brown in colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ginger cat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 姜黄色的猫

Sense.DEF: flavoured with ginger
to make something more exciting
a non-alcoholic drink that tastes of ginger and is often mixed with alcohol
a non-alcoholic drink with a strong taste of ginger
Sense.TRAN: 姜汁啤酒〔一种有姜味但不含酒精的饮料〕

Sense.DEF:
a heavy sweet cake or a
biscuit
with ginger in it

GramExa.GLOSS: a piece of gingerbread in the shape of a man

Sense.DEF: complicated decorations on the outside of a house, especially near the roof
Sense.TRAN: 〔房子外墙﹐尤指屋顶附近〕复杂的装饰

Sense.DEF: a group of people within a political party or organization who try to persuade the other members to support their ideas
Sense.TRAN: 〔政党或组织中的〕活跃分子集团﹐积极派

Sense.DEF: if you move gingerly, or touch something gingerly, you do it in a slow careful way, because you are afraid it will be dangerous or painful
Sense.TRAN: 〔因害怕有危险或被弄痛〕小心翼翼地[的]﹐轻手轻脚地[的]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gingerly felt his way along the dark tunnel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在漆黑的隧道里小心翼翼地摸索着前行。

Sense.DEF:
a hard
biscuit
with ginger in it
gingery hair or fur is bright orange-brown in colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: his gingery beard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他姜黄色的胡子

Sense.DEF: cotton cloth that has a pattern of small white and coloured squares on it
Sense.TRAN: 白色和彩色方格相间的棉布
Sense.EXAMPLE: a red and white gingham tablecloth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红白相间的格子桌布

Sense.DEF:
a medical condition in which your
gums
are red, swollen, and painful
extremely large

a type of
rummy card game for two people
medicine made from the root of a Chinese plant, that some people think keeps you young and healthy

another spelling of
gypsy
a tall African animal with a very long neck and legs and dark spots on its yellow-brown fur
to get ready to do something difficult – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 准备从事〔艰苦的工作﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: if you gird for something, or gird yourself for something, especially something difficult, you prepare for it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By midsummer both police and protesters were girding for confrontation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了仲夏的时候﹐警方和抗议者都做好了对峙的准备。

Sense.DEF: a strong beam, made of iron or steel, that supports a floor, roof, or bridge

a piece of women’s underwear which fits tightly around her stomach, bottom, and
hips
and makes her look thinner
to surround something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the formal garden that girdled the house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环绕屋子布置井然的花园

Sense.DEF: a female child
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both boys and girls can apply to join the choir.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩和女孩均可申请加入合唱团。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve known Mollie ever since I was a little girl.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还是个小女孩的时候就认识莫莉了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The patient was a girl of 12.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 患者是一个12岁的小姑娘。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Girls! Please be quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 姑娘们！请安静。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a teenage girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十几岁的女孩

Sense.DEF: a daughter
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have two girls and a boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有两个女孩和一个男孩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How old’s your little girl sb’s young daughter now?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的小女儿现在多大了？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Time for bed, girls!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该睡觉了﹐姑娘们！

Sense.DEF: a word meaning a woman, especially a young woman, which is considered offensive by some women
Sense.TRAN: 年轻女子﹐姑娘〔有些女性认为具有冒犯性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll invite some of the girls from the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会邀请办公室里的一些姑娘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve’s married to a lovely Dutch girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫娶了一个可爱的荷兰姑娘。

Sense.DEF: a group of women who are friends and often go out together
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going out with the girls tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天晚上要和姐妹们出去。

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to a female animal, especially a dog, cat, or horse
Sense.TRAN: 姑娘〔对雌性狗﹑猫﹑马等的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bring me the stick. Good girl!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把棍子给我拿来。真是好姑娘！

Sense.DEF: used by a woman when she is speaking to another woman she knows well
Sense.TRAN: 姐们儿〔女性对另一相熟女子的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, girl. What’s up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐姐们儿﹐怎么了？

Sense.DEF: used to encourage a girl or woman, or to say that you agree with what she is saying
Sense.TRAN: 对了﹐姑娘！〔表示鼓励或赞同〕

Sense.DEF: a word for a woman who you are having a romantic relationship with
used by an older person when speaking to a girl or woman who is younger than they are, or when they are annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 我的姑娘〔年长者对年轻女性的称呼或气恼时的用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Listen to me, my girl!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听我说﹐我的姑娘！

Sense.DEF: a young woman who works in a factory, shop, office etc
Sense.TRAN: 工厂女工/商店女店员/女办事员等

Sense.DEF: a woman servant
a girl or woman worker who does several different jobs in an office
a girl or woman that you are having a romantic relationship with
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s never had a girlfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来没有交过女朋友。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lives in Chicago with his girlfriend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在芝加哥和女朋友住在一起。

GramExa.PROPFORM: split up/break up with your girlfriend
GramExa.GLOSS: stop having a romantic relationship

Sense.EXAMPLE: one of my ex-girlfriends former girlfriends
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的一个前女友
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t have a steady girlfriend one you have a long relationship with .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那时没有固定的女友。

Sense.DEF: a woman or girl’s female friend
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s out with one of her girlfriends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跟她的一个女伴出去了。

Sense.DEF: the period of her life when a woman is a girl
a magazine etc with pictures of women with no clothes on
Sense.TRAN: 登有女子裸体照的杂志/日历等

Sense.DEF: a girl or woman who is girlie behaves in a silly way, for example by pretending to be shy or always thinking about how she looks
Sense.TRAN: 〔女人〕行为愚蠢的﹐矫揉造作的

Sense.DEF: suitable only for girls rather than men or boys
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pink’s a girlie colour!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粉红色是只适合女孩子的颜色！

Sense.DEF: an offensive word used by men when talking to a woman who they think is less sensible or intelligent than a man
Sense.TRAN: 傻妞〔冒犯语﹐男人认为女人不如他们理智或聪明时使用〕

Sense.DEF: behaving like a girl, looking like a girl, or suitable for a girl
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peal of girlish laughter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵少女般的笑声

Sense.DEF: the idea that women should take control over their own lives or situations
Sense.TRAN: 女权〔指女性应该掌控自己的生活或处境〕

Sense.DEF: the social or political influence that women have

a
scout member of the Girl Scouts Association in the US

another spelling of
girlie 1
a cheque paid by the government to someone who is unemployed

a system of
banking
in Britain in which a central computer can send money from one
bank account
to another electronically
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国银行的〕直接转账计算机系统

Sense.DEF:
a past participle of
gird
the size of something or someone large when you measure around them rather than measuring their height
Sense.EXAMPLE: the enormous girth of the tree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那棵树巨大的干围
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a tall man, of considerable girth he was fat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他个子很高﹐腰身粗圆。

Sense.DEF:
a band of leather which is passed tightly around the middle of a horse to keep a
saddle
or load firmly in position
the main idea and meaning of what someone has said or written

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gist of his argument is that full employment is impossible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他论述的主旨是﹐全面就业是不可能的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry about all the details as long as you get the gist understand the main meaning of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要去管各个细节﹐只要理解主要意思就行了。

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for an unpleasant and annoying person, especially a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: You miserable git!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个讨厌的死鬼！

Sense.DEF: to let someone have something as a present, or to provide something for someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What did Bob give you for your birthday?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你生日鲍勃送了你什么？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Researchers were given a £10,000 grant to continue their work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员得到一万英镑的经费以继续他们的研究。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got some old diaries that my grandmother gave me years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有几本旧日记本﹐是多年前祖母给我的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a ring which was given to him by his mother
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲送给他的一枚戒指

Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t steal it! Maria gave it to me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是偷的！是玛丽亚给我的！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people are willing to give to charity .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人都愿意向慈善事业捐款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The situation is now desperate, so please give generously .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在情况危急﹐请大家慷慨解囊。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘give to someone something’: He gave me a card (NOT 不说 He gave to me a card). 他送给我一张卡片。 | They gave a prize to the best chef (NOT 不说 They gave to the best chef a prize). 他们给最佳大厨颁了奖。

Sense.DEF: to put something in someone’s hand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Give me the letter, please.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把信给我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He poured some wine into a glass and gave it to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他倒了一杯酒递给她。

Sense.DEF: to allow or make it possible for someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He finally gave us permission to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最后还是允许我们离开。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: These meetings give everyone a chance to express their opinions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些会议给每个人发表意见的机会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Students are given the freedom to choose their own topics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生有选择课题的自主权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Language gives us the ability to communicate at a much higher level than any other animal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言赋予我们远远高于其他动物的交流能力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women were given the vote in the early 1900’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪初﹐妇女获得了选举权。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was given absolute control over all recruitment decisions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的人事录用决策她都有绝对的控制权。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This bill will give more power to local authorities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项议案将给予地方政府更大的权力。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone information or details about something, or to tell someone what they should do
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave me some information on university courses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向我提供了一些有关大学课程的信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My secretary will be able to give you more details.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的秘书会告诉你更详细的情况。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me give you some advice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你一些建议吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She certainly likes giving orders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她确实爱发号施令。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were given strict instructions not to tell anyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们得到严格指示不要告诉任何人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you give me directions to the station tell me how to go there ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能告诉我去车站怎么走吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave the following example .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他举了下面的例子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may have to give evidence in court tell a court about what you have seen or know to be true .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可能需要出庭作证。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave a disturbing account of the murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对凶案发生经过的描述令人困惑。

Sense.DEF: to do something by making a movement with your hand, face, body etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She gave a little frown.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻轻地皱了皱眉头。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Joel gave me a smile as I walked in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走进去的时候乔尔对我笑了笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her a big hug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给了她一个大大的拥抱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave a wave of his hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挥了挥手。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t move until I give the signal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有发信号你就别动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She picked up the envelope and gave it a shake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿起信封晃了晃。

Sense.DEF: to make a speech, perform a piece of music etc for a group of people
Sense.TRAN: 发表〔讲话等〕﹔举行〔演出等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s giving a talk on early Roman pottery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要作一个关于古罗马早期陶器的报告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They gave one of their best performances to date.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的这次演出是迄今为止最好的几场之一。

Sense.DEF: to make someone have a feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave us quite a shock .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让我们十分震惊。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The course has given me a lot more confidence .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程使我增加了不少信心。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His job did not give him much sense of fulfilment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的工作没有给他多少成就感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their music has given pleasure to a lot of people over the years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多少年来﹐他们的音乐给许多人带来了快乐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep the noise down – you’re giving me a headache!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别那么大声——我头都痛了！

Sense.DEF: to make someone have problems

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new software has given us quite a few problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新软件给我们带来不少问题。

Sense.DEF: to infect someone with the same illness that you have

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t come too close – I don’t want you to give me your cold!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别离我太近——我可不想让你把感冒传给我！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s very unlikely a doctor could give HIV to a patient.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生把艾滋病病毒传染给病人的可能性极小。

Sense.DEF: to organize a social event such as a party
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re giving a small party for dad’s birthday next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下个星期爸爸生日﹐我们要为他举行一个小小的派对。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone to do a job or piece of work

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much homework are you given in a week?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一星期有多少家庭作业？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always giving us chores to do around the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是叫我们干家务。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 使某人/某物具有某种品质
Sense.DEF: to make someone or something have a particular quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ginger gives the dish a wonderful spicy flavour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 姜使这道菜带有可口的辣味。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His grey hair gave him an air of distinction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰白的头发赋予他一种尊贵的气派。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Its association with the movie industry has given the place a certain glamor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与电影业的联系使这个地方具有一种特殊的魅力。

Sense.DEF: to pay a particular amount of money for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They say they’re not willing to give any more than they’ve already offered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说就给原定的这些钱﹐不愿意再多给了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They gave us £700 for our old car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们出了700英镑买我们的旧车。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How much will you give me for these two games?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给我多少钱买这两个游戏？

Sense.DEF: to behave towards someone in a way that shows you have a particular attitude or feeling towards them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The people were expected to give their leader absolute obedience and loyalty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人民被要求对领袖表示绝对的服从和忠诚。

Sense.DEF: to officially say that someone must have a particular punishment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you don’t pay on time, you could be given a fine of up to $1,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果没有按时付款﹐可能会被处以高达1,000美元的罚金。

GramExa.PROPFORM: give sb six months/three years etc
GramExa.GLOSS: in prison
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 判某人六个月/三年等（徒刑）
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge gave her two years in prison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官判她入狱两年。

Sense.DEF: to make someone think about something in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 给（某人）某种印象/感觉/想法
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to give him the wrong idea about the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让他对这份工作有错误的印象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report gives us a very accurate picture of life in the inner cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇报道非常准确地为我们描绘了老城区的生活现状。

Sense.DEF: to spend some time thinking about something carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congress has been giving the crime bill serious consideration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会一直在认真考虑打击犯罪的法案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give the matter some thought and let you know my decision next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事我考虑考虑﹐下个星期告诉你我的决定。

Sense.DEF: to help someone do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you give me a hand?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能帮我一下吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shall I give you a hand with that bag?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我帮你拎那个包吗？

Sense.DEF: to telephone someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give you a call about seven, okay?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我七点左右给你打电话﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: to try to do something, especially something you have not done before
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not usually much good at this sort of game, but I’ll give it a go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常不大擅长这种游戏﹐不过我还是试试吧。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb time/a few weeks/all day etc
Sense.DEF: to allow time for someone to do something, or for something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 给某人时间/几个星期时间/一整天时间等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve asked him to give me a couple more days to finish my essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要求他再给我几天时间把文章写完。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flexible working hours could give working parents more time to spend with their children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弹性工作时间可以让上班的父母有更多时间和孩子在一起。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I give it six weeks/a month etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not think something will continue successfully for very long
Sense.TRAN: 我估计不会超过六个星期/一个月等〔某事就会失败〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I give the project six months at the most before it all falls apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我估计这个项目最多不出六个月就会告吹。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not give sth a second thought/another thought
Sense.DEF: to not think or worry about something at all
Sense.TRAN: 根本不想某事﹔毫不担心某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The matter didn’t seem important, and I hardly gave it a second thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事情好像并不重要﹐所以我几乎没有多想。

Sense.DEF: to be willing to change what you think or do according to what else happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think that both sides need to give a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得双方都要作出点让步。

Sense.DEF: to state what your official decision or judgement is, for example in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: The referee has given a penalty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁判已经判了点球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury will be giving its verdict within the next couple of days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团将在未来几天作出裁断。

Sense.DEF: to decide that someone should have a particular score or mark for something that they have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: She only gave me a B for my last essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上一篇论文她只给了一个B。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judges have given him top marks for this performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场表演评委给了他最高分。

Sense.DEF: if a material gives, it bends or stretches when you put pressure on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: New shoes often feel tight, but the leather should give a little after a few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新鞋子往往感觉很紧﹐但是穿几天皮子就会松一些。

Sense.DEF: if something gives, it breaks or moves away suddenly because of weight or pressure on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The branch suddenly gave beneath him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脚下的树枝突然断裂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I pushed against the door with all my might, but it still wouldn’t give.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我使出全身力气推门﹐但它还是一动不动。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you like something much more than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give me good old-fashioned rock ’n’ roll any day!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最喜欢的就是摇滚老歌！

Sense.LEXUNIT: would give anything/a lot/your right arm etc for sth
Sense.DEF: used when you would like something very much
Sense.TRAN: 愿意为某物付出一切〔表示十分想要某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d give my right arm for a figure like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是能有那样的身材﹐叫我干什么都愿意。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not care at all about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t give a damn what you think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我才不管你怎么想呢。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not believe someone’s excuse or explanation
Sense.TRAN: 别给我来那一套〔表示不相信某人的借口或解释〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t give me that! I know exactly where you’ve been!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别跟我来这一套！我十分清楚你去哪里了！

Sense.DEF: to tell someone angrily that you are annoyed with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give that boy what for when I see him!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等见到了那个男孩﹐我要好好教训他一顿！

Sense.LEXUNIT: give as good as you get
Sense.DEF: to fight or argue with someone using the same amount of skill or force that they are using
Sense.TRAN: 针锋相对﹐毫不示弱地反击[反驳]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t worry about Emma because I know she can give as good as she gets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不担心埃玛﹐因为我知道她会以牙还牙的。

Sense.DEF: to help other people and do things for them as well as expecting them to do things for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to learn to give and take in any relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在任何人际关系中﹐你都得学会互谅互让。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give or take a few minutes/a penny/a mile etc
Sense.DEF: used to say that the amount or figure that you have just mentioned is nearly correct, but not exactly
Sense.TRAN: 相差几分钟/一便士/一英里等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be a £1,000, give or take £50 or so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那将是1,000英镑﹐出入50英镑左右。

Sense.DEF: used to admit that someone is right about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was wrong to trust him, I’ll give you that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不该相信他﹐这一点我承认。

Sense.DEF: to make someone think that a particular thing is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was given to understand that I would be offered a permanent job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得到的信息是﹐我会得到一份固定的工作。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something in a clear direct way
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no point in beating about the bush, so I’ll give it to you straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要拐弯抹角﹐我就有话直说吧。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I give you the chairman/prime minister/groom etc
Sense.DEF: used at the end of a formal speech to invite people to welcome a special guest
if a woman gives herself to a man, she has sex with him

Exponent.DEF: to let someone have something, without expecting to be paid for it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was always giving me gifts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是送我礼物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They gave a free drink to all their customers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给所有顾客都送一杯免费饮料。

Exponent.DEF: to give money to an organization that helps people or protects something, or to give your blood or part of your body to save someone’s life
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company donates 1 per cent of its profits to charity.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司把利润的1%捐赠给慈善机构。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: 70% of people wanted to donate their organs after death.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有70%的人想要去世后捐献自己的器官。

Exponent.DEF: to officially give money or a prize to someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was awarded a million dollars in damages.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得到了一百万美元的损失赔偿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hollywood awarded him an Oscar for his performance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞给他颁发了奥斯卡表演奖。

Exponent.DEF: to formally or officially give something to someone by putting it in their hands, especially at a formal ceremony
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They presented her with a bouquet of flowers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给她献上了一束花。

Exponent.DEF: to officially arrange for someone to have something that you own after your death
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He left most of his property to his wife.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把大部分财产都留给了妻子。

Exponent.EXP: lavish sb with sth/lavish sth on sb
Exponent.DEF: to give someone a lot of something, especially praise, attention, or gifts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After his team won, the press lavished him with praise.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的球队获胜之后﹐报界对他盛赞有加。

Exponent.DEF: to give someone an honour, a university degree, or the right or power to do something
Exponent.TRAN: 授予﹐赋予〔荣誉﹑学位﹑权利或权力〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the powers conferred on him by Parliament
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会授予他的权力

Section.SECHEADING: TO GIVE SOMETHING TO A GROUP OF PEOPLE 把某物送给一群人

Exponent.DEF: to give something to each of the people in a group
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The teacher handed out the test papers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师把测验卷子分发下去。

Exponent.DEF: to give things to a large number of people, especially in the streets
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Anti-war protesters were distributing leaflets.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 反战示威抗议者在散发传单。

Exponent.DEF: to divide something into equal parts and give a part to each person
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They shared the profits among the staff.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们让员工分享利润。

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone because you do not want or need it for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 分送﹐送掉〔不需要的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gave most of my books away when I left college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大学毕业时把大部分书都送掉了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Give your old clothes away to a thrift shop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的旧衣服送给慈善商店吧。

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone without asking for any money, rather than selling it to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re giving away a free diary with tomorrow’s newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天的报纸我们将会附赠一本日记本。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have 1,000 CDs to give away to our readers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有1,000张CD要送给读者。

Sense.DEF: to show where someone is or what they are doing or thinking when they are trying to keep this a secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, I won’t give you away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我不会出卖你的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue tried to smile, but her voice gave her away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休想笑一笑﹐但是她的声音出卖了她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I knew that if I moved I would give myself away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道只要我一动就会暴露。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The look on his face gave the game away showed something that he was trying to keep secret .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的表情露馅儿了。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something that you should keep secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave away as little information as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尽可能不透露信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to give away exactly how the system works.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想说出这套系统具体的工作原理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to give the game away give information that should be secret by saying too much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想言语过多而泄露了秘密。

Sense.DEF: to lose in a game or competition by doing something badly or making mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: We gave away two goals in the first half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半场我们输了两个球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Democrats are now in danger of giving the whole election away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在民主党处境不利﹐有可能会输掉这次大选。

Sense.DEF: to give formal permission for a woman to marry a man as part of a traditional wedding ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔在传统婚礼上〕将〔新娘〕交给新郎

Sense.DEF: to give something to the person it belongs to or the person who gave it to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: This isn’t your money and you must give it back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不是你的钱﹐你一定要还回去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course you can have a look at it, as long as you give it back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你当然可以看﹐但是你要还回来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll give the keys back to you tomorrow morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天早上把钥匙还给你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her ex-husband refused to give her back any of her old photos and letters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她前夫不肯将她以前的照片和信件还给她。

Sense.DEF: to make it possible for someone to have or do something again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He underwent an expensive operation to give him back his sight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做了一个昂贵的视力恢复手术。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company finally agreed to give the women their old jobs back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司终于同意让那些妇女复工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This legislation will give more power back to local authorities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法规将把更多权力交还给地方政府。

Sense.DEF: to finally agree to do or accept something that you had at first opposed, especially because someone has forced or persuaded you to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eventually I gave in and accepted the job on their terms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我作出让步﹐按照他们的条件接受了这份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob’s wife went on at him so much that eventually he gave in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃的妻子对他不依不饶﹐他终于屈服了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government refused to give in to their demands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对他们的要求拒不妥协。

Sense.DEF: to accept that you are defeated in a game, fight, competition etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels were eventually forced to give in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军最后被迫投降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will carry on fighting to the end. We will never give in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将战斗到底﹐决不认输。

Sense.DEF: to give a piece of work or something you have written to someone in authority
Sense.TRAN: 呈交﹐交上〔作业或文字材料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You were supposed to give this work in four days ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你四天前就应该把作业交上来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rose decided to give in her notice officially say she was going to leave her job .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗丝决定递交辞呈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All assignments must be given in to your teacher by Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五之前必须把所有的作业交给你们老师。

Sense.DEF: to no longer try to stop yourself from doing something you want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t give in to the temptation to argue back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要一时冲动就回嘴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you feel the urge for a cigarette, try not to give in to it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果烟瘾上来﹐要尽量克制。

Sense.DEF: if you give of yourself, your time, your money etc, you do things for other people without expecting anything in return
Sense.EXAMPLE: Retired people are often willing to give of their time to help with community projects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退休老人常常愿意抽出时间来给社区项目帮忙。

Sense.DEF: to produce a smell, light, heat, a sound etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wood gave off a sweet, perfumed smell as it burned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木头燃烧时散发出甜甜的香味。

Sense.DEF: if a window, door, or building gives onto a particular place, it leads to that place or you can see that place from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the garden gate that gives onto the main road
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面朝大路的花园大门
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small balcony giving onto fields
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面向田地的小阳台

Sense.DEF: to give something to each person in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you give the drinks out, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把饮料分给大家好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students were giving out leaflets to everyone on the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们正在街上向每个人分发传单。

Sense.DEF: if part of your body gives out, it stops working properly or becomes much weaker
Sense.TRAN: 〔人体某一部分〕不能正常工作﹐变得无力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just as I approached the town, my legs finally gave out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在我快到镇上时﹐双腿终于挪不动了。

Sense.DEF: if a supply of something gives out, there is none left
Sense.EXAMPLE: My money was beginning to give out and there were no jobs to be found.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的钱快用光了﹐工作也无处可找。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After two hours her patience gave out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两小时之后﹐她失去了耐心。

Sense.DEF: to produce something such as light, heat, or a signal
Sense.EXAMPLE: A gas lamp gave out a pale yellowish light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤气灯发出昏黄的光。

Sense.DEF: to announce something, especially officially
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指正式地〕宣布某事﹐公布某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was given out that the government was to enter into negotiations with the rebels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据宣布﹐政府要和叛军进行谈判。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing or saying something that is annoying other people
Sense.TRAN: 停止〔做或说烦人的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you lot would just give over!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们这些家伙消停些好吗！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh, give over complaining, we’re nearly there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐别发牢骚了﹐我们快到了。

Sense.DEF: to be used for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: The land surrounding the village was given over to vineyards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 村子周围的土地都用来做葡萄园。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole day was given over to cooking and preparing for the celebrations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一整天都在做饭菜和准备庆祝活动。

Sense.DEF: to spend all your time doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: In his youth he had given himself over to pleasure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年轻时候纵情享乐。

Sense.DEF: to give responsibility for or control over something to a particular person, organization etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The running of internal affairs was given over to the Chancellor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内事务交由总理处理。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something, especially something that you do regularly
Sense.TRAN: 放弃某事〔尤指经常做的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Darren has decided to give up football at the end of this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴伦决定本赛季结束后就不再踢球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave up her job and started writing poetry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她辞掉工作﹐开始写诗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gave up going to the theatre when I moved out of London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搬出伦敦以后就不再去看戏了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you give up smoking?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不戒烟呢？

Sense.DEF: to stop trying to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent half an hour looking for the keys, but eventually gave up and went home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们找了半个小时的钥匙﹐但最后还是放弃﹐回家去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I give up. What’s the answer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想了﹐答案是什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t give up so easily .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不应该这么轻易就放弃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gave up trying to persuade him to continue with his studies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不再劝他继续学业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has still not given up the search.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还是没有放弃寻找。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The ground was too hard to dig so I gave it up as a bad job stopped trying because success seemed unlikely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地太硬挖不动﹐于是我放弃了无谓的尝试。

Sense.DEF: to allow yourself or someone else to be caught by the police or enemy soldiers
Sense.TRAN: 自首/把某人交给警察[敌军]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The siege ended peacefully after the gunman gave himself up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持枪歹徒缴械投降﹐围捕行动和平结束。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the end, his family gave him up to the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐他的家人把他交给了警方。

Sense.DEF: to use some of your time to do a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t mind giving up a couple of hours a week to deal with correspondence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不介意一个星期腾出几个小时来处理信件。

Sense.DEF: to give something that is yours to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 把某物/某人让出去﹐放弃某物/某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family refused to give up any of their land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家人拒绝让出任何一块土地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was put under tremendous pressure to give the baby up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她承受着要她放弃孩子的巨大压力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would always give my seat up to an elderly person on the bus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在公共汽车上总是会给老人让座。

Sense.DEF: to end a romantic relationship with someone, even though you do not really want to
Sense.TRAN: 〔不情愿地〕与某人分手﹐放弃〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew deep down that I should give him up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我内心很清楚﹐我应该放他走。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb up for dead/lost etc
Sense.DEF: to believe that someone is dead and stop looking for them
Sense.TRAN: 认为某人已死/失踪等〔而不再寻找〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship sank and the crew were given up for dead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船沉了﹐全体船员被认为已经丧生。

Sense.DEF:
used to ask people to
applaud
someone
Sense.TRAN: 为某人鼓掌﹐为某人叫好

Sense.DEF: to stop hoping that someone or something will change or improve
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某人或某事〕不抱希望
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d been in a coma for six months, and doctors had almost given up on him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经昏迷六个月﹐医生几乎对他不抱希望了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that point, I hadn’t completely given up on the marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候﹐我还没有完全放弃这桩婚姻。

Sense.DEF: to allow yourself to feel an emotion completely, without trying to control it
Sense.TRAN: 使〔自己〕陷入〔某种感情而不加控制〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave himself up to despair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他陷入了绝望之中。

Sense.DEF: the ability of a material or substance to bend or stretch when put under pressure
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rope has quite a bit of give in it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这绳子相当有弹性。

Sense.DEF: a willingness between two people or groups to understand each other, and to let each other have or do some of the things they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: In any relationship there has to be some give-and-take.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在任何人际关系中﹐都必然有一定程度的互相妥协。

Sense.DEF: something that makes it easy for you to guess something

GramExa.GLOSS: make it very easy to guess something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’d been smoking dope; his glazed eyes were a dead giveaway.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直在吸毒﹐他那呆滞的眼神说明了一切。

Sense.DEF: something that is given away free, especially something that a shop gives you when you buy a product
giveaway prices are extremely cheap

the past participle of
give
any particular time, situation, amount etc that is being used as an example
Sense.EXAMPLE: On any given day in the Houston area, half the hospital beds are empty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在休斯敦地区﹐任何一天医院的床位都有一半是空的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rules are to be followed in any given situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些规则在任何情况下都要遵守。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are thought to be around 10,000 young homeless Scots in London at any given time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据信伦敦无论何时都有一万左右的苏格兰青年无家可归。

Sense.DEF: previously arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wrapping machine was pre-set to wrap a given number of biscuits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包装机预设好可以包装一定数量的饼干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Candidates will have to give a presentation on a given topic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 候选人必须就指定话题展开论述。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a game in which, at a given signal, everyone has to stand still
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家接到约定信号后都必须静止不动的一个游戏

Sense.DEF: to tend to do something, especially something that you should not do
Sense.TRAN: 往往会做某事〔尤指不该做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a quiet man, not usually given to complaining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个话不多的人﹐一般不会发牢骚。

Sense.DEF: to accept that something is true or exists, especially when you are developing an idea or argument
Sense.TRAN: 认为某事理所当然如此﹐认为某事是想当然〔尤用于得出观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fact that people find change difficult is taken as given.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人总觉得改变什么很难﹐这是毫无疑问的。

Sense.DEF: taking something into account
Sense.EXAMPLE: Given the circumstances, you’ve done really well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鉴于这种情况﹐你已经算是处理得很好了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Given that the patients have some disabilities, we still try to enable them to be as independent as possible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然考虑到病人有生理上的不便﹐我们还是尽量让他们自立。

Sense.DEF: a basic fact that you accept as being true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sandra will be at least 15 minutes late – that’s a given.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德拉至少会迟到15分钟﹐这是肯定的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concept is taken as a given in social studies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在社会学研究中﹐这个概念被认为是真理。

Sense.DEF:
your
first name
kind, caring, and generous
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a very giving person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一个很有奉献精神的人。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of equipment – used when you cannot remember or do not know its correct name
Sense.TRAN: 小玩意儿﹐小东西〔指忘记或不知道名称的东西〕

Sense.DEF: a part of a bird’s stomach that breaks down food into smaller pieces

glacé fruits, especially
cherries
, have been covered in sugary liquid

a type of
icing
used to decorate cakes
relating to ice and glaciers, or formed by glaciers
Sense.TRAN: 冰的﹐冰川的﹐由冰川形成的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glacial valley
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰川谷
Sense.EXAMPLE: glacial deposits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰川沉积

Sense.DEF: a glacial look or expression is extremely unfriendly
Sense.TRAN: 〔神色或表情〕冷若冰霜的﹐冷漠的﹐冷冰冰的

Sense.DEF: extremely slow
Sense.EXAMPLE: Change was coming, but at a glacial pace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 变化是有了﹐但是非常缓慢。

Sense.DEF: extremely cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glacial wind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺骨的寒风

Sense.DEF: the process in which land is covered by glaciers, or the effect this process has
a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley
pleased and happy about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m really glad I don’t have to go back there again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真高兴我不用再回到那儿去了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re so glad you came.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来了我们真高兴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I am glad to be back home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴回到家里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m glad to see you looking so well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴看到你气色这么好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve decided to accept the job.’ ‘I’m glad.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我决定接受这份工作。”“我很高兴。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll be glad when the war is over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争结束我就高兴了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t leaving after all. He was glad about that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她到底还是不走了﹐他很开心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Jamie’s been accepted for medical school!’ ‘I’m so glad for him.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “杰米被医学院录取了！”“我真为他高兴啊。”

Sense.DEF: to be grateful for something
Sense.TRAN: 为某事感激﹐庆幸有某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks Marge, I’ll be glad of the help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你﹐玛吉﹐非常感谢你的帮助。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be glad of an opportunity/chance/excuse to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were glad of the chance to finally get some sleep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们庆幸终于有机会可以睡一会儿。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was cold outside, and she was glad of her coat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面很冷﹐她很庆幸有这件大衣。

Sense.DEF: to be very willing and eager to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will be glad to send you any information you may need.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 您若需要什么资料﹐我们很乐意寄给您。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure he’d be only too glad to extremely willing to help you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信他一定非常乐意帮助你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you give me a hand?’ ‘I’d be glad to.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你能帮我一个忙吗？” “我很乐意。”

Sense.DEF: used in formal situations or letters to ask someone to do something for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d be glad if you’d let me know when the funeral is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你能告诉我葬礼的时间﹐我将非常感激。

Sense.DEF: good news
to look at someone in a way that shows you are sexually attracted to them
Sense.TRAN: 向某人抛媚眼﹐向某人送秋波

Sense.DEF: your best clothes that you wear for special occasions
Sense.TRAN: 〔特殊场合穿的〕最好的衣服﹐盛装

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the adjective glad are. 本图表所示为形容词glad构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel pleased and happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will gladden the hearts of my friends to see you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的朋友见到你会非常开心。

Sense.DEF: a small open space in a wood or forest
to talk to or welcome people in a very friendly way, especially when this is not sincere
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不是很真诚地〕热烈欢迎﹐热情招呼
Sense.EXAMPLE: He moved among the guests, glad-handing well-wishers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿梭在宾客中间﹐热情地招呼前来道贺的人。

Sense.DEF: a soldier who fought against other men or wild animals as an entertainment in ancient Rome
a tall garden plant with long leaves and large brightly-coloured flowers
willingly or eagerly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would gladly have done it for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我本来会很乐意为他做这事。

Sense.DEF: happily
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Here’s Michelle!’ he said gladly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “米歇尔来了！”他高兴地说道。

Sense.DEF: attractive, exciting, and connected with wealth and success
Sense.TRAN: 有魅力的﹐令人向往的﹐奢华的
Sense.EXAMPLE: glam young film directors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光芒四射的年轻电影导演

Sense.DEF:
an American spelling of
glamour
to make something seem more attractive than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 使更吸引人﹐使更有魅力﹐美化
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV has been accused of glamorizing crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人指责电视美化犯罪。

Sense.DEF: attractive, exciting, and related to wealth and success
Sense.TRAN: 有魅力的﹐令人向往的﹐奢华的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She led an exciting and glamorous life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生活奢华﹐充满刺激。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the most glamorous neighborhood in the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城里最繁华的街区
Sense.EXAMPLE: On television, she looks so glamorous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在电视里看上去光彩照人。

Sense.DEF: the attractive and exciting quality of being connected with wealth and success
Sense.TRAN: 〔财富和成功带来的〕魅力﹐诱惑力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Forget all you read about the glamour of television.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要去管书报上怎么说电视如何有魅力。

Sense.DEF: a style of attractiveness that suggests wealth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Designer clothes are not a passport to instant glamour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名牌服装并不能让你转瞬之间身价倍增。

Sense.DEF: a performer who is more noticeable for their attractiveness than for their skill or ability
Sense.TRAN: 魅力[花瓶型]女艺人/男艺人〔指以美貌悦人而不以技艺或能力著称的艺人〕

Sense.DEF: to quickly look at someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The man glanced nervously at his watch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那人紧张地看了一眼手表。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Wyatt glanced around the restaurant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀亚特环视了一下餐馆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emily glanced over her shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米莉回头看了一眼。

Sense.DEF: to read something very quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you glance through these figures for me?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮我过目一下这些数字好吗？

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say take a quick look at/through etc something rather than glance at/through etc something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常说take a quick look at/through﹐而不说glance at/through
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I took a quick look at my watch.

Sense.DEF: to hit a surface at an angle and then move away from it in another direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bullet had crushed his helmet and glanced off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹打碎了他的头盔后被弹飞。

Sense.DEF: if light glances off a surface, it flashes or shines back from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun was glancing off the icy tips of gleaming rock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闪闪发亮的岩石上﹐太阳光照着冰凌子熠熠生辉。

Sense.DEF: a quick look
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her a quick glance and smiled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迅速地瞥了她一眼﹐笑了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t resist a sidelong glance a look that is not direct at him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她忍不住瞟了他一眼。

GramExa.GLOSS: look at someone or something quickly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The couple at the next table cast quick glances in our direction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻桌的那对夫妇不时朝我们投来一瞥。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The brothers exchanged glances looked at each other quickly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兄弟俩互相瞥了一眼。

Subsense.DEF: if you know something at a glance, you know it as soon as you see it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He saw at a glance what had happened.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一看就知道发生了什么事。

Subsense.DEF: in a short form that is easy to read and understand
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Here are our top ten ski resorts at a glance.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我们的十佳滑雪胜地便览。

Sense.DEF: when you first look at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: At first glance, the place seemed deserted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乍一看﹐这地方似乎空无一人。

Sense.DEF: a hit that partly misses so that it does not have its full force
a short or indirect reference to something or someone
an organ of the body which produces a substance that the body needs, such as hormones, sweat, or saliva
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pituitary gland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脑垂体腺

Sense.DEF: related to the glands, or produced by the glands

an infectious disease which makes your
lymph nodes
swell up and makes you feel weak for a long time afterwards
Sense.TRAN: 腺热﹐传染性单核细胞增多症

Sense.DEF: to look angrily at someone for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She glared at him accusingly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用责备的目光瞪着他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He glared round the room as if expecting a challenge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他凶巴巴地环视房间﹐像是等待有人来挑战他。

Sense.DEF: to shine with a very strong bright light which hurts your eyes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun glared down on us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺眼的阳光照在我们身上。

Sense.DEF: a bright unpleasant light which hurts your eyes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the harsh glare of the desert sun
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙漠中耀眼的太阳光

Sense.EXAMPLE: a special screen to reduce glare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种可以减弱刺眼强光的特殊屏幕

Sense.DEF: a long angry look
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a hostile glare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她狠狠地瞪了他一眼。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the glare of publicity/the media/public scrutiny etc
Sense.DEF: the full attention of newspapers, television etc, especially when you do not want it
Sense.TRAN: 舆论/媒体/公众等的密切关注

Sense.DEF: very bad and very noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book’s most glaring omission is the lack of an index.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书最明显的疏漏是缺少索引。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glaring example of political corruption
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治腐败的明显例子

Sense.DEF: too bright and difficult to look at
Sense.EXAMPLE: the glaring light of high noon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正午的耀眼阳光

Sense.DEF: in a way that is very clear and easy to notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the clues were glaringly obvious .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些线索显而易见。

Sense.DEF:
the
policy
begun by Mikhail Gorbachev in the USSR in the 1980s of allowing discussion of the country’s problems
Sense.TRAN: 公开性﹐开放性〔指戈尔巴乔夫于20世纪80年代在苏联倡导的允许公开讨论国家所面临问题的政策〕

Sense.DEF: a transparent solid substance used for making windows, bottles etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass bowl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃碗
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piece of broken glass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块碎玻璃片

GramExa.GLOSS: a flat piece of glass with straight edges

Sense.EXAMPLE: the cathedral’s stained glass windows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂的彩色玻璃窗

Sense.DEF: a container used for drinking made of glass

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 葡萄酒杯/白兰地酒杯/香槟杯等

Sense.EXAMPLE: Nigel raised his glass in a toast to his son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奈杰尔举杯向儿子祝酒。

PIC.HEADING: GLASSES 玻璃杯
PIC.PICCONTENT: beer glass 啤酒杯；foam 泡沫；wine glass 葡萄酒杯；champagne flute 细长香槟杯；shot glass 烈酒杯；long glass 长水杯；brandy glass 白兰地杯；tumbler 平底玻璃杯；ice cube 冰块

Sense.DEF: the amount of a drink contained in a glass

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She poured a glass of wine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她倒了一杯葡萄酒。

Sense.DEF: two pieces of specially cut glass or plastic in a frame, which you wear in order to see more clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was clean-shaven and wore glasses .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他胡子刮得很光净﹐戴着一副眼镜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need a new pair of glasses .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要一副新眼镜。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远视镜/阅读镜

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Glasses is plural, even when it refers to a single object. Do not say ‘a glasses’.
F2NBox.TRAN: glasses是复数﹐即使是一副眼镜也用复数。不要说a glasses
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She’s got nice (NOT不说 a nice) glasses.

Sense.DEF: objects which are made of glass, especially ones used for drinking and eating
Sense.EXAMPLE: a priceless collection of Venetian glass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套价值连城的威尼斯玻璃器皿藏品

Sense.LEXUNIT: people in glass houses shouldn’t throw stones
Sense.DEF: used to say that you should not criticize someone for having a fault if you have the same fault yourself
Sense.TRAN: 玻璃屋里的人不要扔石头〔表示如果自己也有某种短处﹐就不要指责别人〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb sees the glass as half-empty/half-full
Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular person is more likely to notice the good parts or the bad parts of situation
Sense.TRAN: 某人看杯子是半空的/半满的〔用于表示某人总是看到事情不好的一面或好的一面〕

Sense.DEF: plants that are grown under glass are protected from the cold by a glass cover
a mirror

a
barometer
to cover something with glass, or to build a glass structure around something
Sense.TRAN: 用玻璃把〔某物〕罩住﹔围绕〔某物〕建起玻璃结构

Sense.DEF: the attitudes and practices that prevent women or particular groups from getting high level jobs, even though there are no actual laws or rules to stop them
Sense.TRAN: 玻璃天花板〔指女性或某一群体的人在职位晋升上遇到的无形障碍〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goodhue shattered the glass ceiling as the first female publisher at Time Inc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古德休打破了无形的障碍﹐成为时代公司的第一位女出版人。

Sense.DEF: surrounded by a glass structure
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glassed-in porch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用玻璃围起来的门廊

Sense.DEF: the amount of liquid a glass will hold
a building made mainly of glass which is used for growing plants
a military prison
glass objects, especially ones used for drinking and eating
smooth and shining, like glass
Sense.EXAMPLE: the glassy surface of the lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平滑如镜的湖面

Sense.DEF: glassy eyes show no feeling or understanding, and do not move
Sense.TRAN: 〔目光〕呆滞的﹐无表情的﹐木然的

Sense.DEF: having eyes that do not move or show any expression
Sense.TRAN: 目光呆滞的﹐眼睛无神的

Sense.DEF:
a town in southwest England with one of the oldest
abbeys type of religious building
in England. According to some old stories, it is the place where King Arthur is buried. A festival of modern music is held at Glastonbury every summer. When it rains, conditions can become very muddy at the festival, especially for people staying in tents.
Sense.TRAN: 格拉斯顿伯里〔英格兰西南部一城镇﹐英格兰最古老的一座修道院坐落于此。相传亚瑟王安葬于该地〕

Sense.DEF: an eye disease in which increased pressure inside your eye gradually makes you lose your sight
if your eyes glaze over, they show no expression, usually because you are very bored or tired
Sense.TRAN: 〔因无聊或疲倦〕变得目光呆滞
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes his eyes would glaze over for a second or two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候他会两眼发直地愣一两秒钟。

Sense.DEF: to cover plates, cups etc made of clay with a thin liquid that gives them a shiny surface
to cover food with a liquid which gives it an attractive shiny surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Glaze the rolls with egg white.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给小圆面包淋上蛋清。

Sense.DEF: to fit glass into window frames in a house, door etc
a liquid that is used to cover plates, cups etc made of clay to give them a shiny surface
a liquid which is put onto food to give it an attractive shiny surface
Sense.TRAN: 〔浇在食物上使之光滑好看的〕液浆

Sense.DEF: a transparent covering of oil paint spread over a painting
if you have a glazed look, your eyes show no expression, usually because you are very bored or tired
Sense.TRAN: 呆滞的神色/目光/表情等

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to fit glass into window frames
glass that has been used to fill windows
to shine softly
Sense.EXAMPLE: His teeth gleamed under his moustache.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的八字须下面﹐牙齿晶莹发亮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wooden panelling was gleaming with wax polish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 木嵌板上过蜡显得很光亮。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes or face gleam with a feeling, they show it
Sense.TRAN: 〔眼睛或脸部〕闪现﹐表露〔某种情感〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He laughed, his eyes gleaming with amusement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑了﹐眼中流露出愉悦的神色。

Sense.DEF: a small pale light, especially one that shines for a short time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They saw a sudden gleam of light.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们看到一道微光一闪而过。

Sense.DEF: the brightness of something that shines

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the gleam of gold and diamonds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 金子和钻石闪闪发亮

Sense.DEF: an emotion or expression that appears for a moment on someone’s face

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She saw a gleam of amusement in his eyes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到他眼中闪烁着笑意。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Rose looked at me with a furious gleam in her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗丝看着我﹐眼中闪着怒火。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is a gleam in sb’s eye
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is being planned or thought about, but does not yet exist
Sense.TRAN: 某事物仅仅是某人的一个构想
Sense.EXAMPLE: In those days, CD-ROMs were still just a gleam in the eye of some young engineer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候﹐只读光盘还只是一些年轻工程师心中的构想。

Sense.DEF: to find out information slowly and with difficulty

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Additional information was gleaned from other sources.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另外的信息都是从其他地方搜集来的。

Sense.DEF: to collect grain that has been left behind after the crops have been cut
small pieces of information that you have found out with difficulty
Sense.TRAN: 费力搜集到的零星消息

Sense.DEF: a feeling of satisfaction and excitement, often because something bad has happened to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manufacturers are rubbing their hands with glee as they prepare to cash in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厂家准备收钱的时候高兴得直搓手。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who sing together for enjoyment
very excited and satisfied
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gleeful laugh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开心的笑

Sense.DEF: a deep narrow valley in Scotland or Ireland
Sense.TRAN: 〔苏格兰或爱尔兰的〕峡谷﹐幽谷

Sense.DEF: said easily and without thinking about all the problems involved – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: glib generalizations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻率的归纳

Sense.DEF: speaking easily but without thinking carefully – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 信口开河的﹐巧舌如簧的 〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: glib politicians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧舌如簧的政客

Sense.DEF: to move smoothly and quietly, as if without effort

GramExa.EXAMPLE: couples gliding over the dance floor
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在舞池中翩翩起舞的一对对舞者

Subsense.DEF: if a bird glides, it flies without moving its wings
if a plane glides, it flies without using an engine

Sense.DEF: to do or achieve things easily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kennedy seemed to glide through life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼迪似乎一帆风顺。

Sense.DEF: a smooth quiet movement that seems to take no effort
the act of moving from one musical note to another without a break in sound
a vowel which is made by moving your tongue from one position to another
a light plane that flies without an engine
the sport of flying in a glider
a small sign of something such as hope or understanding

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a glimmer of hope for the future
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对未来的一丝希望

Sense.DEF: a light that is not very bright

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first glimmer of dawn
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一道熹微的晨光

Sense.DEF: to shine with a light that is not very bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weak glimmering light
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微弱的闪光

Sense.DEF: a small sign of thought or feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: The glimmerings of an idea began to come to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始有了一个隐约的想法。

Sense.DEF: a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

GramExa.GLOSS: a very short look
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We only had a fleeting glimpse of the river.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只是匆匆地看了一眼那条河。

Sense.DEF: a short experience of something that helps you begin to understand it
Sense.TRAN: 短暂的感受﹐短暂的体验

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a glimpse of what life might be like in the future
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 未来生活可能是什么样子的一次短暂体验

Sense.DEF: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I glimpsed a figure at the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say catch sight of sb/sth rather than glimpse sb/sth .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常常说catch sight of sb/sth﹐而不说glimpse sb/sth
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I caught sight of him as he was getting into his car.

Sense.DEF: to begin to understand something for a moment
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the first time she glimpsed the truth about her sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她第一次了解到有关她姐姐的真实情况。

Sense.DEF: if a shiny surface glints, it gives out small flashes of light
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gold rims of his spectacles glinted in the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他眼镜的金框在太阳光下闪闪发光。

Sense.DEF: if light glints off a surface, it shines back off it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sunlight glinted off the windows of a tall apartment building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光从一栋高大公寓楼的玻璃窗上反射出来。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes glint, they shine and show an unfriendly feeling
Sense.TRAN: 〔眼睛〕发亮〔表达不友善的感情〕

Sense.DEF: a look in someone’s eyes which shows a particular feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: a humorous glint in her eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她眼中闪烁的幽默

Sense.DEF: a flash of light from a shiny surface
to shine and look wet or oily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boy’s back was glistening with sweat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个男孩背上的汗水闪闪发亮。

Sense.EXAMPLE: glistening black hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乌黑发亮的头发

Sense.DEF: a small fault in a machine or piece of equipment, that stops it working
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器或设备上的〕小故障﹐小毛病
Sense.EXAMPLE: a software glitch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软件小故障

Sense.DEF: to shine brightly with flashing points of light
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river glittered in the sunlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光下河面波光粼粼。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s eyes glitter, they shine very brightly and show a particular strong emotion
Sense.TRAN: 〔眼睛〕闪现﹐流露〔某种强烈的感情〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His blue eyes glittered with anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的蓝眼睛里燃烧着愤怒。

Sense.DEF: brightness consisting of many flashing points of light
Sense.EXAMPLE: the glitter of his gold cigarette case
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那金烟盒发出的亮光

Sense.DEF: a bright shining expression in someone’s eyes that shows a particular emotion
Sense.TRAN: 〔眼睛里某种感情的〕闪现﹐流露
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no mistaking the mocking glitter in his eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼睛里无疑流露着讥讽。

Sense.DEF: the exciting attractive quality of a place or a way of life which is connected with rich or famous people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The glamour and glitter of London was not for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦这个流光溢彩的繁华世界不适合他。

Sense.DEF: very small pieces of shiny paper that are used for decoration
people who are rich, famous, and fashionable
giving off many small flashes of light
Sense.EXAMPLE: glittering jewels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 璀璨的宝石

Sense.DEF: very successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glittering career
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辉煌的事业

Sense.DEF: connected with rich, famous and fashionable people
Sense.TRAN: 盛大的﹐华丽的﹔众星云集的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glittering Hollywood premiere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场众星云集的好莱坞影片首映式

Sense.DEF: the exciting, attractive quality which is connected with rich, famous and fashionable people
Sense.TRAN: 〔与富人﹑名人和时尚人士有关的〕魅力﹐富丽堂皇﹐奢华
Sense.EXAMPLE: show business glitz
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 娱乐圈的浮华

Sense.DEF: exciting and attractive because of being connected with rich, famous, and fashionable people
Sense.EXAMPLE: glitzy London parties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦盛大的派对

Sense.DEF: the time in the early evening when it is becoming dark
to show in an annoying way that you are proud of your own success or happy about someone else’s failure

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fans are still gloating over Scotland’s victory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷们还在为苏格兰队的胜利扬扬得意。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of something soft or liquid that has a round shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: globs of paint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一滴滴油漆

Sense.DEF: affecting or including the whole world
Sense.EXAMPLE: global climate change
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球气候变化
Sense.EXAMPLE: the global economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球经济

Sense.DEF: considering all the parts of a problem or situation together
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are taking a global view of our business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从全局来考虑我们的生意。

Sense.DEF:
affecting a whole computer system, program, or
file
Sense.TRAN: 影响整个计算机系统[程序﹐文件]的

Sense.DEF: the process of making something such as a business operate in a lot of different countries all around the world, or the result of this
Sense.EXAMPLE: the increasing globalization of world trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界贸易的日益全球化

Sense.DEF:
if a company, industry, or
economy
globalizes or is globalized, it has business activities all over the world
a name for the world, used to emphasize the degree to which everything is connected and each part depends on the others
Sense.TRAN: 地球村〔用于强调世界上的一切都紧密联系﹑互相依存〕

Sense.DEF:
a general increase in world temperatures caused by increased amounts of
carbon dioxide
around the Earth
a round object with a map of the Earth drawn on it
the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: We export our goods all over the globe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的商品出口到世界各地。

Sense.DEF: an object shaped like a ball

an
artichoke
someone who spends a lot of their time travelling to many different countries
in the shape of a globule or a globe
a small drop of a liquid, or of a solid that has been melted
Sense.EXAMPLE: globules of fat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油滴

Sense.DEF:
relating to the connections or relationships between
global
and local businesses, problems etc
Sense.TRAN: 全球化和本土化兼顾的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glocal approach to crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整合国内﹑国际力量打击犯罪的方法

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument consisting of many flat metal bars of different lengths, that you play with special hammers
to become attached to someone or something so strongly that it is difficult to break the attachment
Sense.EXAMPLE: The antibodies glom onto the virus and destroy it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗体附着在病毒上将其摧毁。

Sense.DEF: to be very attracted to an idea, opinion, style etc
Sense.TRAN: 非常喜欢〔某种观点﹑看法﹑风格等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: College students have glommed onto the new African styles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学生们深深地迷上了这种新的非洲风格。

Sense.DEF: almost complete darkness
Sense.EXAMPLE: He peered into the gathering increasing gloom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在渐深的暮色中眺望远方。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of great sadness and lack of hope
Sense.EXAMPLE: a time of high unemployment and economic gloom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业率高﹑经济惨淡的一段时间

Sense.DEF: making you feel that things will not improve
Sense.TRAN: 令人沮丧的﹐令人扫兴的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report paints a gloomy picture of the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

Sense.DEF: sad because you think the situation will not improve
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne dismissed these gloomy thoughts from her mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮抛开了心里这些沮丧的念头。

Sense.DEF: dark, especially in a way that makes you feel sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a gloomy room with one small window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里阴森森的﹐只有一扇小窗。

Sense.DEF: a thick soft wet mass of something
made to seem like something more important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many bosses view secretaries as no more than glorified typists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多老板认为秘书其实就是打字员﹐只不过称呼好听点。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something seem more important or better than they really are
Sense.EXAMPLE: films which glorify violence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美化暴力的影片

Sense.DEF: to praise someone or something, especially God
Sense.TRAN: 赞美﹐颂扬〔某人或某物﹐尤指上帝〕

Sense.DEF: having or deserving great fame, praise, and honour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a truly glorious future
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无比美好的将来
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glorious victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光荣的胜利

Sense.DEF: very beautiful or impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: glorious views of the coast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿海的迷人景色
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glorious red sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被染成红色的绚丽天空

Sense.DEF: glorious weather is sunny and hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: glorious sunshine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灿烂的阳光

Sense.DEF: extremely enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a glorious afternoon of sailing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出海航行﹐度过了一个美好的下午。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say great rather than glorious .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说great﹐而不说glorious
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He’s got a great future ahead of him.
The house has great views.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子可以看到非常美的景色。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The weather’s been great .

Sense.DEF: the importance, honour, and praise that people give someone they admire a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dreamt of future glory as an Olympic champion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她梦想着将来能得到奥运冠军的荣誉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goran’s moment of glory came when he defeated Rafter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戈兰击败拉夫特﹐迎来了荣耀的一刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He began the season in a blaze of glory , scoring seven goals in as many games.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个赛季一开始他便光芒四射﹐七场比赛进了七个球。

Sense.DEF: an achievement that is greatly admired or respected, or makes you very proud
Sense.TRAN: 辉煌的成就﹔荣耀的事﹐值得骄傲的事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: one of the finest artistic glories of Florence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛罗伦萨最辉煌的艺术成就之一

Sense.EXAMPLE: monuments to past glories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纪念昔日荣耀的丰碑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Becoming a Supreme Court judge was the crowning glory most successful part of her career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为最高法院法官是她事业上的至高荣耀。

Sense.DEF: when something is beautiful and impressive in appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: They spent $10 million restoring the theatre to its former glory .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们斥资1,000万美元使剧院恢复了昔日的辉煌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sun emerged from behind the clouds in all its glory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳穿云而出﹐壮丽无比。

Sense.DEF: to share some of the importance and praise that belongs to someone close to you
Sense.TRAN: 分享某人/某事带来的荣誉﹐沾某人/某事的光

Sense.DEF: a time in the past when someone was admired
Sense.EXAMPLE: the team’s glory days in the late ’80s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队在80年代末的光辉岁月

Sense.DEF: in order to increase the honour that is given to someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 为了（增加）某人/某事的荣耀
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cathedral was built to the greater glory of God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建造这座教堂是为了彰显上帝的荣耀。

Sense.DEF: used to say that God deserves praise, honour, and thanks
to enjoy or be proud of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t like to glory in her past victories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不喜欢躺在过去的功劳簿上不思进取。

Sense.DEF: a bright shine on a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: This gel will add gloss to even the dullest hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用了这种发胶﹐即使最干枯的头发也会增添光泽。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The silverware had been polished to a high gloss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些银质器具被擦得锃亮。

Sense.DEF: an attractive appearance on the surface of something that may hide something less pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beneath the gloss of success was a tragic private life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功的光鲜外表下是悲惨的个人生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The injury to Keane took the gloss off Manchester United’s victory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基恩的受伤使曼联队的胜利失色不少。

Sense.DEF: a note in a piece of writing that explains a difficult word, phrase, or idea
a description or explanation that makes something seem more attractive or acceptable than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister was accused of putting a gloss on the government’s poor performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位部长被指责粉饰政府的无能。

Sense.DEF: a surface or photograph that has been made shiny
paint that looks shiny after it dries
to provide a note in a piece of writing, explaining a difficult word, phrase, or idea
to avoid talking about something unpleasant, or to say as little as possible about it
Sense.TRAN: 避免谈论〔不愉快的事情〕﹔对…轻描淡写
Sense.EXAMPLE: She glossed over the details of her divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对离婚的细节含糊其词。

Sense.DEF: a list of special words and explanations of their meanings, often at the end of a book
shiny and smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: her glossy black hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那亮泽的黑发
Sense.EXAMPLE: the glossy surface of the leaves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叶子光亮的表面

Sense.DEF: a magazine etc printed on good quality shiny paper, usually with lots of colour pictures
Sense.TRAN: 用高光纸印刷的杂志/小册子等

Sense.DEF: something that is glossy has an attractive appearance on the surface that may hide something less pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glossy election campaign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浮华的竞选活动

Sense.DEF: a magazine that is printed on good quality shiny paper, usually with lots of colour pictures
a photograph printed on shiny paper
a speech sound made by completely closing and then opening your glottis, which in some forms of spoken English may take the place of a /t/ between vowel sounds or may be used before a vowel sound

the space between your
vocal cords
which helps to make the sound of your voice. When this space is opened and closed, the movement produces a sound.
a piece of clothing that you wear on your hand in order to protect it or keep it warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of gloves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副手套
Sense.EXAMPLE: boxing gloves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拳击手套

PIC.HEADING: GLOVES 手套
PIC.PICCONTENT: leather gloves 皮手套；boxing gloves 拳击手套；oven gloves BrE【英】/oven mitts AmE【美】烤箱隔热手套；gardening gloves 园艺手套；mittens 连指手套；rubber gloves 橡胶手套；cycling gloves 骑行手套；surgical gloves 手术手套

Sense.DEF: used to say that people are ready to begin a fight or argument
Sense.TRAN: 拉开架势〔表示准备好打架或争论〕

Sense.DEF: a small cupboard in a car in front of the passenger seat, where things such as maps can be kept
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车前排座位前存放地图等小物件的〕杂物箱

Sense.DEF: wearing a glove

a
puppet
that you put over your hand
a soft steady light

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the glow from the dying fire
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 快要熄灭的火光

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the dim glow of the lightbulb
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯泡发出的昏暗的光
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the warm glow of the setting sun
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 落日的温暖余晖
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the green glow of the computer monitor
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑显示器发出的绿光

Sense.DEF: the pink colour in your face or body that you have when you are healthy, have been doing exercise, or are excited
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体健康﹑运动后或兴奋时脸部或身体发出的〕红润光泽﹐红晕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a healthy glow in her cheeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上泛着健康的红晕。

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of pleasure etc
Sense.TRAN: 强烈的愉快/满足/幸福等感觉
