Sense.DEF:
a type of
credit card
that gives you special advantages such as a high spending limit
an attractive woman who uses her looks to get money from rich men
gold in the form of a fine powder
to be very valuable and difficult to find

Sense.DEF: having a bright yellow colour like gold

Sense.DEF: a good chance to get something valuable or to be very successful

Sense.DEF: someone who is popular and successful

Sense.DEF: a golden period of time is one of great happiness or success

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the golden years of childhood

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is in a very good situation and is likely to be successful

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果正好有慧眼识人的编辑看中你的文章﹐你就有希望了。

Sense.DEF: made of gold

Sense.DEF: the date that is exactly 50 years after the beginning of something, especially a wedding

Sense.DEF: a large light brown bird that lives in northern parts of the world

in some games of football, the first goal scored in
extra time
. The team that scores the goal wins the game.

Sense.DEF:
things such as a large

or a good

Sense.DEF: a large amount of money given to someone when they leave their job

a small pale

Sense.DEF: a large dog with light brown fur

Sense.DEF: an area of land where gold can be found

the use of the value of gold as a fixed standard on which to base the value of money
a game in which the players hit a small white ball into holes in the ground with a set of golf clubs, using as few hits as possible

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他星期天都去打高尔夫球。

a long wooden or metal stick used for hitting the ball in the game of golf

a person or organization that is very large and powerful. This name comes from a story in the Bible. A

a child’s

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
go

Subsense.DEF: to be no longer in a particular place

Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门砰地响了一声﹐他走了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I turned round for my bag and it was gone.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我转身去拿我的包﹐可是包已经不见了。

Subsense.DEF: to be dead or to no longer exist

Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妻子去世几年了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Many of the old houses are gone now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多老房子现在已经没有了。

Sense.DEF: to be very attracted to someone of the opposite sex

Sense.DEF:
to have been
pregnant
for five, six etc months

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到家时已经过了半夜。

Sense.DEF: if someone is a goner, they are soon going to die, fall, be caught etc

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人从背后打我﹐我以为这下完了。

Sense.DEF: a round piece of metal that hangs in a frame and which you hit with a stick to give a deep ringing sound. It is used as a musical instrument or to announce that a meal is ready.

a
medal
, title, or prize that someone is given
a way of saying ‘going to’

Sense.DEF: an unpleasantly sticky substance

Sense.DEF: of a high standard or quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: a good hotel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家不错的宾馆
Sense.EXAMPLE: good quality cloth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质布料

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车服务不是很好。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的法语比西班牙语好。

Sense.DEF: able to do something well

GramExa.PROPFORM: do/make a good job (of doing sth)

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克把窗户漆得很好。

Sense.DEF: used about something that is what you want or happens in the way that you want

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是好消息啊！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need a bit of good luck .

Sense.DEF: pleasant and enjoyable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s good to see you again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很高兴再次见到你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you have a good vacation?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你假期里玩得开心吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: That was good fun .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那很好玩。

Sense.DEF: likely to be successful or correct

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s full of good ideas .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她满脑子都是好主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, can you think of a better plan?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么﹐你能想出更好的计划吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the best way to deal with this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事怎样处理最好呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have a pretty good idea who did it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方很清楚这是谁干的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure, but I could make a good guess .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能确定﹐但是差不多猜得出来。

Sense.DEF: suitable or convenient
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is this a good time to talk to you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在和你谈谈方便吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a good place to rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个休息的好去处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a good day for going to the beach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的天气去海滩玩很合适。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ten o’clock is good for me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 10点钟我没问题。

Sense.DEF: useful or helpful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want some good advice ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想不想听听好的建议？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The best thing you can do is wait here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好的办法就是在这里等着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should make good use of your time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该善用时间。

Sense.DEF: behaving well and not causing any trouble – used especially about a child
Sense.TRAN: 表现好的﹐乖的〔尤指小孩〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s such a good baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她真是个乖宝宝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids were as good as gold very good .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们都很乖。

Sense.DEF: likely to make you healthy, either physically or mentally

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fresh fruit and vegetables are good for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新鲜的水果和蔬菜对你有益。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Watching too much TV isn’t good for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视看得太多不好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have to learn which wild foods are good to eat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们必须学会辨别哪些野菜野果能吃。

Sense.DEF: likely to improve the condition of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: products that are good for the environment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有益于环境的产品
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The publicity has been good for business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告宣传对生意很有帮助。

Sense.GRAM: used especially in negatives and comparatives
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 尤用于否定式和比较级
Sense.DEF: healthy or well
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How are you?’ ‘Better, thanks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你怎么样？”“好些了﹐谢谢。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lyn’s not feeling too good today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琳恩今天身体不适。

Sense.DEF: if the condition of something is good, it is not damaged or weak

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s in pretty good condition for an old car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以旧车来说﹐这样的车况算是不错了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Boris had always kept his body in good shape.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍里斯的身体一向保养得很好。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Chancellor announced that the economy is in good shape.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总理宣布经济状况良好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Once the boat’s repaired, it’ll be as good as new in perfect condition .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船修好了以后就会和新的一样。

GramExa.GLOSS: the one that is not damaged
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某人的那只好眼睛/那条好胳膊/那条好腿等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sat up, supporting himself on his good arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用自己的那条好胳膊支撑着坐了起来。

Sense.DEF: kind and understanding about what other people need or want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dad lent me the money. He was very good about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸把钱借给我了﹐对比他毫不吝啬。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was good of him to offer you a lift.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他真好﹐让你搭他的车。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s always been very good to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司一向对我很好。

Sense.DEF: behaving correctly or being right according to accepted moral standards
Sense.EXAMPLE: a good man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个好人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I try to be good, but it isn’t always easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想做个好人﹐可这并非总是一件容易的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, that’s my good deed for the day something good you try to do for someone else every day .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐这是我今天做的好事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m on the side of the good guys people who behave in a morally right way, for example in a film .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我支持好人。

Sense.DEF: large in amount, size, range etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had a good crop of apples.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的苹果大丰收。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a good range of leisure facilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有很多娱乐设施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d been waiting a good while a fairly long time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经等了好久了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our team has a good chance of winning is fairly likely to win .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们队获胜机会很大。

Sense.DEF: a good price is reasonable and not expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thirty dollars sounds like a good price to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 30 美元在我看来是个合理的价格。

Sense.DEF: doing something for a long time, so that you do it completely and thoroughly
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need a good rest .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要好好休息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take a good look at it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好好看一看它。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat down and had a good cry .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐下来痛哭了一场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This time he waited until he was good and ready completely ready .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一次他一直等到完全准备好了。

Sense.DEF: a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: It cost a good deal, I can tell you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以告诉你﹐这要很多钱。

GramExa.PROPFORM: a good deal of trouble/time/work etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I went to a good deal of trouble to get this ticket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我费了好大劲才弄到这张票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was a good deal older than her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他比她大很多。

Sense.DEF: something that is good value is not expensive, or is worth what you pay for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The three-course menu is good value for money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种三道菜的套餐物有所值。

Subsense.DEF: able to be used for a particular period of time
Subsense.TRAN: 能使用〔多久〕﹐〔多长时间内〕有效

GramExa.PROPFORM: good for one month/a year etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your passport is good for another three years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的护照还可以用三年。

Subsense.DEF: likely to continue living or being useful for a particular time or distance, even though old or not in good condition
Subsense.TRAN: 能维持〔一段时间〕﹐能持续〔一段距离〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: good for some time/a hundred miles etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This old truck is good for another 100,000 miles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆旧卡车还能跑十万英里。

Subsense.DEF: likely to give you something or provide something
Subsense.TRAN: 可能会给予某物﹐可能会提供某物
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Dad should be good for a few bucks.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸应该会给我几块钱的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a good three miles/ten years etc
Sense.DEF: at least three miles, ten years etc, and probably more
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good mile away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少有一英里的路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a good ten years younger than her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他比她至少小十岁。

Sense.DEF: almost

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The summer’s as good as over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天差不多已经过去了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This carpet’s as good as ruined.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块地毯差不多已经不能用了。

Sense.DEF: a fairly large number of things or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve done this a good few times now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事我到现在已经做了许多遍了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good many people were upset about the new tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人都对新的税项不满。

Sense.LEXUNIT: too good to be true/to last
Sense.DEF: so good that you cannot believe it is real, or you expect something bad to happen
Sense.TRAN: 好得令人难以置信/让人觉得难以持久
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their relationship had always seemed too good to be true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的关系一向好得不像是真的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think the second person does not deserve to have a relationship with the first
Sense.TRAN: 某人好得让另一人配不上
Sense.EXAMPLE: George is a good lad, too good for you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治是个优秀青年﹐你配不上！

Sense.DEF: if you do something in your own good time, you do it only when you are ready to do it, rather than when other people want you to
Sense.TRAN: 在自己认为合适的时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll tell him in my own good time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在合适的时候会告诉他的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in good time (for sth/to do sth)
Sense.DEF: if you do something in good time, you do it early enough to be ready for a particular time or event
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben arrived in good time for dinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本到达时正好赶上吃晚饭。

Sense.LEXUNIT: hanging/shooting etc is too good for sb
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has done something so bad that they deserve the most severe punishment available
Sense.TRAN: 绞死某人/枪毙某人等还便宜了他

Sense.LEXUNIT: as good a time/place etc as any
Sense.DEF: used to say that although a time etc is not perfect, there will probably not be a better one
Sense.TRAN: 这个时间/地方等也不错〔表示虽不完美﹐但也没有更好的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suppose this is as good a place as any to stay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看待在这里也不错。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be as good as your word
Sense.DEF: to do something that you promised to do
Sense.TRAN: 说到做到﹐说话算数﹐守信用

Sense.DEF: something good that you say about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 为某人/某事物说的一句好话
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan put in a good word for you at the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹在会上为你说了句好话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one had a good word to say for her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人说她好话。

Sense.DEF: if you are in someone’s good books, they are pleased with you or your work
Sense.TRAN: 受某人另眼相看﹐得到某人的欢心
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll ask my boss for the day off – I’m in her good books just now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要向老板请一天假——现在她对我青睐有加。

Sense.DEF: to have or be doing something that is successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve got a good thing going with that little shop of theirs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的那家小店生意做得很红火。

Sense.DEF: to have found an easy way of being successful or getting what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andrew knew when he was onto a good thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁知道什么时候是获取成功的时机。

Sense.DEF: to become successful and rich after being poor – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 获得成功﹔发迹〔尤用于报纸报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country boy who made good in New York
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在纽约发迹的一个乡下男孩

Sense.DEF: to pay someone money that you owe, or to provide money to replace what has been lost – used especially in business
Sense.TRAN: 偿还债务/赔偿损失等〔尤用于商业领域〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The loss to the company was made good by contributions from its subsidiaries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的这一损失由子公司上缴的利润弥补了。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in escaping
an expensive way of living with good food, fast cars etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: his weakness for women and the good life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他贪恋女色和奢靡生活的毛病

Sense.DEF: the good times in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: We talked for hours about the good old days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谈了很久﹐回忆过去的美好时光。

Sense.DEF: things that someone does to help other people, especially people with problems
help that someone provides, especially someone in a position of power
someone who gives help to people in trouble
the Bible

Crossrefto.REFLEX: give as good as you get

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you are pleased about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Good. I’m glad that’s finished.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了。 我很高兴那件事做完了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I got an A in Biology, Mum.’ ‘ Oh, good. ’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我生物考了A﹐妈妈。”“哦﹐很好。”

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that you think their work or what they are doing is good
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is the answer five?’ ‘Yes, good.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “答案是5吗？”“对﹐很好。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you approve of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve booked a table.’ ‘Oh, that’s good.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我订了位子。”“哦﹐很好。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has just said or suggested something interesting or important that you had not thought of before
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘But it’s Sunday, the bank will be closed.’ ‘Good point.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “可今天是星期天﹐银行不开门。”“说得对。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you hope that someone is successful or that something good happens to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good luck in your exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 祝你考试好运。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you hope someone is successful, even if you think this is unlikely
Sense.TRAN: 祝他/他们等好运〔表示尽管认为某人成功的可能性不大﹐但仍祝其成功〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘They’re hoping to finish it by November.’ ‘Good luck to them.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们希望11月之前完成。”“祝他们好运。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you approve of something that someone has done
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve decided to accept the job.’ ‘Good for you.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我决定接受这份工作了。” “挺好的。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are glad something happened, because there would have been problems if it had not happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good thing you’re at home. I’ve lost my keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸亏你在家﹐我的钥匙丢了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s gone, and a good thing too.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走了﹐倒也是好事。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not satisfied with something and that you are annoyed about it
Sense.TRAN: 那/这不好〔表示对某事不满和气恼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just not good enough. I’ve been waiting an hour!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太可恶﹐我等了一个小时了！

Sense.DEF: to be completely ready
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll go when I’m good and ready and not before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等我准备就绪我们就走﹐没弄好不能走。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you do not believe something they have said and think it is a joke or a trick
Sense.EXAMPLE: You won $50,000? That’s a good one!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你中了五万美元？开玩笑吧！

Sense.DEF: to be enjoyable or amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s Hazel’s party tomorrow. Should be good for a laugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天是黑兹尔的派对﹐应该很好玩。

Sense.DEF: used to praise someone, especially because they have behaved in the way that you expect them to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good old Ed! I knew he wouldn’t let us down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德是好样的！ 我知道他不会让我们失望的。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise or anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s going to cost us £500.’ ‘Good grief!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们得花500英镑。”“天啊！”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they have done something well
used to tell a child or animal that they have behaved well or done something well
Sense.TRAN: 好孩子/狗狗等〔用于表扬小孩或动物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit! Good dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐下！乖狗狗。

Sense.LEXUNIT: if you know what’s good for you
Sense.DEF: used in a threatening way to tell someone to do something or something bad will happen to them
Sense.TRAN: 你要是知道好歹〔用于威胁某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do as he says, if you know what’s good for you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你知道好歹的话﹐就照他说的做吧！

Sense.LEXUNIT: would you be good enough to do sth

Variant.LEXVAR: would you be so good as to do sth

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone very politely to do something
Sense.TRAN: 你能否…？〔用来客气地请对方做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you be good enough to help me with my bags?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你帮我搬一下这些行李﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: used when someone wants to do something soon but you want to wait a little
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘When can we open our presents, Mum?’ ‘All in good time, Billy.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们什么时候能打开礼物呢﹐妈妈？”“别急﹐比利。”

Sense.DEF: used to say goodbye and to wish someone a nice day
Sense.TRAN: 再见﹐祝你有愉快的一天

Sense.DEF: to be ready to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got my shoes and I’m good to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鞋子穿上了﹐我都准备好了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be as good as it gets
Sense.DEF: if a situation is as good as it gets, it is not going to improve
Sense.TRAN: 情况就这样了〔表示不会有好转〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enjoy yourself while you can. This is as good as it gets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就能享受且享受吧﹐反正事情就这样了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation is good or acceptable, or that there is not a problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry about it, man – it’s all good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心了﹐伙计﹐没有问题的。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone in a position of authority that you will do what they have asked
Sense.TRAN: 是﹐好的〔用于对有权势的人说话﹐表示将按其吩咐去做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Tell the men to come in.’ ‘Very good, sir.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “叫那些人进来。”“是﹐老爷。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you approve of something someone has done
Sense.TRAN: 太好了﹐真棒〔对某人所做之事表示赞同〕

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法: good, well
F2NBox.EXPL: Good is not used as an adverb in standard English. Use well .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在规范的英语中不用good作副词﹐要用well
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He speaks English extremely well (NOT 不说 extremely good).
F2NBox.EXPL: The comparative form of both good and well is better .
F2NBox.TRAN: good和well的比较级形式都是better
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His first book was better. (adj)
We’ll play better next time. (adv)
F2NBox.EXPL: The superlative form of both good and well is best .
F2NBox.TRAN: good和well的最高级形式都是best
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Who is the best singer? (adj)
How could this best be achieved? (adv)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事最好能通过什么方法来实现？

Exponent.DEF: of a high standard or quality
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve just read a really good book.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚读了一本很好的书。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My French is not very good.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我法语不太好。

Exponent.DEF: pleasant and enjoyable. Nice is very common in spoken English. In written English, it is better to use other words.
Exponent.TRAN: 舒适的﹐愉快的〔口语中常用nice﹐书面语中最好使用其他单词〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I hope you have a nice vacation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 祝你假期愉快。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It will be nice to see you again.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望能再见到你。

Exponent.DEF: well made from good materials
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you buy good quality shoes, they last much longer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你买质量好的鞋子﹐就会耐穿很多。

Exponent.DEF: used for describing things of a very high quality, or weather with no rain and clear skies
Exponent.TRAN: 好的﹐不错的﹔〔天气〕晴朗的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The restaurant serves the finest food in Florence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐厅的饭菜是佛罗伦萨最好的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If it’s fine tomorrow, we’ll go for a walk.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天如果天气好﹐我们就去散步。

Exponent.DEF: good – used when you like something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: That’s a neat idea.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这主意不错。

Exponent.DEF: an attractive offer, course of action etc seems good and makes you want to accept it or do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Going home for dinner was a more attractive proposition than completing his run.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家吃晚饭比起完成跑步对他来说更具吸引力。

Exponent.DEF: something that is impressive is good in a way that makes people admire it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an impressive achievement
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 了不起的成就

Section.SECHEADING: EXTREMELY GOOD 非常好的﹐出色的

Exponent.DEF: extremely good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Your English is excellent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的英文棒极了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s a superb teacher.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一位出色的教师。

Exponent.DEF: extremely good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a great film.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影很棒。

Exponent.DEF: extremely good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The play was absolutely brilliant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部戏绝对精彩。

Exponent.DEF: extremely good, in a surprising and exciting way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: New York is an amazing place.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约是个令人惊叹的城市。

Exponent.DEF: used about weather that is very pleasant and sunny
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a beautiful day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气很好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The weather was just glorious.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气真是非常好。

Exponent.DEF: much better than other places, people etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an outstanding performance
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 精彩的表演
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The service is always first-class.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务总是一流的。

Exponent.DEF: unusually good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Occasionally, we get a student with exceptional talent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔我们会招到个别天赋出众的学生。

Exponent.DEF: very good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The movie was awesome.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影好极了。

Exponent.DEF: to be extremely good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their chocolate cake is just out of this world!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的巧克力蛋糕真是好得没比的了！

Sense.LEXUNIT: no good/not much good/not any good

Subsense.DEF: not useful or suitable
Subsense.EXAMPLE: One lesson’s not much good – you need five or six.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堂课没有用——要五六堂课才行。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I could come next week.’ ‘That’s no good. I’ll be away.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我可以下个礼拜来。”“那不行﹐我不在。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The land here isn’t any good for agricultural crops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的土地不适合种庄稼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re no good to me if you can’t drive a car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不能开车﹐对我就没有用。

Subsense.DEF: of a low standard or level of ability
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The movie wasn’t much good.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片不是很好。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is the new headteacher any good?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新校长好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m no good at speaking in public.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不太擅长当众说话。

Subsense.DEF: morally bad
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Stay away from Jerry – he’s no good.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离杰里远点——他不是什么好东西。

Sense.DEF: used to say that an action will not achieve what it is intended to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s no good telling him – he won’t listen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟他说没有用——他不会听的。

Sense.DEF: to have a useful effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: She works for a small charity where she feels she can do some good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一家小慈善机构工作﹐觉得自己在那里能做点有用的事情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll talk to him but I don’t think it will do any good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会找他谈谈﹐但我觉得不会有用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A bit more exercise would do you good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍微多锻炼锻炼对你有好处。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what’s the good of...?/what good is...?
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is not worth doing or having something in a particular situation …
Sense.TRAN: 有什么用？〔用于表示不值得做某事或拥有某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the good of buying a boat if you’re too busy to use it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你忙得连用的时间都没有﹐那买了船有什么意义？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: money when you haven’t any friends?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果没有朋友﹐钱有什么用？

Sense.DEF: permanently
Sense.EXAMPLE: The injury may keep him out of football for good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次受伤可能会使他永远告别足球。

Sense.DEF: in order to help someone or improve a situation
Sense.TRAN: 为了某人/某物的利益[好处]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must work together for the good of the community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了社区的利益我们必须共同努力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take the medicine – it’s for your own good !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把药吃了——那是为你自己好！

Sense.DEF: behaviour, attitudes, forces etc that are morally right
Sense.TRAN: 善﹐正直的行为﹐合乎道德的态度
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is definitely an influence for good on those boys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对那些男孩绝对能产生好的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a lot of good in him, in spite of his rudeness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他虽然粗鲁﹐但也有很多优点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the struggle between good and evil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 善恶之争

Sense.DEF: to be doing or planning something wrong or dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 正在做坏事﹔打算做坏事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those guys look like they’re up to no good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些家伙好像不是在干什么好事。

Sense.DEF: the advantage of everyone in society or in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: countries united for the common good
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了共同的利益而联合起来的国家

Sense.DEF: used to say that something that happens is good, especially when it is in addition to or as the result of something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: If further improvements can be made, that would be all to the good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果还能改进﹐那就更好了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: three goals/£200 etc to the good
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has more of something than before or than someone else
Sense.TRAN: 领先三个球/多出200英镑等
Sense.EXAMPLE: With United two goals to the good, the result seemed a certainty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联队领先两个球﹐比分似乎已经无法改变了。

Sense.DEF: well. Many teachers think this is not correct English
Sense.TRAN: 好〔许多老师认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business is doing good now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在生意做得很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Listen to me good!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好好听我说！

Sense.DEF: used to say hello when you are greeting someone in the afternoon, especially someone you do not know
Sense.TRAN: 下午好〔尤用于和不认识的人打招呼〕

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In informal everyday English, people often just say Afternoon . If you don’t want to sound formal or informal, you can just say Hello .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在非正式日常英语中﹐人们常常只说Afternoon。如果想避免听起来正式或非正式﹐说Hello即可
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Afternoon , everyone.

Sense.DEF: used when you are leaving someone, or when they are leaving
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goodbye, John, see you tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再见﹐约翰﹐明天见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just have to say goodbye to Jane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得跟简道别。

GramExa.GLOSS: say goodbye to several people or everyone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We said our goodbyes and left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们告辞后便离开了。

Sense.DEF:
a type of
cholesterol chemical substance found in your blood
that carries bad cholesterol away from your arteries
(artery)
and back to your
liver
, helping to protect you against heart disease
used to say hello or goodbye, especially in the morning or afternoon
Sense.TRAN: 日安﹐你好﹐再见〔尤用于上午或下午打招呼及道别〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must get back. Good day to you .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得回去了﹐再见。

Sense.DEF: used to say hello when you are greeting someone in the evening, especially someone you do not know
Sense.TRAN: 晚上好〔尤用于和不认识的人打招呼〕

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In informal everyday English, people often just say Evening . If you don’t want to sound formal or informal, you can just say Hello .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在非正式日常英语中﹐人们常常只说Evening。如果想避免听起来正式或非正式﹐说Hello就行了
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Evening , Tom.

Sense.DEF: when a person, country etc intends to be honest and sincere and does not intend to deceive anyone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company had acted in good faith .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司诚实无欺。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A ceasefire was declared as a sign of good faith.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一种善意表示宣布了停火。

Sense.DEF: a good-for-nothing person is lazy and useless
Sense.EXAMPLE: an idle good-for-nothing drunk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个懒惰﹑没用的酒鬼

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩是个一无是处的饭桶。

Sense.DEF:
the Friday before the Christian holiday of Easter, that Christians remember as the day Jesus Christ was
crucified
Sense.TRAN: 受难日〔复活节前的星期五〕

Sense.DEF: kind and generous
a happy friendly character or attitude to life
Sense.TRAN: 愉快的心情﹐好脾气﹔乐观的人生态度
Sense.EXAMPLE: At 80 her eyes still sparkled with good humour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她80岁了﹐眼神里依然闪烁着乐观的光芒。

Sense.DEF: someone in a book or film who is good and does things you approve of
Sense.EXAMPLE: the goodies and the baddies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好人和坏人

Sense.DEF: fairly good but not very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is the pay good?’ ‘Goodish.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “工资满意吗？”“还可以吧。”

Sense.DEF: a fairly long way, a fairly large number etc
someone who is good-looking is attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a really good-looking guy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长得很漂亮的家伙

Sense.DEF: the attractive appearance of someone’s face
Sense.EXAMPLE: his natural good looks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他天生的好相貌

Sense.DEF: a large amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: £1,500 is still a goodly sum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1,500英镑仍然是个大数目。

Sense.DEF: pleasant in appearance or good in quality
used to say hello when you are greeting someone in the morning

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In informal everyday English, people often just say Morning . If you don’t want to sound formal or informal, you can just say Hello .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在非正式日常英语中﹐人们常常只说Morning。如果想避免听起来正式或非正式﹐说Hello即可
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Morning , Joe.

Sense.DEF: the good opinion that people have of someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It threatened to damage the good name of the firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事危及公司的名声。

Sense.DEF: a naturally kind and helpful character or attitude to people
Sense.TRAN: 善良的品性﹐善良的心地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had his father’s good looks and his mother’s good nature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拥有父亲的好相貌和母亲的好心肠。

Sense.DEF: naturally kind and helpful and not easily made angry
Sense.TRAN: 善良的﹐心肠好的﹔性情温和的

Sense.DEF: when countries or people try to have friendly and helpful relationships with others that are near them
said when you are surprised or sometimes angry
Sense.TRAN: 天啊！啊呀！〔用于表示惊讶﹐有时也表示愤怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My goodness, you have spent a lot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊呀﹐你花了这么多钱！

Sense.DEF: said when you are annoyed or surprised, especially when telling someone to do something
Sense.TRAN: 看在老天爷的面上〔用来表示烦躁或惊讶﹐尤指要求某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: For goodness’ sake stop arguing!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看在老天爷的面上﹐别吵了！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are not sure about something, or to make a statement stronger
Sense.TRAN: 天晓得﹐谁也不知道〔用来强调对某事没有把握或加强语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That bar’s been closed for goodness knows how long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天晓得那家酒吧已经关了多久。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goodness knows, I tried to help him!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天晓得﹐我还想办法帮他哩！

Sense.DEF: the quality of being good
Sense.EXAMPLE: the desire to see goodness and justice in the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对善良和正义的向往

Sense.DEF: the part of food which is good for your health
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the goodness of an egg is in the yolk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋的营养全在蛋黄里。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have the goodness to do sth
Sense.DEF: used when asking someone to do something in an extremely polite way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please have the goodness to wait.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳驾您等一等。

Sense.LEXUNIT: out of the goodness of sb’s heart
Sense.DEF: used when someone has done something in order to be kind or helpful to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did it out of the goodness of his heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这么做是出于好心。

Sense.DEF: used to say goodbye when you are leaving someone or they are leaving at night, or before going to sleep
Sense.TRAN: 晚安〔晚上分别时或就寝前用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good night. Sleep well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚安﹐睡个好觉。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In informal everyday English, people often just say Night or, especially to children, Night night.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在非正式日常英语中﹐人们常常只说Night﹐或者Night night﹐后者尤在对孩童说话时使用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Night night , darling. See you in the morning.

Sense.DEF: things that are produced in order to be sold

GramExa.EXAMPLE: furniture and other household goods
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家具及其他家居用品

Sense.EXAMPLE: the large market for consumer goods televisions, washing machines etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庞大的消费品市场
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s leading exporter of manufactured goods things that are made, not grown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国主要的工业制成品出口商
Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be tax increases on a range of goods and services .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一些商品和服务将要增税。

Sense.DEF: things that someone owns and that can be moved
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were charged with handling stolen goods .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们因为买卖赃物被起诉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We collected up our goods and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收拾好东西就走了。

Sense.DEF: things which are carried by road, train etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a goods train
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一列货车

Sense.LEXUNIT: come up with the goods/deliver the goods
Sense.DEF: to do what is needed or expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a great player. He always comes up with the goods on the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一名优秀的球员﹐比赛中总能有令人满意的表现。

Sense.DEF: to have or find proof that someone is guilty of a crime
Sense.TRAN: 掌握某人的把柄﹐找到某人的罪证
Sense.EXAMPLE: Face it, Bukowski, we got the goods on you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 承认吧﹐布科夫斯基﹐我们找到你的罪证了！

Sense.DEF: someone whose actions mean that they no longer have a good effect or influence on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the scandal, he was considered damaged goods by the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑闻发生以后﹐他在党内被视为害群之马。

Sense.DEF: personal possessions
the quality someone has when they are able to make sensible decisions about what to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Booth showed a lot of good sense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布思夫人表现出了不俗的见地。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have the good sense to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mark had the good sense not to argue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克很明智地没有争辩。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It makes good sense is sensible to do some research before buying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 购买之前先做些调研﹐这是很明智的。

Sense.DEF: pleasant, kind, and not easily made angry
kind feelings towards or between people and a willingness to be helpful
Sense.EXAMPLE: A fund was set up as a goodwill gesture to survivors and their families.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成立了基金会﹐以向幸存者及其家属作出善意的表示。

GramExa.GLOSS: Christmas
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 互表友爱的季节〔指圣诞节〕

Sense.DEF: the value that a company has because it has a good relationship with its customers
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sale price also covers the goodwill of the business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 售价中还包含公司的商誉。

Sense.DEF: something that is nice to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: We bought lots of goodies for the picnic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为野餐买了许多好吃的。

Sense.DEF: something attractive, pleasant, or desirable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The competition gives you the chance to win all sorts of goodies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次比赛让你有机会赢取各种各样好玩的东西。

Sense.DEF:
a
goodie
a word used by children to express pleasure or excitement
someone who tries hard to be very good and helpful in order to please their parents, teachers etc – used especially by children to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 善于讨好卖乖的孩子﹐乖乖儿〔指尽量表现得好以取悦父母﹑老师等的人﹔尤为儿语﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: sticky and soft
Sense.EXAMPLE: gooey cakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黏软的糕饼
Sense.EXAMPLE: gooey mud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黏糊糊的烂泥

Sense.DEF: showing your love for someone in a way that other people think is silly
Sense.TRAN: 过分柔情的﹔甜腻缠绵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Babies make her go all gooey .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿使她变得百般柔情。

Sense.DEF: to make a silly mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somebody goofed and entered the wrong amount.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人犯了一个愚蠢的错误﹐把金额输错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant totally goofed up our reservations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐馆把我们的预订全部搞错了。

Sense.DEF: to spend time doing silly things or not doing very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent the afternoon just goofing around on our bikes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只是骑着自行车瞎转了一个下午。

Sense.DEF: to waste time or avoid doing any work
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been goofing off at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在学校里一直混日子。

Sense.DEF: a silly mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: The goof could cost the city $5 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个愚蠢的错误会使该市损失500万美元。

Sense.DEF: someone who is silly
someone who is silly or stupid
stupid or silly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A goofy grin spread across her face when she saw the card.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到卡片﹐脸上露出了傻傻的笑容。

Sense.DEF:
if you ride a
skateboard
or
snowboard
goofy footed, you ride with your right foot at the front of the board and your left foot at the back
Sense.TRAN: 〔在滑板或滑雪板上〕右脚在前左脚在后的

Sense.DEF:
a very popular
search engine computer program that allows you to search for information on the Internet
. Google also provides other Internet services including e-mail, maps,
social networking
, and video sharing.
Sense.TRAN: 谷歌〔一种搜索引擎﹐还提供电子邮件﹑地图﹑社交和视频分享等网络服务〕

Sense.DEF:
to put a word or words into a
search engine
, especially Google™, in order to search for information on the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 用搜索引擎搜索﹐用谷歌搜索
Sense.EXAMPLE: I googled her name and found out she runs her own company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用谷歌搜索她的姓名﹐发现她自己开有公司。

Sense.DEF:
a single result when you search for a combination of two words on the
search engine
Google. You do the search as a game.
Sense.TRAN: 谷歌纯命中〔使用谷歌搜索引擎输入两个词所获得的唯一结果〕

Sense.DEF:
a ball in the game of
cricket
that is thrown to an opponent so that it looks as if it will go in one direction but goes in the other
to ask someone a question that is intended to trick them
Sense.TRAN: 问某人一个刁钻的问题

Sense.DEF: the number that is written as the number 1 followed by 100 zeros, or 10 to the power 100
the number that is written as the number 1 followed by a googol of zeros, or 10 to the power googol
Sense.TRAN: 古戈尔普勒克斯〔即10的古戈尔次方〕

Sense.DEF:
a rude or humorous word meaning a
testicle
a silly or stupid person
a violent criminal who is paid to frighten or attack people
a thick slightly sticky substance

Subsense.DEF: a bird that is like a duck but is larger and makes loud noises
a female goose

PIC.HEADING: GOOSE 鹅
PIC.PICCONTENT: Canada goose 加拿大雁；gosling 小鹅；white goose 白鹅

Sense.DEF: the cooked meat of this bird
a silly person

Crossrefto.REFLEX: wouldn’t say boo to a goose
kill the goose that lays the golden egg
what’s sauce for the goose is sauce for the gander

Sense.DEF: to touch or press someone on their bottom as a joke
Sense.TRAN: 碰[戳]〔某人〕的屁股〔一种开玩笑的举动〕

Sense.DEF: a small round green fruit that grows on a bush and has a sour taste
to be with two people who are having a romantic relationship and who want to be alone together
Sense.TRAN: 当电灯泡〔指夹在想单独相处的情侣中间〕

Sense.DEF: small raised spots on your skin that you get when you are cold or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔因寒冷或害怕而起的〕鸡皮疙瘩

Sense.DEF: a way of marching by soldiers, in which they lift their legs quite high and do not bend their knees
a North and Central American animal like a large rat that lives in holes in the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔生活在北美洲和中美洲的〕囊地鼠

Sense.DEF: a computer program that helps people find and use information quickly on the Internet
Sense.TRAN: Gopher程序﹐地鼠程序〔供在因特网上快速查找资料的计算机程序〕

Sense.DEF: to quickly solve a difficult problem by determined action
Sense.TRAN: 〔大刀阔斧地〕解决难题﹐快刀斩乱麻
Sense.EXAMPLE: Governments have tried to cut the Gordian knot by reducing state support to the railways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府试图通过削减对铁路部门的资助来快速解决这个难题。

Sense.DEF:
if an animal gores someone, it wounds them with its horns or
tusks
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was attacked and gored by a bull.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他遭到一头公牛袭击﹐被顶伤了。

Sense.DEF: thick dark blood that has flowed from a wound
Sense.EXAMPLE: He likes movies with plenty of blood and gore violence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢看很暴力血腥的电影。

Sense.DEF: a deep narrow valley with steep sides
to feel very sick or angry, especially when you see or smell something very unpleasant
to eat until you are too full to eat any more
Sense.TRAN: 拼命地吃（某物）﹐饱食（某物）
Sense.EXAMPLE: We gorged ourselves on ripe plums.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们拼命地吃成熟的李子。

Sense.DEF: to be completely full of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The insect sucks until it is gorged with blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那虫子直到吸饱了血才停下来。

Sense.DEF: extremely beautiful or attractive
Sense.TRAN: 非常漂亮的﹐极其吸引人的

Sense.DEF: extremely beautiful or attractive
Sense.TRAN: 极其漂亮的﹐极其吸引人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you think of my new flatmate?’ ‘He’s absolutely gorgeous !’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你觉得我的新室友怎么样？”“他帅极了！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look gorgeous, Maria.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去非常漂亮﹐玛丽亚。

Sense.DEF: extremely pleasant or enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gorgeous cake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的蛋糕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel room had a gorgeous view.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那间客房窗外景色迷人。

Sense.DEF: one of the three sisters in ancient Greek stories who had snakes on their heads that made anyone who looked at them change into stone
Sense.TRAN: 戈耳工﹐蛇发女怪〔古希腊传说中蛇发三姐妹之一﹐见到她的人会变成石头〕

Sense.DEF: an ugly frightening woman

a very large African monkey that is the largest of the
apes
a man who is very large and who looks as if he might become violent
very stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gormless grin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咧嘴傻笑

Sense.DEF:
a
prickly
bush with bright yellow flowers, which grows in the countryside in Europe
clearly describing or showing violence, blood, and killing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gory horror movie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血腥的恐怖片
Sense.EXAMPLE: gory tales of murder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血腥的凶杀故事

Sense.DEF: all the details about an unpleasant or interesting event – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 骇人听闻的细节〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, I want to hear all the gory details.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我讲讲吧﹐我想听听这些骇人听闻的细节。

Sense.DEF: covered in blood
used to express surprise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gosh, it’s cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊呀﹐真冷啊。

Sense.DEF:
a young
goose
a protest against an employer in which the workers work as slowly as possible
one of the four books in the Bible about Christ’s life
Sense.TRAN: 福音书〔《圣经》中有关耶稣生平的四福音书之一〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Gospel according to St Luke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路加福音

Sense.DEF: the life of Christ and the ideas that he taught
Sense.TRAN: 福音〔指基督的生平和教诲〕

GramExa.GLOSS: tell people about it
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Missionaries were sent to preach the Gospel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传教士被派出去传福音。

Sense.EXAMPLE: gospel stories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福音故事

Sense.DEF: a set of ideas that someone believes in very strongly and tries to persuade other people to accept

GramExa.EXAMPLE: spreading the gospel of science
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传播科学真理

Sense.DEF: something that is completely true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t take everything she says as gospel don’t believe everything she says .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把她说的每句话都当真理。

Sense.DEF: a type of Christian music in which religious songs are sung very loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gospel choir
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福音唱诗班

Sense.DEF: a very light thin material

the light silky thread which
spiders
leave on grass and bushes
information that is passed from one person to another about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including unkind or untrue remarks
Sense.TRAN: 流言蜚语﹐闲言碎语﹐传闻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Here’s an interesting piece of gossip about Mrs Smith.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有一则关于史密斯夫人的有趣传闻。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the latest gossip ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近有些什么传闻？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want to hear some juicy gossip ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想听些有趣的传闻吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had no time for idle gossip .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有时间说长道短。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was common gossip how he felt about her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对她的看法﹐大家都在议论纷纷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You miss a lot of office gossip when you have a day off work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请一天假﹐你就会错过办公室里的许多小道消息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: On Sundays all the men gather in the square to exchange local gossip .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每到星期天﹐男人们就聚集在广场上﹐飞短流长地说一些当地的新闻。

Sense.DEF: a conversation in which you exchange information with someone about other people’s lives and things that have happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Phil’s in there, having a gossip with Maggie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔在那里面跟玛吉闲聊。

Sense.DEF: someone who likes talking about other people’s private lives – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 爱说长道短的人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rick’s a terrible gossip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克就爱说三道四。

Sense.DEF: to talk about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including remarks that are unkind or untrue

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole town was gossiping about them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全镇的人都在议论他们。

Sense.DEF: a regular article in a newspaper or magazine about the behaviour and private lives of famous people
Sense.TRAN: 〔报刊上有关名人行为和私生活的〕八卦专栏

Sense.DEF: a gossipy conversation, letter etc is informal and full of gossip
Sense.TRAN: 〔谈话﹑书信等〕说人闲话的﹐充满流言蜚语的﹐闲聊式的

Sense.DEF: a gossipy person likes to gossip
Sense.TRAN: 爱说闲话的﹐爱谈论别人私生活的
Sense.EXAMPLE: gossipy secretaries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱说闲话的秘书

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and a past participle of
get

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: You cannot use got on its own as a present tense meaning ‘have’ or ‘has’ in standard English. Say that someone has something or has got something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在标准英语中﹐ got不可以单独作为一般现在时使用﹐表示“有”的意思﹐正确的用法是have/has或have/has got
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We’ve got (NOT 不说 We got) some ideas.

Sense.DEF: a word meaning ‘I’ve got you’, used when you catch someone or trick them in some way
Sense.TRAN: 抓到你了﹐逮住你了﹔你上当了

Sense.DEF: a word meaning ‘I understand’
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Yeah, 5 o’clock, gotcha.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “好的﹐5点钟﹐我明白了。”

Sense.DEF:
a type of slow sad popular music that is played on electric
guitars
and
keyboards
Sense.TRAN: 哥特摇滚乐〔一种节奏缓慢﹑伤感的流行音乐﹐用电吉他和键盘乐器演奏〕

Sense.DEF: someone who likes goth music

the Gothic style of building was common in Western Europe between the 12th and 16th centuries and included tall pointed
arches
and windows and tall
pillars
Sense.TRAN: 哥特式的﹐哥特风格的〔12至16世纪流行于西欧的建筑风格﹐以尖拱﹑尖窗和高大的柱子为特征〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Gothic church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座哥特式教堂

Sense.DEF: a Gothic story, film etc is about frightening things that happen in mysterious old buildings and lonely places, in a style that was popular in the early 19th century
Sense.TRAN: 哥特派的〔指小说﹑电影等的风格﹐描写神秘古老建筑及荒僻地方的恐怖故事﹐该风格曾流行于19世纪初〕

Sense.DEF: Gothic writing, printing etc has thick decorated letters
Sense.TRAN: 哥特体的〔粗笔画加装饰的字体〕

Sense.DEF: the go-to person is someone who people always ask for help with a particular problem, because of their great skill or knowledge
Sense.TRAN: 有问必答的﹐总被找去解决问题的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the go-to guy for questions about spreadsheets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关电子表格的问题找他准没错。

Sense.DEF: a short form of 缩略式= ‘have got to’, ‘has got to’, ‘have got a’, or ‘has got a’, which most people think is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 必须﹐得〔大多数人认为这一形式不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We gotta go now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在得走了。

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
get

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In American English, gotten is the usual past participle of get .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在美国英语中﹐get的常用过去分词形式是gotten
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’d gotten an A on the test.
I heard they had gotten divorced.
F2NBox.EXPL: In the phrase have got to , meaning ‘must’, gotten is never used instead of got .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在短语have got to（必须）中﹐切不可用gotten来替代got
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The deaths have got to stop.
F2NBox.EXPL: In British English, gotten is not used. The past participle of get in British English is got .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英国英语中﹐get的过去分词是got﹐不用gotten
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I had got a letter from my sister in Australia.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我收到了姐姐从澳大利亚寄来的一封信。

Sense.DEF: a method of painting using colours that are mixed with water and made thicker with a type of glue
a picture painted in this way
to make a deep hole or cut in the surface of something
Sense.TRAN: 在〔某物表面〕凿洞﹐凿槽于
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took a knife and gouged a hole in the bottom of the boat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拿了一把刀﹐在船底凿了一个洞。

Sense.DEF: to form a hole, space etc by digging into a surface and removing material, or to remove material by digging

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A rough road had been gouged out of the rock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在岩石上凿出了一条崎岖的路。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Every week 30,000 tonnes of slate are gouged out of the mountains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 山上每个星期都开采出3万吨的板石。

Sense.DEF: to remove someone’s eyes with a pointed weapon
a hole or cut made in something, usually by a sharp tool or weapon
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常用利器等凿成的〕孔﹐洞﹐槽

Sense.DEF: a dish of meat cooked in liquid with a hot-tasting pepper, originally from Hungary
a round fruit whose outer shell can be used as a container, or the container made from this fruit
someone who likes to eat and drink a lot
producing or relating to very good food and drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gourmet cook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美食厨师
Sense.EXAMPLE: gourmet dinners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛宴

Sense.DEF: someone who knows a lot about food and wine and who enjoys good food and wine
a disease that makes your toes, fingers, and knees swollen and painful

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= governor 州长﹔总督

Sense.DEF: used in Internet addresses for government websites
Sense.TRAN: 政府机构〔用于政府网址中〕

Sense.DEF: to officially and legally control a country and make all the decisions about taxes, laws, public services etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the leaders who govern the country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治理这个国家的领导人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party had been governing for seven months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党执政已经有七个月了。

Sense.DEF: if rules, principles etc govern the way a system or situation works, they control how it happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: legislation governing the export of live animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管制活畜出口的法规
Sense.EXAMPLE: The universe is governed by the laws of physics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宇宙受到物理法则的支配。

Sense.DEF: the act or process of governing
Sense.TRAN: 统治﹐管理﹔统治方式﹐管理方法

Sense.DEF: a female teacher in the past, who lived with a rich family and taught their children at home
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时有钱人家的〕家庭女教师

Sense.DEF: having the power and authority to control an organization, country etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: FIFA is the governing body of world soccer the group of people who control it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际足联是世界足球运动的主管机构。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Democrats are now the governing party the party in power in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党现在是该国的执政党。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the governing class of ancient Rome
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古罗马的统治阶级

Sense.DEF: a principle that has the most important influence on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freedom of speech is one of the governing principles in a democracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 言论自由是民主国家的宗旨之一。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: the group of people who govern a country or state
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Government are planning further cuts in public spending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府正计划进一步削减公共支出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US government has tightened restrictions on firearms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国政府已经加强了对枪支的管制。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neither party had the majority necessary to form a government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个政党都没有获得组阁所必需的多数票。

GramExa.GLOSS: during the period of a government
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Structural reforms are unlikely under the present government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在本届政府执政期间不大可能进行结构改革。

Sense.DEF: a form or system of government
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people in the country support the return to democratic government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内大多数人都支持恢复民主政体。

Sense.DEF: the process or way of governing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What would the opposition do if they were in government governing the country ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果反对党执政﹐他们会怎么做？

Sense.EXAMPLE: the importance of good government in developing countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治国有道在发展中国家的重要性

Sense.DEF: the degree to which the government controls economic and social activities
Sense.TRAN: 政府掌控经济和社会活动的程度
Sense.EXAMPLE: The protest march was really about big government when the government controls many activities .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次抗议游行其实是针对大政府主义。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The UK government has offered to send aid.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国政府已表示会提供援助。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 工党/保守党/社会民主党等政府
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In August 1931 the Labour government collapsed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 1931年8月﹐工党政府倒台。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: government made up of members of more than one political party
that does not have enough politicians to control parliament
that deals with national rather than local things
in the US, the government of the whole country, rather than of the individual states

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Government spending on health care totals about $60 billion a year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府一年的医疗开支共约600亿美元。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A government minister said that there would be an inquiry.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位政府部长称将进行调查。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who works for a government in an official position
an organization run by the government
vote to choose a government
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government was elected last October.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本届政府于去年10月选出。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become the government
force it to lose power

Exponent.DEF: the group of people who govern a country or the system they use to govern it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The French government did not sign the agreement.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国政府没有签署此项协定。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a democratic system of government
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主政体

Exponent.DEF: the government of a country, especially one such as the US, which is led by a president
Exponent.TRAN: 政府〔尤指美国等由总统领导的政府〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Kennedy administration
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼迪政府
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the problems left by the previous administration
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 前一届政府遗留下来的问题

Exponent.DEF: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of
Exponent.TRAN: 〔未经公正选举产生的或者不被认可的〕政府,政权
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most people opposed the apartheid regime.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人都反对这个实行种族隔离的专制政府。

Exponent.DEF: a political system in which everyone can vote to choose the government, or a country that has this system
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The transition to democracy has not been easy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 向民主制度的过渡并非易事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In a democracy, people have freedom of speech.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在民主国家,人们享有言论自由。

Exponent.DEF: a country that has an elected government, and is led by a president, not a king or queen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mauritius became a republic in 1992.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛里求斯于1992年成为共和国。

Exponent.DEF: the system of having a king or queen as the head of state, or a country that has this system
Exponent.TRAN: 君主政体,君主制﹔君主国
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some monarchies have elected governments.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些君主制国家有民选政府。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: controversy about the institution of monarchy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于君主制度的争议

Section.SECHEADING: AN UNDEMOCRATIC GOVERNMENT 非民主政体

Exponent.DEF: a political system or country that has a dictator a leader who has complete power and who has not been elected
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Argentina was a military dictatorship until 1983.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1983年之前﹐阿根廷还是个军事专制国家。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hungary’s years of dictatorship
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 匈牙利实行独裁统治的年代

Exponent.DEF: used for describing countries in which ordinary people have no power and the government has complete control over everything
Exponent.EXAMPLE: totalitarian states such as Nazi Germany
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如纳粹德国之类的极权国家
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a totalitarian dictatorship
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 极权的独裁政府

Exponent.DEF: a country where the government strictly controls people’s freedom, for example to travel or to talk about politics
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s like living in a police state.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就像生活在警察国家。

Sense.DEF: of a government, or relating to government
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to restrict governmental power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 限制政府权力的尝试

GramExa.GLOSS: organization controlled by the government

Sense.DEF: a notice that must be put on products such as cigarettes, to warn people that they are dangerous to their health
Sense.TRAN: 政府健康警告〔指必须印在香烟等产品上的文字﹐警告人们该产品危害健康〕

Subsense.DEF: the person in charge of governing a state in the US
the person in charge of governing a country that is under the political control of another country

Sense.DEF: a member of a committee that controls an organization or institution
Sense.EXAMPLE: a school governor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校董事
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hospital’s board of governors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院的董事会

Sense.DEF: the person in charge of an institution
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prison governor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱长

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the governor of the central bank
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 央行行长

Sense.DEF:
a
guvnor

someone who represents the King or Queen of Britain in other Commonwealth countries which are not
republics
Sense.TRAN: 〔除英国外的英联邦国家中代表英国君主的〕总督
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Governor-General of Australia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚总督

Sense.DEF: the position of being governor, or the period during which someone is governor

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= government 政府

Sense.DEF: a long dress that a woman wears on formal occasions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a white silk wedding gown
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件白色的真丝结婚礼服

Sense.DEF: a long loose piece of clothing worn for special ceremonies by judges, teachers, lawyers, and members of universities
Sense.TRAN: 〔法官﹑教师﹑律师﹑大学成员在特殊仪式上穿的〕长袍

Sense.DEF: a long loose piece of clothing worn in a hospital by someone doing or having an operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hospital gown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院手术服

Sense.DEF: a doctor who is trained in general medicine and treats people in a particular area or town
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某一地区或城镇行医的〕全科医生﹐普通医师
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got an appointment with my GP at five o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我约好了5点见我的医生。

Sense.DEF: the average of a student’s marks over a period of time in the US education system
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国教育体制中的〕平均学分绩点

Sense.DEF:
a system that uses radio signals from
satellites
to show your exact position on the Earth on a special piece of equipment
to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: I grabbed my bag and ran off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我抓起我的包就跑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two men grabbed her and pushed her to the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子抓住她﹐把她推倒在地上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kay grabbed hold of my arm to stop herself falling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯抓住我的手臂﹐以免自己摔倒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I managed to grab the gun from Bowen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从鲍恩手里把枪夺了过来。

Sense.DEF: to get some food or sleep quickly because you are busy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you go and grab some sleep?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不赶紧去睡一会儿呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hang on while I grab a cup of coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍等一下﹐我赶紧弄杯咖啡喝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s grab a bite to eat before we go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走之前赶紧吃点什么吧。

Sense.DEF: to get something for yourself, sometimes in an unfair way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to get there early and grab good seats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量早点去﹐抢个好位子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob tried to grab all the profit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃想独吞全部利润。

Sense.DEF: to take an opportunity, accept an invitation etc immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you should grab your chance to travel while you’re young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得你应该趁年轻抓紧机会旅游。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She grabbed the opportunity to go to America.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抓住了这个赴美的机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Melanie grabbed at the invitation to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅拉妮连忙接受了邀请。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is our chance to grab a slice of this new market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我们在这个新市场上抢占一席之地的机会。

Sense.DEF: to get someone’s attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is full of good ideas to grab your students’ attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书里通篇都是如何吸引学生注意力的好方法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plight of the refugees immediately grabbed the headlines was the most important story in the newspapers .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民的困境立即成了报纸的头条新闻。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone if they would be interested in doing a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: How does the idea of a trip to Spain grab you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对去西班牙旅行的想法感兴趣吗？

Sense.DEF: to quickly and suddenly put out your hand to try and catch or get something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I grabbed at the glass just before it fell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼看杯子就要翻倒﹐我赶紧伸手去抓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucy grabbed for the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西伸手去抢钱。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly try to take hold of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as he turned his back, I made a grab for the revolver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 趁着他一转身的机会﹐我赶紧去抓手枪。

Sense.DEF: if a job, prize, opportunity etc is up for grabs, it is available for anyone who wants to try to have it
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作﹑奖金﹑机会等〕等待你去争取[赢取]

Sense.DEF: the act of getting something quickly, especially in a dishonest way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shameless power grab to eliminate opposition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为清除反对派而抢班夺权的无耻行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: Officials denounced the settlers’ land grab .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官员谴责拓荒者抢夺土地的行为。

Sense.DEF: a container filled with small presents that you put your hand in to pick one out
a mixture of different things or styles

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The treaty covers a grab bag of issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 条约中涵盖了多种问题。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which things are decided by chance
a smooth way of moving that looks natural, relaxed, and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lena moved with the grace of a dancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉娜走路姿势有着舞者般的优美。

Subsense.DEF: polite and pleasant behaviour
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The hotel maintains traditional standards of elegance, style, and grace.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店保持着传统的优雅体面格调。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have the grace to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t even have the grace to apologize he was not polite enough to apologize .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他甚至连道歉的气度都没有。

Subsense.DEF: the skills needed to behave in a way that is considered polite and socially acceptable
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Max definitely lacked social graces .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯显然缺少社交风度。

Sense.DEF: more time that is allowed to someone to finish a piece of work, pay a debt etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got a few days’ grace to finish my essay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的文章被宽限了几天完成。

Sense.DEF: in a willing and pleasant way, or an unwilling and angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kevin smiled and accepted his defeat with good grace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯文微笑着大大方方地接受了失败。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With typical bad grace, they refused to come to the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一向如此无礼﹐拒绝来参加聚会。

Sense.DEF: God’s kindness that is shown to people
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are saved by God’s grace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们蒙上帝的恩典得救。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there but for the grace of God (go I)
Sense.DEF: used to say that you feel lucky not to be in the same bad situation as someone else
Sense.TRAN: 若不是上帝开恩（我也会这样）

Sense.DEF: a prayer thanking God, said before a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father said grace .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲做了饭前祷告。

Sense.DEF: the state of someone’s soul when it is free from evil, according to Christian belief
Sense.TRAN: 灵魂的得救﹐蒙恩〔基督教里指某个人的灵魂得到宽恕〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died in a state of grace when God has forgiven you for the wrong things you have done .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死的时候灵魂得到了宽恕。

Sense.DEF:
used as a title when talking to or about a
duke
,
duchess
, or
archbishop
Sense.TRAN: 大人﹐夫人﹐阁下 〔对公爵﹑公爵夫人或大主教的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: three beautiful Greek goddesses who often appear in art
to bring honour to an occasion or group of people by coming to something – said humorously when someone comes late or does not often come to meetings etc
Sense.TRAN: 赏光〔幽默说法﹐意指某人迟到﹐或不常出席会议等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ah, so you’ve decided to grace us with your presence!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐这么说你决定赏光出席了！

Sense.DEF: to make a place or an object look more attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: His portrait graces the wall of the drawing room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的画像给客厅的墙壁增添了光彩。

Sense.DEF: moving in a smooth and attractive way, or having an attractive shape or form
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her movements were graceful and elegant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她举手投足优雅而高贵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The branches formed a graceful curve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些树枝形成一条优美的曲线。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a polite and pleasant way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father was a quiet man with graceful manners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲沉默寡言﹐彬彬有礼。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She rose gracefully to her feet.

Sense.DEF: not being polite, especially when someone has been kind to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was bad-tempered and graceless in defeat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他输了之后脾气暴躁﹐毫无风度。

Sense.DEF: moving or doing something in a way that seems awkward
Sense.TRAN: 〔动作或行为〕笨拙的﹐不优雅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers were graceless with their heavy packs and helmets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们背着沉重的背包﹐戴着钢盔﹐样子很笨拙。

Sense.DEF: something that is graceless is unattractive and unpleasant to look at
Sense.EXAMPLE: graceless architecture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难看的建筑

Sense.DEF: behaving in a polite, kind, and generous way, especially to people of a lower rank
Sense.TRAN: 有礼貌的﹔仁慈的﹔和蔼的﹐亲切的〔尤指对较低阶层的人们〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sibyl was the most gracious, helpful, and generous person to work with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西比尔非常和蔼﹐乐于助人﹐而且为人慷慨﹐和她共事最愉快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gracious apology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 落落大方的道歉

Sense.DEF: having the kind of expensive style, comfort, and beauty that only rich people can afford
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gracious manor house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪华的庄园大宅
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magazine about gracious living
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本有关奢华生活的杂志

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise or to emphasize ‘yes’ or ‘no’
Sense.TRAN: 天哪﹐啊呀〔用于表示惊讶﹐或强调“是”或“不是”〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good gracious! What on earth has happened to your feet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天哪！你的脚到底怎么了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you ever go back?’ ‘Good gracious, no.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你回去过没有？”“啊呀﹐当然没有。”

Sense.DEF: a gracious act by or gift from God is kind and forgiving
used as a polite way of describing a royal person
Sense.TRAN: 尊贵的〔用于对王室成员的敬称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: our gracious Queen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尊贵的女王

Sense.DEF:
a
graduate

an adjective which is gradable can be used in the
comparative
or
superlative
forms, or with words such as ‘very’ or ‘fairly’
Sense.TRAN: 可分级的〔指形容词有比较级或最高级形式﹐或可被very, fairly等词修饰〕

Sense.DEF: a small change or difference between points on a scale
Sense.TRAN: 〔不同标度之间的〕渐变﹐层次﹐级次
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are many gradations of colour between light and dark blue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浅蓝和深蓝之间有许多颜色层次。

Sense.DEF: a particular level of quality that a product, material etc has
Sense.EXAMPLE: The best grades of tea are expensive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最上等的茶叶价格很贵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: industrial grade diamonds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业等级钻石

GramExa.EXAMPLE: low grade products
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 低等产品

Sense.DEF: a particular level of job
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are lots of jobs in junior grades.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职位低的工作有很多。

Sense.DEF: a mark that a student is given for their work or for an examination
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got a grade A in maths.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他数学得了个A。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim worked hard and got good grades.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆努力学习﹐取得了好成绩。

Sense.DEF: to succeed or reach the necessary standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: What does it take to make the grade as a top golfer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎样才能成为顶级的高尔夫球员？

Sense.DEF: one of the 12 years that students are at school in the American school system, or the students in a particular year
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国中小学的〕年级﹔某个年级的学生

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My brother is in sixth grade.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我弟弟在上六年级。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fifth-grade teacher
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五年级的老师

Sense.DEF: a slope or a degree of slope, especially in a road or railway
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指道路或铁路的〕斜坡﹐坡度

Sense.DEF: to say what level of a quality something has, or what standard it is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pencils are graded according to softness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 铅笔按软硬度分级。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All the parks are regularly checked and graded by tourist board inspectors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有公园都由旅游协会的检查员进行定期检查和评级。

Sense.DEF: to give a mark to an examination paper or to a piece of school work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ted is grading papers in his office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特德在办公室评卷。

Sense.DEF: to give a particular rank and level of pay to a job
Sense.TRAN: 给〔某个职位〕评定级别和工资等级

Sense.DEF: a place where a road and railway cross each other, usually with gates that shut the road while the train passes
designed to suit different levels of learning
Sense.EXAMPLE: graded coursebooks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分级教材

Sense.DEF: a student in one of the 12 years in an American school
Sense.TRAN: 一年级学生/四年级学生等

Sense.DEF:
an
elementary school
a slope or a degree of slope, especially in a road or railway
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指道路或铁路的〕斜坡﹐坡度
Sense.EXAMPLE: a steep gradient
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陡坡

Sense.DEF:
a
graduate school
happening slowly over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has been a gradual change in climate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气候渐渐发生了变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gradual decline in manufacturing industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制造业的逐渐衰退
Sense.EXAMPLE: Education is a gradual process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育是一个循序渐进的过程。

Sense.DEF: a gradual slope is not steep
slowly, over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jill gradually became aware of an awful smell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔渐渐地闻到了一股难闻的气味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gradually, my ankle got better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的脚踝慢慢好了。

Sense.DEF: someone who has completed a university degree, especially a first degree
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指完成学士学位课程的〕大学毕业生
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Harvard graduate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈佛毕业生

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a graduate of Edinburgh University
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱丁堡大学的毕业生

Sense.EXAMPLE: university graduates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学毕业生
Sense.EXAMPLE: a history graduate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史专业毕业生

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s a graduate in philosophy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他哲学专业毕业。

Sense.DEF: someone who has completed a course at a college, school etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high-school graduate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中学毕业生

Sense.DEF: to obtain a degree, especially a first degree, from a college or university

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kate graduated from medical school last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特去年从医学院毕业了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He graduated in physics from Cambridge University.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是剑桥大学物理学专业毕业的。

Sense.DEF:
to complete your education at
high school

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jerry graduated from high school last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里去年中学毕业。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something that is bigger, better, or more important
Sense.EXAMPLE: As an actress she has graduated from small roles to more substantial parts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为演员﹐她从配角演起﹐慢慢地开始出演比较重要的角色。

Sense.DEF:
to give a degree or
diploma
to someone who has completed a course
Sense.TRAN: 向〔毕业生〕授予学位[文凭]

Sense.DEF: relating to or involved in studies done at a university after completing a first degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: a graduate student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究生

Sense.DEF: divided into different levels
Sense.EXAMPLE: graduated rates of taxation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分级税率

Sense.DEF: a tool or container that is graduated has small marks on it showing measurements

a college or university where you can study for a
master’s degree
or a
doctorate
after receiving your first degree, or the period of time when you study for these degrees
Sense.TRAN: 研究生院﹔攻读研究生的时期

Sense.DEF:
the time when you complete a university degree course or your education at an American
high school
Sense.EXAMPLE: After graduation Neil returned to Ohio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼尔毕业以后回到了俄亥俄州。
Sense.EXAMPLE: On graduation after completing a first degree , Nancy became an art teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南希毕业以后当了一名美术老师。

Sense.DEF:
a ceremony at which you receive a university degree or a
diploma
from an American
high school
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学或美国高中的〕毕业典礼
Sense.EXAMPLE: graduation day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕业典礼日

Sense.DEF: a mark on an instrument or container used for measuring

another spelling of
greco-
rude, humorous, or political writing and pictures on the walls of buildings, trains etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔墙﹑火车等上面的〕涂鸦﹐乱涂乱画
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls are daubed with graffiti.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上满是乱七八糟的涂鸦。

Sense.DEF: a piece of healthy skin or bone taken from someone’s body and put in or on another part of their body that has been damaged
Sense.TRAN: 移植的皮肤﹔移植的骨骼
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martha had to have several skin grafts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛莎不得不进行了多处皮肤移植。

Sense.DEF: a piece cut from one plant and tied to or put inside a cut in another, so that it grows there
hard work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our success has been due to sheer hard graft .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的成功全凭努力得来。

Sense.DEF: the practice of obtaining money or advantage by the dishonest use of influence or power
Sense.EXAMPLE: He promised to end graft in public life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承诺要清除公务生活中的腐败行为。

Sense.DEF: to remove a piece of skin, bone etc from part of someone’s body and put it onto or into a part of their body that has been damaged

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The technique involves grafting a very thin slice of bone onto the damaged knee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种技术是把非常薄的骨片移植到受伤的膝盖上去。

Sense.DEF: to join a part of a plant or tree onto another plant or tree
to add something very different to something, so that it becomes part of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New elements are being grafted onto our traditional form of government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们传统的政府模式正被注入新的元素。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is a 17th-century farmhouse with some Victorian additions grafted on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一座17世纪的农舍﹐后来又加盖了一些维多利亚时代风格的房子。

Sense.DEF: to work hard
to get money or advantages from someone by the dishonest use of influence, especially political influence
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指利用权势以不正当手段〕向〔某人〕索贿﹐牟取私利

Subsense.DEF: the seeds of crops such as corn, wheat, or rice that are gathered for use as food, or these crops themselves
Subsense.EXAMPLE: big sacks of grain
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大袋大袋的粮食
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Last year’s grain harvest was the biggest ever.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年粮食收成最好。

Subsense.DEF: a single seed of corn, wheat etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: grains of rice
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谷粒

Sense.DEF: the natural lines you can see in a substance such as wood, which are the result of its structure

GramExa.GLOSS: in the same direction as the grain
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cut along the grain of the wood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺着木头的纹路劈下去。

GramExa.GLOSS: at 90 degrees to the grain

Sense.DEF: a single very small piece of a substance such as sand or salt

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a grain of sand
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗沙子

Sense.EXAMPLE: There were crumbs and grains of sugar on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子上有面包屑和糖粒。

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story wouldn’t have fooled anyone with a grain of sense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍有一点头脑的人都不会被这个故事骗到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a grain of truth in all folklore and legend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的民间故事和传说中都带有一点真实的成分。

Sense.DEF: if something goes against the grain, it is not what you would naturally or normally do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary is always honest and it went against the grain to tell lies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽一向诚实﹐说谎不合她的本性。

Sense.DEF: the smallest unit for measuring weight, equal to about 0.06 grams. It is used for weighing medicines.
Sense.TRAN: 格令〔最小的重量单位﹐约合0.06克﹐用于称量药品〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: take sth with a pinch/grain of salt

Sense.DEF: a photograph that is grainy has a rough appearance, as if the images are made up of spots

the basic unit for measuring weight in the
metric system
a message delivered as an amusing surprise
Sense.EXAMPLE: On his birthday we sent him a kissagram a woman who was paid to give him a message and kiss him .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生日那天我们请了一位女郎给他送上贺吻。

Sense.DEF: the rules by which words change their forms and are combined into sentences, or the study or use of these rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check your spelling and grammar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检查你的拼写和语法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rules of English grammar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语的语法规则

Sense.DEF: a particular description of grammar or a book that describes grammar rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: A dictionary lists the words, a grammar states the rules.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 词典收列单词﹐语法书讲解语法规则。

Sense.DEF: someone who studies and knows about grammar
a school in Britain for children over the age of 11 who have to pass a special examination to go there
Sense.TRAN: 文法学校〔英国为11岁以上儿童设立的一种学校﹐须通过专门考试才能入学〕

Sense.DEF:
an
elementary school
concerning grammar
Sense.EXAMPLE: grammatical rules
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语法规则

Sense.DEF: correct according to the rules of grammar
Sense.TRAN: 语法正确的﹐符合语法的

Sense.DEF:
a British spelling of
gram

an
award
given by the US National Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences for special achievement in the record industry
Sense.TRAN: 格莱美奖〔美国国家录音与科学学会颁发给在唱片业有特殊成就者的音乐奖〕

Sense.DEF:
a
record player
grandmother
a place where grain, especially wheat, is stored
Sense.TRAN: 粮仓〔尤指储存小麦的仓库〕

Sense.DEF: Granary bread is bread which contains whole grains of wheat
big and very impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grand country house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪华的乡间大宅
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party was a grand affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个聚会场面隆重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: New Yorkers build on a grand scale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约人喜欢建高楼大厦。

Sense.DEF: aiming or intended to achieve something impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry Luce had a grand design for America’s future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利·卢斯为美国的未来设计了一幅宏伟蓝图。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s grand ambition was to become the first and biggest global airline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的远大目标是要成为首家并且是最大的国际航空公司。

Sense.DEF: important and rich
Sense.TRAN: 显赫的﹐富丽堂皇的﹐华贵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked very grand in his ceremonial uniform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身着礼服﹐看上去气度不凡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grand end of West Avenue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西大街繁华的一头

Subsense.DEF: used in the titles of buildings or places that are big and impressive
Subsense.TRAN: 大〔用于建筑物名或地名〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Grand Hotel
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格兰大酒店
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Grand Central Station
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中央大火车站

Subsense.DEF: used in the titles of some people who belong to the highest social class
Subsense.TRAN: 大〔用于对最高阶层的人的称呼中〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Grand Duke of Baden
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴登大公

Sense.DEF: excellent
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all had a grand time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都过得非常愉快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you, Shirley, that’s grand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你﹐雪莉﹐那真是太好了。

Sense.DEF: the final total you get when you add up several numbers or amounts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You could add the £15,000 Bonus to the First Prize and win a grand total of £125,000!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 头奖再加1.5万英镑的奖金﹐获奖金额共计12.5万英镑！

Sense.DEF: an age when someone is quite old
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had reached the grand old age of 80.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经到了80高龄。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the Grand Old Man of sth
Sense.DEF: a man who has been involved in an activity or a profession for a long time and is highly respected
Sense.TRAN: 〔某活动或某行业的〕元老﹐老前辈
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Grand Old Man of British theatre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国戏剧界的老前辈

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘I am training her to cook for royalty,’ Auguste said grandly.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “我在培养她为王室烹饪。”奥古斯特郑重地说。

Sense.DEF: a thousand pounds or dollars
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car cost him 15 grand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车花了他1.5万英镑。

Sense.DEF:
a
grand piano
grandfather
grandfather
the first or greatest example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Louis Armstrong, the grandaddy of all jazz trumpeters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爵士音乐号手的祖师爷路易斯·阿姆斯特朗

Sense.DEF: the main railway station in New York City. Grand Central Station is a very busy place, and in the US people often mention it humorously to say how busy another place is
Sense.TRAN: 中央大火车站〔纽约的主要火车站﹐是一个极繁忙的地方﹐美国人常幽默地用它来形容某地很繁忙〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our house was like Grand Central Station last night!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我们家忙得就像中央大火车站！

Sense.DEF: the child of your son or daughter

the usual American spelling of
grandad

another spelling of
grandaddy
the daughter of your son or daughter
a politician of the highest social class who has a lot of influence

a Spanish or Portuguese
nobleman
of the highest rank, in the past
Sense.TRAN: 大公〔西班牙或葡萄牙旧时的最高爵位〕

Sense.DEF: impressive beauty, power, or size
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grandeur of the mountains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山峦的巍峨壮丽

Sense.DEF: the father of your father or mother

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: People usually say grandad (especially in British English) or grandpa when talking to or about their own grandfather.
F2NBox.TRAN: 和自己的（外）祖父谈话或谈到他们时﹐人们一般说grandad（尤其在英国英语中）或grandpa
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I used to stay at my grandpa ’s house.

Sense.DEF: an old-fashioned tall clock which stands on the floor
the last and most impressive or exciting part of a show or performance
Sense.TRAN: 〔节目或演出的〕高潮性结尾﹐压轴戏

Sense.DEF: using words that are too long and formal in order to sound important
Sense.TRAN: 言辞浮夸的﹐卖弄辞藻的

Sense.DEF: grandiose plans sound very important or impressive, but are not practical

GramExa.EXAMPLE: grandiose schemes of urban renewal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 华而不实的市区重建计划

Sense.DEF: a group of people in the US who decide whether someone charged with a crime should be judged in a court of law
the crime of stealing very valuable goods
grandmother

a serious form of
