epilepsy

a
chess
player of a very high standard
the mother of your mother or father

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: People usually say gran (in British English) or grandma when talking to or about their own grandmother.
F2NBox.TRAN: 和自己的（外）祖母谈话或谈到她们时﹐人们一般说gran（英国英语）或grandma
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: My grandma used to make lovely cakes.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我祖母以前常做很好吃的蛋糕。

Sense.DEF: a horse race that takes place every year at the Aintree racecourse near Liverpool, England
Sense.TRAN: 全国越野障碍赛马大赛〔每年在英格兰近利物浦的安特里赛马场举行〕

Sense.DEF:
a centre for
country
music in Nashville, Tennessee, known especially for the radio and television broadcasts made there for many years. In 1974, it moved to Opryland, USA, near Nashville, and it is still an important centre for country and western music.
Sense.TRAN: 大奥普里〔位于美国田纳西州纳什维尔的乡村与西部音乐中心〕

Sense.DEF:
an
opera
with a serious subject in which all the words are sung
grandfather
one of the parents of your mother or father
Sense.EXAMPLE: My grandparents live in Sussex.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的祖父母住在萨塞克斯郡。

Sense.DEF: the type of large piano often used in concerts, with strings in a horizontal position
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常在音乐会上使用的〕大钢琴﹐三角钢琴

Sense.DEF: one of a set of international races, especially a car race
the winning of all of a set of important sports competitions in the same year
Sense.TRAN: 大满贯〔指在全年各项重大体育赛事中获全胜〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wales won the Grand Slam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔士队赢得了大满贯。

Sense.DEF:
a hit in
baseball
which gets four points because it is a
home run
and there are players on all the bases
Sense.TRAN: 〔棒球中的〕四分本垒打﹐全垒打

Sense.DEF:
the winning of all of the
tricks
possible in one game of cards, especially in
bridge
Sense.TRAN: 〔扑克牌﹐尤指桥牌中的〕大满贯

Sense.DEF: the son of your son or daughter
a large structure that has many rows of seats where people sit and watch sports competitions, games, or races
a very good view of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a grandstand view of the fireworks from our house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从我们家看出去﹐烟火表演清清楚楚。

Sense.DEF: an action that is intended to make people notice and admire you
Sense.TRAN: 作秀﹐引人注意的动作﹐哗众取宠的行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: His opening the new school is just a piece of political grandstanding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给这所新学校剪彩只是一种政治作秀。

Sense.DEF: a trip round Europe made in the past by young British or American people from rich families as part of their education
Sense.TRAN: 环欧旅行〔指旧时英美富家子弟所作的环欧洲旅行﹐是教育的一部分〕

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone takes you around a building to show it to you – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: They took us on a grand tour of their new house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们领我们在他们的新居参观了一圈。

Sense.DEF: a large country house with farm buildings
a very hard grey rock, often used in building
grandmother
of a style typically used by old women
Sense.EXAMPLE: granny shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老奶奶鞋

Sense.DEF: a separate place inside or next to someone’s house that is designed for an old relative to live in
Sense.TRAN: 老奶奶住房〔指在住宅内部或隔壁专供年老亲人居住的居室〕

Sense.DEF:
a knot that is like a
reef knot
but is tied wrongly so that it is not firm
Sense.TRAN: 〔两条绳反向打的〕外平行结﹐祖母结﹐老奶奶结

Sense.DEF: breakfast food made from mixed nuts, grains, and seeds
Sense.TRAN: 〔用坚果﹑谷物和种子混合制成的〕早餐食品

Sense.DEF: to give someone something or allow them to have something that they have asked for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain could grant Spain’s request .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国可能会同意西班牙的请求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would love to be able to grant her wish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很希望能够满足她的愿望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The council have granted him permission to build on the site.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政会已经批准他在这块地上建房子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A licence to sell alcohol was granted to the club.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家俱乐部获得了经销酒类的许可证。

GramExa.GLOSS: used in prayers
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Grant that we may know your presence and love.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 求主开恩﹐让我们知道你与我们同在﹐你的爱与我们同在。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say give permission rather than grant permission .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说give permission﹐而不说grant permission
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They gave him permission to stay.

Sense.DEF: to admit that something is true although it does not make much difference to your opinion
Sense.TRAN: 承认〔某事属实﹐但该事不影响自己的看法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got talent, I grant you , but he doesn’t work hard enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有天赋﹐这不假﹐但是他不够努力。

Sense.DEF: to believe that something is true without making sure
Sense.TRAN: 想当然地认为﹐认为…是理所当然
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just took it for granted that he would pass the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还想当然地认为自己能通过考试呢。

Sense.DEF: to expect that someone or something will always be there when you need them and never think how important or useful they are
Sense.TRAN: 视某人/某事为理所当然〔而对其不重视〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bridget was careful not to take him for granted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里奇特很小心﹐不把他所做的一切看成是理应如此。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money given to someone, especially by the government, for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政府等发给的〕补助金﹐拨款
Sense.EXAMPLE: The university gets a government grant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所大学获得政府拨款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone wishing to apply for a grant should write to the Treasurer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡希望申请补助者﹐请致函财务主管。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a grant of £50,000
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五万英镑的补助金

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These studios are funded by a grant from the Kress Foundation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些工作室由克雷斯基金会拨款资助。

Sense.DEF: used when you admit that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Granted, the music is not perfect, but the flaws are outweighed by the sheer joy of the piece.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诚然﹐这音乐算不上完美﹐但曲中欢乐无穷﹐因而瑕不掩瑜。

Sense.DEF: a grant-maintained school in Britain receives its money directly from the central government rather than from the local government
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国学校〕由中央政府直接拨款的

Sense.DEF: consisting of granules
Sense.TRAN: 由颗粒组成的﹐颗粒状的

Sense.DEF: the amount of detail that is included in something such as a system
Sense.EXAMPLE: The database should have an appropriate level of granularity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据库应该有适当的粒度级别。

Sense.DEF: granulated sugar is in the form of small white grains
a small hard piece of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: coffee granules
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡颗粒

Sense.DEF:
one of a number of small round green or purple fruits that grow together on a
vine . Grapes are often used for making wine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of grapes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一串葡萄
Sense.EXAMPLE: grape juice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葡萄汁
Sense.EXAMPLE: red seedless grapes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红色无籽葡萄

Sense.DEF:
a round yellow
citrus
fruit with a thick skin, like a large orange
to hear about something because the information has been passed from one person to another in conversation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard about his resignation on the grapevine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他辞职的事我是从小道消息听来的。

Sense.DEF: a climbing plant on which grapes grow
a drawing that uses a line or lines to show how two or more sets of measurements are related to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martin showed me a graph of their recent sales.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁给我看了他们最近销售情况的图表。

Sense.DEF: a graphic account or description of an event is very clear and gives a lot of details, especially unpleasant ones
Sense.TRAN: 〔叙述或描写〕清楚详细的﹐细致的〔尤指包含令人不愉快的细节〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a graphic account of her unhappy childhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对她不幸童年细致入微的描述
Sense.EXAMPLE: His illness is described in graphic detail .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的病情被描述得非常详细。

Sense.DEF: connected with or including drawing, printing, or designing
Sense.TRAN: 绘画的﹔图样的﹔印刷的﹔平面造型设计的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a graphic artist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平面造型艺术家
Sense.EXAMPLE: the graphic arts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平面造型艺术

Sense.DEF: relating to or containing graphics, especially on a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: a simple graphical representation of the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这道题的简单图示

Sense.DEF: if you describe something graphically, you describe it very clearly with a lot of detail
using a graph
Sense.EXAMPLE: statistics represented graphically
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用图表表示的统计资料

Sense.DEF: a way of showing and organizing information on a computer screen that is easy to use and understand
the art of combining pictures, words, and decoration in the production of books, magazines etc
pictures or images that are designed to represent objects or facts, especially in a computer program
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指计算机程序中的〕图形﹐图表

Sense.DEF:
a
circuit board
that connects to a computer and allows the computer to show images, such as video images, on its screen

a soft black substance that is a kind of
carbon
, used in pencils, paints, and electrical equipment
Sense.TRAN: 石墨〔碳的一种形式﹐用于铅笔﹑油漆和电气设备中〕

Sense.DEF:
the study of
handwriting
in order to understand people’s characters

paper with many squares printed on it, used for drawing
graphs
used in nouns to mean a way of making pictures or of writing
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于构成名词﹐表示图像制作技术或书写方法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: radiography
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 射线照相﹐X光照相
Sense.EXAMPLE: photography
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影
Sense.EXAMPLE: calligraphy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书法

Sense.DEF: to fight or struggle with someone, holding them tightly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two men grappled with a guard at the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男人和一个门卫在门口扭打。

Sense.DEF: to try hard to deal with or understand something difficult
Sense.TRAN: 尽力解决﹐设法理解〔难题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Government has to grapple with the problem of unemployment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府必须尽力解决失业问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Molly’s upstairs grappling with her maths homework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫莉在楼上绞尽脑汁地做数学家庭作业。

Sense.DEF: an iron tool with several hooks that you tie to a rope and use to hold a boat still, look for objects on the bottom of a river etc
Sense.TRAN: 多爪钩﹐多爪锚〔系在绳上用于固定在河底寻物等的船只〕

Sense.DEF: to take and hold something firmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I grasped his arm firmly and led him away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我紧紧抓住他的胳膊把他带走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan grasped the handle and pulled it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦抓住手柄一拉。

Sense.DEF: to completely understand a fact or an idea, especially a complicated one
Sense.TRAN: 理解﹐领会〔尤指复杂的事情或观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that time, we did not fully grasp the significance of what had happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时﹐我们没有完全明白所发生之事的重要性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people find the idea of relativity difficult to grasp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人觉得相对论的概念很难理解。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A short opening paragraph enables the reader to quickly grasp what the article is about.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开篇的小段落使读者很快就能掌握文章的大意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nick had grasped that something was wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克已经知道出问题了。

Sense.DEF: to eagerly and quickly use an opportunity to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is ready to grasp any opportunity to expand the business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已准备好抓住一切机遇拓展业务。

Sense.DEF: to deal with an unpleasant situation firmly and without delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to grasp the nettle of prison reform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要当机立断﹐解决狱政改革这个难题。

Sense.DEF: to try to hold on to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His foot slipped and he grasped at the top of the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脚下一滑﹐立刻伸手去抓墙头。

Sense.DEF: the way you hold something or your ability to hold it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luke took her arm in a firm grasp and led her through the gate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢克紧紧抓着她的胳膊﹐领她进了门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had allowed the ball to slip from his grasp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让球从手里滑了出去。

Sense.DEF: your ability to understand a complicated idea, situation, or subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔对复杂想法﹑情况或问题的〕理解力﹐领悟力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her grasp of the issues was impressive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对这些问题的领悟能力极强。

GramExa.PROPFORM: a good/firm/thorough etc grasp of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steve has a good grasp of the European legal system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫对欧洲的法律体系非常了解。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After two months, his grasp on the subject was improving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个月之后﹐他对这个问题有了更好的理解。

Sense.DEF: your ability to achieve or gain something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An agreement to end the war seemed within their grasp.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们似乎有把握签订停战协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many families are finding suitable housing beyond their grasp.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多家庭负担不起合适的住房。

Sense.DEF: control or power
Sense.EXAMPLE: The king was determined not to let Scotland slip from his grasp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王决心不让苏格兰脱离出去。

Sense.DEF: too eager to get money and unwilling to give any of it away or spend it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hanson was a hard grasping man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉森是个苛刻贪婪的人。

Subsense.DEF: a very common plant with thin leaves that covers the ground in fields and gardens and is often eaten by animals
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She enjoyed the feel of grass beneath her feet.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢踩在草上的感觉。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a blade of grass single leaf
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片草叶

Subsense.DEF: a particular kind of grass
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All grasses need light to grow well.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的草都需要光照才能生长得好。

Sense.DEF: an area of grass, especially an area where the grass is kept cut short
Sense.EXAMPLE: I walked across the grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走在草地上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep off the grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请勿践踏草地。

Sense.DEF: someone, usually a criminal, who gives information about other criminals to the police – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 告密者﹐通风报信者〔通常指向警方告发其他罪犯的人﹐含贬义〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: the grass is greener (on the other side)
Sense.DEF: used to say that other places or situations seem better than yours, although they may not really be better
Sense.TRAN: 草是那边的绿〔用于表示别的地方或情况似乎比自己的好﹐虽然事实可能并非如此〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: not let the grass grow under your feet
Sense.DEF: to not waste time or delay starting something
Sense.TRAN: 不浪费时间﹐不耽误时间

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave their job because they are too old to do it effectively
Sense.TRAN: 使某人离职〔因某人年迈而不能有效工作〕

Sense.DEF: to tell the police about a criminal’s activities

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Burton grassed on other prisoners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯顿告发了其他犯人。

Sense.DEF: to cover land with grass
a tennis court which has a grass surface for the players to play on
an insect that has long back legs for jumping and that makes short loud noises
a large area of land covered with wild grass
the ordinary people in an organization, rather than the leaders

RunOn.EXAMPLE: We are hoping for full participation at grass roots level.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望基层民众充分参与。

Sense.DEF: a common snake that is not poisonous
covered with grass
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grassy bank
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长满青草的河岸

Sense.DEF:
the metal bars and frame that hold the wood, coal etc in a
fireplace
to rub cheese, vegetables etc against a rough or sharp surface in order to break them into small pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: grated cheese
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 磨碎的干酪
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peel and grate the potatoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把马铃薯削皮磨碎。

Sense.DEF: to talk in a low rough voice
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Let me go,’ he grated harshly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “放我走。”他粗声粗气地说﹐口气很凶。

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Fen had a loud voice that grated on her ears.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 芬先生嗓门很大﹐直刺她的耳朵。

Sense.DEF: to make an unpleasant sound by rubbing, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stones beneath her shoes grated harshly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石子在她鞋底下吱嘎作响﹐声音很刺耳。

Sense.DEF: feeling that you want to thank someone because of something kind that they have done, or showing this feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m so grateful for all your help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我衷心感谢你的帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I am very grateful to all those who took the trouble to write to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多谢各位费心来函。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She should be grateful that he was making things easier for her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给她提供了方便﹐她应该对此心存感激。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I am extremely grateful for the assistance your staff have provided.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我万分感激贵方员工提供的援助。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our grateful thanks go to all who participated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们衷心感谢所有参与者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave me a grateful look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感激地看了我一眼。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say
I appreciate it rather than
I’m grateful.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说I appreciate it﹐而不说I’m grateful
F2NBox.BADEXA: I’m grateful for everything you’ve done.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分感谢你所做的一切。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I would be grateful if you could/would ...
Sense.DEF: used to make a request
Sense.TRAN: 如果你能…我将感激不尽〔用于提出请求〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would be most grateful if you could send me an invoice in due course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请您届时将发票寄送给我﹐我将万分感激。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: All contributions will be gratefully received .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有捐资﹐我们都不胜感谢。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: The authors gratefully acknowledge your financial support.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 您慷慨资助﹐作者十分感谢。

Sense.DEF: a tool used for grating food
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheese grater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干酪磨碎器

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel pleased and satisfied
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was gratified by Lucy’s response.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对露西的回答很满意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John was gratified to see the improvement in his mother’s health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰很高兴看到母亲的身体有所好转。

Sense.DEF: to satisfy a desire, need etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She did not propose to gratify Gloria’s curiosity any further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不想再去满足格洛丽亚的好奇心了。

Sense.DEF: pleasing and satisfying
Sense.TRAN: 令人高兴的﹐令人满意的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s gratifying to note that already much has been achieved.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 得知已经完成了很多﹐真令人欣慰。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The support was considerable and very gratifying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得到很多支持﹐让人感到很高兴。

Sense.DEF:
a dish containing vegetables or fish, covered in cheese or cheese sauce and cooked in an
oven
Sense.TRAN: 〔表面为干酪或奶汁的〕脆皮烙菜﹐焗烤菜肴

Sense.DEF: a metal frame with bars across it, used to cover a window or hole
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leaves clogged the grating over the drain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树叶把排水管上的格栅堵住了。

Sense.DEF: a grating sound is hard and unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: a harsh grating voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺耳难听的声音

Sense.DEF: done or given without payment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Medical advice was provided gratis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗咨询是免费提供的。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of being grateful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tears of gratitude filled her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她眼里充满感激的泪水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had a deep gratitude towards David, but she did not love him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对戴维深怀感激﹐但是并不爱他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee expressed its gratitude for the contribution he had made.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会对他所作的贡献表示感激。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will you let me take you out to dinner tomorrow in gratitude for what you’ve done?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了感谢你所做的一切﹐我明天请你吃晚饭好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She accepted his offer with gratitude.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她满怀感激地接受了他的帮助。

Sense.DEF: said or done without a good reason, in a way that offends someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: children’s books which include gratuitous violence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包含无谓暴力内容的儿童书籍

RunOn.EXAMPLE: There is no point in gratuitously antagonizing people.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要无故与人为敌。

Sense.DEF: a small gift of money given to someone for a service they provided
a large gift of money given to someone when they leave their job, especially in the army, navy etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指陆军﹑海军等的〕退职金﹐退伍金

Sense.DEF: the place in the ground where a dead body is buried
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the head of the grave there was a small wooden cross.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坟头上有一个小小的木十字架。

Sense.DEF: death
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took that secret to the grave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把那个秘密带进了坟墓。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb would turn in their grave
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone who is dead would strongly disapprove of something happening now
Sense.TRAN: 某人于九泉之下难以安息〔用于表示即使是死者也会强烈反对〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way Bill plays that piece would have Mozart turning in his grave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔如此演奏那首曲子﹐会使莫扎特在九泉之下也难以安息的。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have one foot in the grave

Sense.DEF: grave problems, situations, or worries are very great or bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matthew’s life is in grave danger .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马修的生命危在旦夕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report expressed grave concern over the technicians’ lack of training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告中对技术人员缺乏培训深表忧虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have grave doubts about his ability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十分怀疑他的能力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The situation is becoming very grave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形势变得非常严峻。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say serious rather than grave, and seriously rather than gravely.
F2NBox.TRAN: 日常英语中﹐人们一般说serious和seriously﹐而不说grave和gravely
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I have serious doubts about whether he’s up to the job.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十分怀疑他是否能胜任这个工作。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’m seriously worried about her.

Sense.DEF: looking or sounding quiet and serious, especially because something important or worrying has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turnbull’s face was grave as he told them about the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特恩布尔在告诉他们这次事故时表情十分严肃。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当神情严肃地点点头。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: We are gravely concerned very concerned about these developments.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对事态的发展深表忧虑。

Sense.DEF:
a grave
accent
is a mark put above a letter in some languages such as French to show the pronunciation, for example è
Sense.TRAN: 有沉[抑]音符的〔法语等语言中标在字母之上表示发音的符号〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to dig graves
small stones, used to make a surface for paths, roads etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gravel path
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石子小道

GramExa.GLOSS: a place where gravel is dug out of the ground

Sense.DEF: a gravelled path or road has a surface made of gravel
Sense.TRAN: 〔小道或道路〕用砾石[碎石]铺成的

Sense.DEF: a gravelly voice has a low rough sound
covered with or mixed with gravel
Sense.TRAN: 铺砾[碎]石的﹔含砾[碎]石的
Sense.EXAMPLE: gravelly soil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含砾石的土壤

Sense.DEF:
beside a
grave
, especially when someone is being buried there
Sense.TRAN: 在墓边〔尤指某人下葬时〕

Sense.DEF: a place where there is a grave
an old website which is no longer looked after by the people who started it
a website which not many people visit and so does not make much money

a stone above a
grave
showing details of the person buried there
an area of ground where people are buried, often next to a church
a place where things that are no longer wanted are left
Sense.EXAMPLE: a graveyard for old cars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 废旧汽车堆放场

Sense.DEF: a place where people or things fail
a regular period of working time that begins late at night and continues until the early morning, or the people who work during this time
a seriousness of manner that people respect
to be attracted to something and therefore move towards it or become involved with it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most visitors to London gravitate to Piccadilly Circus and Leicester Square.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多数到了伦敦的游客会被吸引到皮卡迪利广场和莱斯特广场。

Sense.DEF:
the force that causes two objects such as
planets
to move towards each other because of their
mass
Sense.EXAMPLE: Newton’s law of gravitation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛顿万有引力定律

Sense.DEF: related to or resulting from the force of gravity
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Moon’s gravitational field
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月球的引力场
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gravitational pull of the Moon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月球的引力

Sense.DEF:
the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another
planet
Sense.EXAMPLE: the force of gravity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重力

Sense.DEF: the extreme and worrying seriousness of a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could not hide from her the gravity of the situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The penalties should be proportionate to the gravity of the offence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罚应当罪。

Sense.DEF: an extremely serious way of behaving or speaking
Sense.TRAN: 严肃〔指举止或言谈的态度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Consul spoke slowly and with great gravity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领事讲话慢悠悠的﹐神态十分严肃。

Sense.DEF: a sauce made from the juice that comes from meat as it cooks, mixed with flour and water
something good that is more than you expected to get

a long
jug
that you pour gravy from
an organization, activity, or business from which many people can make money or profit without much effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: Privatization is not always the gravy train that governments promise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私有化并不一定能像政府承诺的那样带来滚滚财富。

Sense.DEF:
the usual American spelling of
grey
if an animal grazes, or if you graze it, it eats grass that is growing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Groups of cattle were grazing on the rich grass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛群在肥美的青草地上吃草。

Sense.EXAMPLE: fields where they used to graze their sheep
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们过去放羊的田野

Sense.DEF: to accidentally break the surface of your skin by rubbing it against something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fell on the gravel, severely grazing my knee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我摔倒在砾石路上﹐膝盖擦伤得很严重。

Sense.DEF: to touch something lightly while passing it, sometimes damaging it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A bullet grazed his arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗子弹擦过他的手臂。

Sense.DEF: to eat small amounts of food all through the day instead of having regular meals
Sense.TRAN: 整天吃零食〔而不吃正餐〕

Sense.DEF: a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adam walked away from the crash with just a graze on his left shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当在车祸中平安脱险﹐只是擦伤了左肩。

Sense.DEF:
an examination that is done by students in the US who have completed a first
degree
and want to go to
graduate school
a fatty or oily substance that comes off meat when it is cooked, or off food made using butter or oil
a thick oily substance that is put on the moving parts of a car, machine etc to make it run or move smoothly
an oily substance that is produced by your skin
to put butter, grease etc on a pan etc to prevent food from sticking to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grease the pan before you pour the batter in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先在锅底涂上油﹐然后倒入面糊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a greased baking tray
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抹过油的烤盘

Sense.DEF: to give someone money in a secret or dishonest way in order to persuade them to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joseph was able to grease a few palms, thus helping his brother to escape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约瑟夫买通了几个人﹐帮助他兄弟逃了出来。

Sense.DEF: extremely fast
a thick soft kind of paint that actors use on their face or body

a kind of paper that butter,
grease
etc cannot pass through, used in cooking and for wrapping food
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于烹调和包裹食品的〕防油纸﹐蜡纸

Sense.DEF:
a young man who is very interested in
motorcycles
and cars, and who behaves in a rough way
Sense.TRAN: 飞车青年﹐飙车小痞子〔指热衷于驾驶摩托车和汽车﹑行为粗放的年轻人〕

Sense.DEF: covered in grease or oil
Sense.TRAN: 多脂的﹐沾油脂的﹐油腻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shampoo for greasy hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适用于油性发质的洗发液
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food was heavy and greasy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这食物油腻难消化。

Sense.DEF: slippery
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police say the rain’s making the roads greasy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说雨后路面湿滑。

Sense.DEF: too polite and friendly in a way that seems insincere or unpleasant
used to refer to the difficult process of moving up in rank to a more important position
Sense.EXAMPLE: a politician climbing up the greasy pole
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费力往上爬的政客

Sense.DEF:
a small cheap restaurant that mainly serves
fried
food
Sense.TRAN: 〔主要供应油炸食品的〕廉价小餐馆

Sense.DEF: very large in amount or degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie was a great success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片大获成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news came as possibly the greatest shock of my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个消息可能是我一生中最大的打击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paintings cost a great deal a lot of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些画价值不菲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John always takes great care over his work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰工作时总是非常小心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It gives me great pleasure I am very pleased to introduce tonight’s speaker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常高兴请出今晚的演讲者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a great pity that none of his poems survive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常遗憾﹐他的诗歌没有一首保存下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The temptation was too great to resist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诱惑太大﹐难以抵挡。

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather here is great.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的天气非常好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s great to be home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家真好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a great day out for all the family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家人愉快出游的一天

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I worked out this morning and I feel great.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今早做了运动﹐感觉很好。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You look great in that dress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿那条裙子很漂亮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Email’s great for keeping in touch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子邮件是很好的联系方式。

GramExa.GLOSS: the very good thing about someone or something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The great thing about Alex is that he’s always willing to explain things to you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯的优点是他总愿意把事情解释给你听。

Subsense.DEF: important or having a lot of influence
Subsense.EXAMPLE: one of the greatest scientific achievements of our time
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这个时代最伟大的科学成就之一
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What makes a novel truly great ?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是什么使一部小说真正伟大？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: great historical events
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重大的历史事件

Subsense.DEF: used in the title of a person or event that was very important in the past
Subsense.TRAN: 重要的﹐重大的〔用于历史上重要人物的称号或重要事件的名称〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m reading a biography of Alexander the Great.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在看一部亚历山大大帝的传记。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Great Depression
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大萧条

GramExa.GLOSS: World War One

Sense.DEF: very good or generous in a way that people admire
Sense.EXAMPLE: a great humanitarian gesture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 崇高的人道主义姿态

Sense.DEF: famous for being able to do something extremely well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ali was undoubtedly one of the greatest boxers of all time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里无疑是有史以来最伟大的拳击手之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book about the lives of the great composers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 介绍大作曲家生平的一本书

Sense.DEF: very big
Sense.EXAMPLE: A great crowd had gathered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群人聚集了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A great iron stove filled half the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个巨大的铁炉占了房间的一半。

Sense.DEF: very big
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get your great big feet off my table!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的大脚从我桌上拿下来！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone does something a lot
Sense.TRAN: 酷爱做某事的〔用于强调〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anthony’s a great talker – sometimes you just can’t get a word in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安东尼很健谈——有时你根本插不上话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Len was a great believer in the power of positive thinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱恩坚信积极思维的力量。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be a great one for doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s a great one for telling stories about her schooldays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很喜欢讲她学生时代的故事。

Sense.LEXUNIT: to a greater or lesser extent
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is always true, even though it is more true or noticeable in some situations than others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most companies operate in conditions that are to a greater or lesser extent competitive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数公司的经营多少都面临着一些竞争。

Sense.DEF: to not be very good, interesting, or skilful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The work’s no great shakes, but at least I’m earning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作不怎么样﹐但至少我在挣钱。

Sense.DEF: to be doing something extremely well
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a slow start, the Tigers are going great guns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老虎队起步慢﹐现在却顺风顺水。

Sense.DEF: used when you are disappointed or annoyed about something
Sense.TRAN: 太糟了〔表示失望或生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Daniel’s cancelled the party.’ ‘Oh great!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “丹尼尔把派对取消了。”“噢﹐太糟了！”

Sense.DEF: used in the names of some animals or plants, especially when they are bigger than other animals or plants of the same type
Sense.TRAN: 大〔用于相似动植物中较大者的名称前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Great Crested Grebe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凤头䴙

Sense.DEF: the countryside, considered as enjoyable and healthy
Sense.TRAN: 〔有趣又有益健康的〕大自然﹐野外
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a taste for adventure and the great outdoors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢冒险﹐喜欢大自然。

Sense.DEF: used humorously when you and another person have had the same idea
Sense.TRAN: 英雄所见（略同）〔幽默用法﹐表示和另一个人有同样的想法〕

Sense.DEF: a general advantage that you can only gain by losing or harming something that is considered less important
Sense.TRAN: 〔需要牺牲较不重要的东西才能得到的〕更大的利益
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some wars are fought for the greater good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候战争是为了获取更大的利益。

Sense.DEF: the different types of animals that are similar to large monkeys, considered as a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alone of the great apes, the gorilla is not very efficient at using tools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 类人猿中﹐唯独大猩猩不太会使用工具。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is a big difference between groups in society, areas of a country etc, for example a big difference between their wealth or attitudes
Sense.TRAN: 分水岭﹐差距﹐差异〔指不同社会群体﹑地区等在财富和价值观上的差别〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The great divide between north and south seems to be as unbridgeable as ever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的南北差距似乎依然难以弥合。

Sense.DEF: London, Los Angeles etc and its outer areas
Sense.TRAN: 大伦敦/大洛杉矶/大曼彻斯特等〔指包括市区和周围地区在内的区域〕

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how big something is
used to express shock or surprise
very soon to have a baby
a very successful and famous person in a particular sport, profession etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某项运动﹑某一行业等的〕杰出人物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack Nicklaus is one of golf’s all-time greats .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克·尼克劳斯是空前杰出的高尔夫球手之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think his show’s OK, but I wouldn’t call him one of the greats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他的节目还可以﹐但他算不上是什么杰出人物。

Sense.DEF: people who are considered important – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 重要人物﹐大人物〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF:
the
grandfather
,
grandmother
etc of your parents
Sense.TRAN: （外）曾祖父/（外）曾祖母/姑婆[姨婆]/伯公[舅公]

Sense.DEF:
the
grandchildren
of your child
a long heavy coat
a very large short-haired dog
extremely or very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cost of repairs has greatly increased in recent years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近年来﹐修理费大幅上涨。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All offers of help will be greatly appreciated .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如蒙帮助﹐感激不尽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The quality of health care varies greatly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健服务质量差别很大。

Sense.DEF: an old-fashioned name for World War I
a water bird similar to a duck
from ancient Greece, or having a style or appearance that is considered typical of ancient Greece
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Grecian urn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希腊古瓮

Sense.DEF: ancient Greek and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greco-Roman art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古希腊——罗马艺术

Sense.DEF: a strong desire for more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: people motivated by jealousy and greed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受妒忌和贪婪驱使的人们

Sense.DEF: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need
Sense.TRAN: 贪婪的﹐贪心的﹔贪吃的﹐贪喝的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a greedy and selfish society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个贪婪自私的社会
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked at the gold with greedy eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他贪婪地看着这些金子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you eaten them all, you greedy pig?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把那些全吃了？你这贪吃的猪！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are greedy for profits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们利欲熏心。

Sense.DEF: someone who is greedy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, greedy guts, leave some cake for me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗨﹐你这贪嘴的家伙﹐给我留点蛋糕！

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He grabbed the bottle and drank greedily.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抓起瓶子﹐贪婪地喝了起来。

Sense.DEF: relating to Greece, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 希腊的﹔希腊人的﹔希腊语的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greek yoghurt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希腊式酸奶

Sense.DEF: someone from Greece
the language used in modern or ancient Greece

a member of a
sorority
or
fraternity
at an American college or university
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国大学里的〕女生[男生]联谊会会员

Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot understand something
Sense.TRAN: 我对此完全不理解﹐一头雾水

Sense.DEF: having the colour of grass or leaves
Sense.EXAMPLE: beautiful green eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的碧眼
Sense.EXAMPLE: Raw coffee beans are green in colour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生咖啡豆是绿色的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dark green dress
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条深绿色的连衣裙

Sense.DEF: covered with grass, trees, bushes etc
Sense.TRAN: 长满绿色植物的﹐绿油油的
Sense.EXAMPLE: green fields
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿茵茵的田野

Sense.DEF: not yet ready to be eaten, or very young
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bananas are still green.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香蕉还是青的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: tiny green shoots of new grass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小草细嫩的绿芽

Subsense.DEF: connected with the environment or its protection
Subsense.EXAMPLE: green issues such as the greenhouse effect and global warming
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温室效应﹑全球变暖等环保问题
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was an early champion of green politics.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是绿色政治的早期倡导者。

Subsense.DEF: harming the environment as little as possible
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We need to develop greener cleaning products.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要研发更环保的清洁用品。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The industry has promised to go green change so that it harms the environment less .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该行业已承诺减少污染。

Sense.DEF: young and lacking experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was pretty green then; I had a lot of things to learn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那时年轻无知﹐有很多东西要学。

Sense.DEF: looking pale and unhealthy because you are ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: George looked a bit green the next morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天早上乔治的脸色看上去有点苍白。

GramExa.GLOSS: look pale and ill

Sense.DEF: wishing very much that you had something that someone else has

jealousy
– often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 嫉妒﹐眼红〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to be good at making plants grow
money
the colour of grass and leaves
Sense.EXAMPLE: a room decorated in pale blues and greens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用浅蓝色和浅绿色装修的房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: different shades of green
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深浅不同的绿色

Sense.DEF: vegetables with large green leaves
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eat your greens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的青菜吃了吧。

Sense.DEF: a level area of grass, especially in the middle of a village
Sense.EXAMPLE: I walked home across the green.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我穿过草地走回家。

Sense.DEF:
a smooth flat area of grass around each hole on a
golf course
Sense.TRAN: 球洞区﹐果岭〔高尔夫球场上每个球洞四周的平坦草地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 18th green
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第18球洞区

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to or supports a political party which thinks the protection of the environment is very important
Sense.TRAN: 〔重视环境保护的〕绿党人士﹐绿党支持者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Greens have 254 candidates in the election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿党在这次选举中有254名候选人。

Sense.DEF: to fill an area with growing plants in order to make it more attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Existing derelict land is needed for greening the cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现有的荒地要用来绿化城市。

Sense.DEF: to make a person or organization realize the importance of environmental problems
an examination of the activities of an organization in order to see how much it harms the environment and how much energy it uses
Sense.TRAN: 绿色审计﹐环保审计〔为了解某一团体的活动对环境的破坏程度或能源消耗情况所进行的核查〕

Sense.DEF:
an American
banknote
a long thin green vegetable which is picked before the beans inside it grow
an area of land around a city where building is not allowed, in order to protect fields and woods
a document that a foreigner must have in order to work legally in the US
Sense.TRAN: 绿卡〔外国人在美国合法就业所必需的证件〕

Sense.DEF: a British motor insurance document that you need when you drive abroad
Sense.TRAN: 绿色保险证〔英国的汽车保险证明﹐在国外驾车时需要〕

Sense.DEF: green leaves and plants
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rich greenery of grass and trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 茂盛的绿色草木

Sense.DEF: a piece of land that has never been built on before
Sense.TRAN: 未开发地区﹐从未建过房子的地皮

Sense.DEF: a very small green insect that feeds on and damages young plants

a juicy greenish-yellow
plum
someone who owns or works in a shop selling fruit and vegetables
a greengrocer’s shop
someone who lacks experience of something
a glass building used for growing plants that need warmth, light, and protection

the gradual warming of the air surrounding the Earth as a result of heat being trapped by
pollution

a gas, especially
carbon dioxide
or
methane
, that is thought to trap heat above the Earth and cause the greenhouse effect
Sense.TRAN: 温室气体〔尤指二氧化碳或甲烷〕

Sense.DEF: when a person or organization starts to think and know more about environmental problems
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某机构环保意识的增强

Sense.DEF: slightly green

a
traffic light
that shows cars they can go forward
to allow a project, plan etc to begin
Sense.TRAN: 给某人/某物开绿灯〔即允许某工程﹑计划等启动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has given the green light to Sunday trading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已经为星期天营业开了绿灯。

Sense.DEF: an onion with a small white round part and a long green stem, usually eaten raw
a document produced by the British government containing proposals to be discussed, which may later be used in making laws
Sense.TRAN: 绿皮书〔英国政府文件﹐提出建议以供讨论﹐日后可能用作立法的依据〕

Sense.DEF:
a hollow green vegetable that you can cook or eat raw in
salads
a large increase in the amount of crops, such as wheat or rice, that are produced because of improved scientific methods of farming
Sense.TRAN: 绿色革命〔指作物由于采用经改进的科学耕作法而实现的增产〕

Sense.DEF: the interest in protecting the environment that has developed in many parts of the world
Sense.TRAN: 环境革命﹐绿色革命〔指世界许多地方对保护环境的重视〕

Sense.DEF:
the room in a theatre, television
studio
etc in which performers wait when they are not on stage performing
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧院﹑电视演播室等的〕演员休息室

Sense.DEF:
a
salad
made with
lettuce
and other raw green vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 〔用生菜和其他绿色生蔬菜制作的〕绿色色拉﹐蔬菜色拉

Sense.DEF:
a tax, for example a tax on
fuel
, that is intended to reduce harm to the environment
Sense.TRAN: 绿色税﹐环保税〔为减少环境污染对燃料等所征收的税〕

Sense.DEF: light-coloured tea made from leaves that have been heated with steam, especially popular in eastern Asia
when a company hides the true effects of its products or actions on the environment, by making it seem as though the company is very concerned about the environment
Sense.TRAN: 漂绿〔指公司作出非常关心环境的姿态﹐以掩盖其产品或行为对环境造成的真正影响〕

Sense.DEF:
a humorous or insulting name for rich people who live in the country and enjoy country life, especially hunting and horse-riding. The name comes from the green
wellingtons rubber boots
that some of them wear.
Sense.TRAN: 绿色橡胶靴一族〔幽默或侮辱性的称呼﹐指居住在乡间﹑尤其爱狩猎骑马的富人。他们中的有些人穿绿色橡胶靴﹐故名〕

Sense.DEF: the time as measured at Greenwich in London
to say hello to someone or welcome them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Belinda greeted her warmly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝琳达热情地招呼她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill opened the door to Harold and greeted him with cries of welcome.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔给哈罗德开了门﹐欢呼着迎接他。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say hello (to sb) rather than greet sb .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说say hello (to sb)﹐而不说greet sb
F2NBox.BADEXA: She came out to greet us.

Sense.DEF: to react to something in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His statement was greeted with cries of astonishment and indignation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的这番话被报以一片叫喊声﹐有震惊﹐也有愤怒。

Sense.DEF: to be the first thing you see or hear when you arrive somewhere
Sense.TRAN: 最先映入〔某人的〕眼帘﹔首先传入〔某人的〕耳中
Sense.EXAMPLE: Complete silence greeted us as we entered the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走进房间﹐迎接我们的是一片沉默。

Sense.DEF: someone who greets people politely as they enter a place, especially someone who does this as a job
something you say or do when you meet someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She raised her hand in greeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她举起手来打招呼。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I smiled a polite greeting, but the woman hardly acknowledged me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我客气地笑着打了个招呼﹐可是那女人没有答理我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two cousins exchanged greetings greeted each other .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表兄妹俩互相问候。

Sense.DEF:
a message saying that you hope someone will be happy and healthy on their
birthday
, at Christmas etc
used to say hello to someone

a card that you send to someone on their
birthday
, at Christmas etc
friendly and preferring to be with other people
gregarious animals tend to live in a group
the system of arranging the 365 days of the year in months and giving numbers to the years from the birth of Christ, used in the West since
Sense.TRAN: 1582公历﹐阳历〔自1582年起在西方使用的历法〕

Sense.DEF: a kind of church music for voices alone
Sense.TRAN: 格列高利圣咏〔一种无伴奏的合唱形式的宗教音乐〕

Sense.DEF: an imaginary evil spirit that is blamed for problems in machinery
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器发生故障时人们所责怪的〕小妖精

Sense.DEF: a small bomb that can be thrown by hand or fired from a gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hand grenade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手榴弹

Sense.DEF:
a soldier in a famous
regiment
of the British army
Sense.TRAN: 英国近卫步兵团的士兵

Sense.DEF:
a sweet liquid made from
pomegranates
that is used in drinks
Sense.TRAN: 石榴汁糖浆〔用于制作饮料〕

Sense.DEF: a village in southern Scotland on the border with England. Until 1940, the marriage laws were less strict in Scotland than in England, and many young English couples, whose parents did not want them to marry, ran away to get married in Gretna Green.
Sense.TRAN: 格雷特纳格林〔苏格兰南部与英格兰交界处一村庄。1940年前﹐苏格兰的婚姻法比英格兰要宽松﹐许多英格兰的年轻情侣﹐因为婚事未得到家长的同意﹐便跑到此地结婚〕

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
grow
having the colour of dark clouds, neither black nor white
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old lady with grey hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头发灰白的老太太
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grey sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰色的天空

GramExa.EXAMPLE: dark grey trousers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 深灰色的裤子

Sense.DEF: having grey hair

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was a tall thin woman who had gone grey early.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一个高高瘦瘦的女人﹐头发早早地白了。

Sense.DEF: looking pale because you are tired, frightened, or ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于疲倦﹑害怕或生病而〕脸色苍白的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As he listened, his face went grey with shock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听着﹐惊得脸色苍白。

Sense.DEF: boring and unattractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grey anonymous men in government offices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府部门里那些呆板而千篇一律的男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: visions of a grey and empty world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想象中一个空虚无聊的世界

Sense.DEF: if the weather is grey, the sky is full of clouds and the sun is not bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grey day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴沉沉的天

Sense.DEF: connected with old people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grey vote
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人的选票

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a situation in which something is not clearly a particular thing, so that people are not sure how to deal with it
Sense.TRAN: 灰色地带﹐中间区域〔指难以界定和处理的情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: people in the grey area between loyalty and opposition to the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府不支持也不反对的中间派

Sense.DEF: the colour of dark clouds, neither black nor white
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have these skirts in grey?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些裙子有灰色的吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: dull greys and browns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暗灰色和棕色

Sense.DEF: if someone greys, their hair becomes grey
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim was greying a little at the temples.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆两鬓微霜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a full head of greying hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满头华发

Sense.DEF: a type of thin dog that can run very fast and is used in races
Sense.TRAN: 灵（犭是）〔一种体形瘦长﹑跑得很快的犬﹐用于比赛〕

Sense.DEF: a type of bus service, connecting cities in the US. Greyhound Buses are a popular way of travelling in the US, because they are cheaper than renting a car or going by plane.
Sense.TRAN: 灰狗长途客运﹐灰狗大巴〔指美国城际汽车客运服务〕

Sense.DEF: the situation in which the average age of a population increases, so that there are more old people than there were in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: the graying of classical music audiences
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古典音乐听众的老龄化

Sense.DEF: slightly grey
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stone was a greyish colour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那石头是一种浅浅的灰色。

Sense.DEF: the system by which people buy and sell goods that are hard to find, in a way that is legal but not morally good or correct
Sense.TRAN: 灰色市场〔买卖稀缺商品的市场﹐灰市交易不算违法﹐但有违道德〕

Sense.DEF:
a situation in which people are buying and selling
shares
just before they are officially made available to be sold for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 灰市﹐暗盘市场〔在股票正式上市之前进行的交易〕

Sense.DEF: your intelligence, or your brain
the money that older people have available to spend, especially after their children have grown up and left home
Sense.TRAN: 灰色英镑〔尤指孩子们长大离家后老人可支配的钱〕

Sense.DEF: a metal frame with bars across it
a pattern of straight lines that cross each other and form squares
Sense.EXAMPLE: Its streets were laid out in a grid pattern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里的街道是棋盘式的布局。

Sense.DEF: a set of numbered lines printed on a map so that the exact position of any place can be referred to
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pilots were just given a grid reference number referring to a point on a map of the target.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行员只有目标的坐标位置。

Sense.DEF:
the network of electricity supply wires that connects
power stations
and provides electricity to buildings in an area
Sense.EXAMPLE: the national grid the electricity supply in a country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家电网

Sense.DEF: a set of starting positions for all the cars in a motor race
a system of running a computer program using a lot of small computers that are connected together in order to do very complicated jobs
Sense.TRAN: 网格计算〔指把许多小型计算机连接起来运行一个程序〕

Sense.DEF:
a round iron plate that is used for cooking meat, vegetables, or cakes on top of a
stove
or over a fire

a
pancake
an open frame of metal bars for cooking meat or fish over a very hot fire
a field marked in white lines for American football
Sense.TRAN: 〔画有白线的〕美式橄榄球场﹐美式足球场

Sense.DEF: a situation in which streets in a city are so full of cars that they cannot move
a situation in which nothing can happen, usually because people disagree strongly
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于强烈的意见分歧而造成的〕僵局
Sense.EXAMPLE: The battle over spending led to gridlock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支出之争使事情陷入了僵局。

Sense.DEF: extreme sadness, especially because someone you love has died
Sense.TRAN: 悲痛﹐极度悲伤〔尤指因所爱之人去世〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The grief she felt over Helen’s death was almost unbearable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因海伦的去世而悲痛难当。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Charles was overcome with grief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯悲痛欲绝。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you feel extremely sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every change in our lives brings with it griefs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们生活当中的每一个变化都有让人伤心的一面。

Sense.DEF: used when you are slightly surprised or annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 哎哟！〔用于略感惊讶或气恼之时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good grief! What a mess!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的天！这么乱！

Sense.DEF: to fail, or to be harmed or destroyed in an accident
Sense.TRAN: 失败﹔〔在事故中〕受损﹐被毁
Sense.EXAMPLE: candidates who come to grief in exams
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试失利的应试者

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone in an annoying way
trouble or problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll save yourself a lot of grief if you check the measurements first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你先核实尺寸﹐就可以省去不少麻烦。

Sense.DEF: feeling very sad because of something that has happened
Sense.TRAN: 感到极度悲伤的﹐悲痛欲绝的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The grief-stricken widow refused to leave her dead husband’s side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那遗孀悲痛欲绝﹐在死去的丈夫身旁不肯离开。

Sense.DEF: a belief that you have been treated unfairly, or an unfair situation or event that affects and upsets you
Sense.TRAN: 不平﹐委屈﹐不满﹔不平的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: anyone who has a legitimate grievance against the company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡是有正当理由对公司感到不满的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a means of overcoming genuine grievances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化解委屈的一个办法
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must be an opportunity for both sides to air their grievances .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要有一个机会让双方都说出心中的不满。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The teachers’ contract established a grievance procedure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师合同建立了一个申诉程序。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sense of grievance which characterized him as a young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年轻时惯有的不满情绪

Sense.DEF: to feel extremely sad, especially because someone you love has died
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因所爱之人去世而〕感到悲痛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He died, and every day since then I have grieved for him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死了﹐从此我没有一天不在悲痛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: People need time to grieve after the death of a loved one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们在所爱之人去世后会有一段悲伤期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She grieved the loss of her only son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因为失去唯一的儿子而悲痛。

Sense.DEF: if something grieves you, it makes you feel very unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLE: My aunt, it grieves me to say, gets things confused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的姑妈﹐说起来我很难过﹐她有点颠三倒四的。

Sense.DEF: very sad and upset

GramExa.EXAMPLE: King George V had been very grieved at the outbreak of the Great War.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一战的爆发让国王乔治五世非常痛心。

Sense.DEF: very serious and causing great pain or suffering
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grievous shortage of hospital beds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院床位的严重短缺

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was grievously hurt by their betrayal.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的背叛让他深受伤害。

Sense.DEF: serious injury caused by a criminal attack

an imaginary animal that has a lion’s body and an
eagle’s
wings and head
someone who dishonestly obtains something, especially money
Sense.TRAN: 以不正当方式获取某物〔尤指钱财〕的人

Sense.DEF: if you grill something, or if it grills, you cook it by putting it on a flat metal frame with bars across it, above or below strong direct heat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grill the bacon until crisp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将培根烤至酥脆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: swordfish grilled over charcoal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炭火烤的剑鱼

Sense.DEF: to ask someone a lot of questions about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She never grilled her husband about his work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丈夫工作上的事她从不问长问短。

Sense.DEF:
a part of a
cooker
in which strong heat from above cooks food on a metal shelf below
Sense.TRAN: 〔炉具中热力自上而下的〕烤架
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pop it under the grill for five minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它放在烤架下烤五分钟。

Sense.DEF: a flat frame with metal bars across it that can be put over a fire, so that food can be cooked on it
a place where you can buy and eat grilled food
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Tribeca Bar and Grill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翠贝卡烧烤酒吧

Sense.DEF: a grille
Sense.TRAN: 门窗护栏﹔〔保护汽车散热器的〕金属格栅

Sense.DEF: a frame with metal bars or wire across it that is put in front of a window or door for protection

the metal bars at the front of a car that protect the
radiator
Sense.TRAN: 〔保护汽车散热器的〕金属格栅

Sense.DEF: when you ask someone a lot of questions about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The three party leaders each endured a 20-minute television grilling from voters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3名政党领导人各在电视上接受了选民20分钟的提问。

Sense.DEF:
a square flat pan, used under a
grill
making you feel worried or unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 令人担忧的﹔令人不快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grim reality of rebuilding the shattered town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重建被毁城镇的严峻现实
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he lost his job, his future looked grim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他失业以后前途不容乐观。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Millions of Britons face the grim prospect something bad that will probably happen of dearer home loans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无数英国人面临着住房贷款更加沉重的暗淡前景。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We received the grim news in silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到这个令人沮丧的消息﹐沉默无言。

Sense.DEF: looking or sounding very serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll survive,’ he said with a grim smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我死不了。”他阴笑着说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child hung on to her arm with grim determination .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那孩子死死抓住她的胳膊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police officers were silent and grim-faced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察默不作声﹐神情严肃。

Sense.DEF: very bad, ugly, or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 非常糟糕的﹔极丑的﹔令人不快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather forecast is pretty grim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气预报说天气很恶劣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They painted a grim picture of what life used to be like there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将昔日那里的生活描绘成一幅悲惨的画面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grim industrial town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个丑陋的工业城镇

Sense.DEF: ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Juliet felt grim through the early months of her pregnancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀孕的头几个月﹐朱丽叶感觉很不舒服。

Sense.DEF: to hold something very tightly because you are afraid
to twist your face in an ugly way because you do not like something, because you are feeling pain, or because you are trying to be funny
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不喜欢某物﹑感到疼痛或开玩笑时〕扭曲脸部﹐做怪相

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She grimaced at her reflection in the mirror.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对着镜中的自己做了个怪脸。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She sipped the whisky and grimaced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她呷了一口威士忌﹐做了个怪相。

Sense.DEF: an expression you make by twisting your face because you do not like something or because you are feeling pain
Sense.TRAN: 脸部扭曲﹐怪相﹐鬼脸〔指不喜欢某物或感到疼痛时的面部表情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face twisted in a grimace of pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他痛得龇牙咧嘴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grimace of disgust
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表示厌恶的怪相

Sense.DEF: a lot of dirt
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls were black with grime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上黑黑的﹐积满了灰尘。

Sense.DEF: covered with dirt
Sense.TRAN: 满是污垢的﹐蒙上灰尘的
Sense.EXAMPLE: grimy windows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 落满灰尘的窗子

Sense.DEF: to smile widely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She grinned at me, her eyes sparkling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她咧嘴对我笑着﹐两眼放光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He walked out of the pool, grinning widely.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他满面笑容地从游泳池里走上来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was grinning like an idiot grinning in a silly way .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他像个傻瓜似的咧着嘴笑。

GramExa.GLOSS: grin very widely

Sense.DEF: to accept an unpleasant or difficult situation without complaining, usually because you realize there is nothing you can do to make it better
a wide smile
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came into the room with a friendly grin on his face .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走进房间﹐脸上带着亲切的微笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Of course,’ he agreed with a wide grin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “那当然。”他满脸堆笑地同意了。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: wipe the grin off sb’s face

Subsense.DEF: to break something such as corn or coffee beans into small pieces or powder, either in a machine or between two hard surfaces

GramExa.EXAMPLE: pepper
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现磨的胡椒粉

Subsense.DEF: to cut food, especially raw meat, into very small pieces by putting it through a machine
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ground beef
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛肉末

Sense.DEF: to make something smooth or sharp by rubbing it on a hard surface or by using a machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stone for grinding knives and scissors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 磨刀剪的石头
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lenses are ground to a high standard of precision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镜片被磨到很高的精确度。

Subsense.DEF: to press something onto a surface and rub it with a strong twisting movement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He dropped a cigar butt and ground it into the carpet with his heel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扔下雪茄烟头﹐用脚后跟把它碾进地毯里。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: He ground out his cigarette on the window ledge.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在窗台上捻灭香烟。

Subsense.DEF: to press hard against something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: as these plates large areas of land grind against each other
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着地壳板块的互相挤压

Sense.DEF: to rub your upper and lower teeth together, making a noise
Sense.TRAN: 把牙齿磨得嘎嘎响﹐磨牙

Subsense.DEF: if a vehicle grinds to a halt, it stops gradually
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Traffic ground to a halt as it approached the accident site.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车辆在靠近事故现场时慢慢停了下来。

Subsense.DEF: if a country, organization, or process grinds to a halt, its activity or the process gradually stops
Subsense.TRAN: 〔国家﹑组织或进程〕逐渐停顿﹐慢慢瘫痪
Subsense.EXAMPLE: After two days the talks had ground to a halt.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两天之后﹐谈判进行不下去了。

Sense.DEF:
to perform a special movement in
skateboarding
or
rollerblading
, which involves moving sideways along the edge of something, so that the bar connecting the wheels of the
skateboard
or
rollerblade
presses hard against the edge
Sense.TRAN: 〔玩滑板或溜冰时〕擦边﹐碾磨边缘

Sense.DEF: to treat someone in a cruel way for such a long time that they lose all courage and hope
Sense.TRAN: 〔长期地〕欺压﹐折磨〔某人﹐使其丧失勇气﹑希望等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never let male colleagues grind me down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从没让男同事欺负过我。

Sense.DEF: to continue for an unpleasantly long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the negotiations grind on, time is passing towards the deadline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判拖拖拉拉地进行着﹐很快就要到最后期限了。

Sense.DEF: to produce information, writing, music etc in such large amounts that it becomes boring
Sense.TRAN: 大量撰写﹐大量提供〔信息﹑文字﹑音乐作品等〕﹔粗制滥造
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frank just keeps grinding out detective stories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克就一篇又一篇不停地写侦探小说。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a rough, angry, or emotional way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You don’t love him,’ he ground out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你并不爱他！”他咬着牙说。

Sense.DEF: something that is hard work and physically or mentally tiring
Sense.EXAMPLE: I find the journey to work a real grind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得上班路上很辛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: workers emerging from their daily grind in the factory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干完繁重的日常劳动从工厂出来的工人

Sense.DEF: a student who never does anything except study

a movement in
skateboarding
or
rollerblading
, which involves moving sideways along the edge of something, so that the bar connecting the wheels of the
skateboard
or
rollerblade
presses hard against the edge
Sense.TRAN: 〔玩滑板或溜冰时的〕擦边动作﹐碾磨边沿动作

Sense.DEF:
a machine for crushing coffee beans,
peppercorns
etc into powder
very difficult and unpleasant, and never seeming to improve
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country devastated by civil war and grinding poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个被内战和极度贫困压垮的国家

Sense.DEF: a grinding noise is the continuous unpleasant noise of machinery parts rubbing together
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器部件的摩擦声〕持续而刺耳的

Sense.DEF: a large round stone that turns like a wheel, and is used for making tools and knives sharp when they are rubbed against it

Crossrefto.REFLEX: keep your nose to the grindstone

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word used in Latin America to refer to a foreigner, especially a white English-speaking person. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 外国佬〔拉丁美洲国家对外国人﹐尤其是对说英语的白人的称呼﹐极具冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF:
a
storyteller
from west Africa who teaches people about their history and culture
Sense.TRAN: 〔在西非给人们讲述历史和文化的〕民间艺人﹐江湖艺人

Sense.DEF: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抓住绳索别松手﹐不然你会掉下去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He released his grip and stepped back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放开手往后退去。

Sense.DEF: power and control over someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stalin’s determination to keep an iron grip on Eastern Europe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯大林对东欧实行铁腕控制的决心

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By 1979 South Africa was tightening its grip on Namibia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了1979年﹐南非加强了对纳米比亚的控制。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The recession could be avoided if business keeps a firm grip on its costs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 企业如果严格控制成本就可以避免不景气。

Sense.DEF: an understanding of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m just trying to get a grip on what’s happening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就是想了解出了什么事。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was losing her grip on reality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对现实世界越来越不理解。

Sense.DEF: to understand or deal with something difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never really got to grips with this new technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来没有真正了解这种新技术。

Sense.DEF: to become less confident and less able to deal with a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know what’s the matter; I think I’m losing my grip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道是怎么回事﹐我觉得我要控制不住了。

Sense.DEF: to start to improve your behaviour or control your emotions when you have been very upset
Sense.TRAN: 控制住自己的情绪﹐冷静下来
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop being hysterical and get a grip on yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别歇斯底里的﹐控制一下自己的情绪。

Sense.DEF: used in order to tell someone to control their emotions
Sense.EXAMPLE: For God’s sake get a grip!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看在上帝的份上﹐冷静点！

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in the grip of sth
Sense.DEF: to be experiencing a very unpleasant situation that cannot be controlled or stopped
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country in the grip of famine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受饥荒困扰的国家

Subsense.DEF: a special part of a handle that has a rough surface so that you can hold it firmly without it slipping
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My racquet needs a new grip.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的球拍需要换个握柄。

Subsense.DEF: the ability of something to stay on a surface without slipping
Subsense.EXAMPLE: boots which give a good grip
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防滑力强的靴子

Sense.DEF:
a
hairgrip
someone whose job is to move the cameras around while a television show or film is being made
Sense.TRAN: 〔拍摄电视节目或电影时的〕操控摄像[摄影]机的工作人员

Sense.DEF: a bag or case used for travelling
to hold something very tightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gripped the rail and tried not to look down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我紧紧抓住栏杆﹐尽量不往下看。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The woman moved closer to Beth, gripping her arm tightly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个女人走近贝丝﹐紧紧抓住她的胳膊。

Sense.DEF: to have a strong effect on someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country gripped by economic problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深受经济问题困扰的国家
Sense.EXAMPLE: Panic suddenly gripped me when it was my turn to speak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮到我说话时﹐我一下子惊慌起来。

Sense.DEF: to hold someone’s attention and interest
Sense.EXAMPLE: a story that really grips you
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扣人心弦的故事

Sense.DEF: if something grips a surface, it stays on it without slipping
Sense.TRAN: 紧附于〔某表面而不滑动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Radial tires grip the road well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子午线轮胎的防滑性能很好。

Sense.DEF: to complain about something in an annoying way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joe came in griping about how cold it was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔走进来﹐抱怨天气太冷。

Sense.DEF: something unimportant that you complain about
Sense.EXAMPLE: My main gripe was the price of refreshments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我主要的不满是茶点太贵。

Sense.DEF: sudden bad stomach pains
a liquid medicine which is given to babies when they have stomach pains
Sense.TRAN: 驱风剂〔治疗婴儿腹痛的药水〕

Sense.DEF: a griping pain is a sudden severe pain in your stomach
a gripping film, story etc is very exciting and interesting
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑故事等〕扣人心弦的﹐引人入胜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Collins’ gripping detective novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科林斯扣人心弦的侦探小说

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant and involving people being killed or injured
Sense.TRAN: 令人极其厌恶的﹐恐怖的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a series of grisly murders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串恐怖的凶杀案

Sense.DEF: something that is useful in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 有用的东西﹔有利的事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any publicity is good – it’s all grist to the mill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何宣传都是好的——它总能起到作用。

Sense.DEF: the part of meat that is not soft enough to eat
very small pieces of stone or sand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure both surfaces are free from dust and grit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要确保内外两面都没有灰尘和沙粒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The council is responsible for putting grit on icy roads.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政机构负责在结冰的道路上撒沙子。

Sense.DEF: determination and courage
a type of grain that is roughly crushed and cooked, and often eaten for breakfast
Sense.TRAN: 粗碾的谷物〔常于早餐食用〕

Sense.DEF: to scatter grit on a frozen road to make it less slippery

Subsense.DEF: to use all your determination to continue in spite of difficulties
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just grit your teeth and hang on – it’ll be over soon.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咬紧牙关坚持下去吧——事情很快会过去的。

Subsense.DEF: to bite your teeth together, especially when you are in pain, angry, or under pressure
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指在疼痛﹑生气或有压力时〕咬紧牙关
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ben gritted his teeth, hoping Sasha wouldn’t notice his fear.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本咬紧牙关﹐希望萨莎没有看出他的恐惧。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘No, that’s alright,’ she said through gritted teeth.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不用﹐没关系。”她咬着牙说。

Sense.DEF: a large vehicle that puts salt or sand on the roads in winter to make them less icy
Sense.TRAN: 〔冬天在道路上撒沙子或盐防滑的〕撒沙车﹐撒盐车

Sense.DEF: showing determination and courage
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henin gave a typically gritty performance, coming back from 4-0 down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海宁表现出一贯的坚毅﹐把零比四落后的比分扳回。
Sense.EXAMPLE: her gritty determination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那坚定的决心

Sense.DEF: showing a difficult or unpleasant situation as it really is
Sense.TRAN: 〔对困难处境等的描写〕逼真的﹐活生生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Billingham’s pictures have a gritty realism which can be almost upsetting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比林厄姆的照片展现活生生的现实﹐几乎达到令人揪心的程度。

Sense.DEF: containing grit or covered in grit
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gritty soil had got under her nails.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙土嵌进了她的指甲。

Sense.DEF: if a baby or child grizzles, they cry quietly for a long time
to complain in an annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben was grizzling about being tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本抱怨说很累。

Sense.DEF: having grey or greyish hair

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a grizzled old man
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 头发花白的老人

Sense.DEF: a very large bear that lives in the northwest of North America
Sense.TRAN: 〔生活在北美西北部的〕大灰熊

Sense.DEF: to make a long deep sound because you are in pain, upset, or disappointed, or because something is very enjoyable
Sense.TRAN: 〔因疼痛﹑心烦或失望而〕呻吟﹔〔因快乐而〕哼哼
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids all groaned when I switched off the TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我关掉电视时﹐孩子们都发出不满的抱怨声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As she kissed him, Gary groaned with pleasure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在她的亲吻之下﹐加里愉快地哼哼着。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Richard’s jokes make you groan rather than laugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德的笑话让你哭笑不得。

Sense.DEF: to complain about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m tired of him moaning and groaning all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一天到晚牢骚满腹﹐我都听腻了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s too hot!’ he groaned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “太热了！”他抱怨道。

Sense.DEF: to make a low deep sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old tree groaned in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老树在风中嘎吱作响。

Sense.DEF: if a table groans with food, there is a very large amount of food on it
a long deep sound that you make when you are in pain or do not want to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔疼痛时的〕呻吟﹔〔不愿做某事时发出的〕哼哼声
Sense.EXAMPLE: Casey let out a groan of protest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯西哼了一声表示抗议。

Sense.DEF: a long low deep sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door opened with a groan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门嘎吱一声开了。

Sense.DEF: a former British coin that had a low value
Sense.TRAN: 格罗特〔旧时英国的低面值硬币〕

Sense.DEF: someone who owns or works in a shop that sells food and other things used in the home
a grocer’s shop
food and other goods that are sold by a grocer or a supermarket

a
supermarket

a strong alcoholic drink, especially
rum
mixed with water
Sense.TRAN: 格罗格酒〔尤指掺水朗姆酒〕

Sense.DEF: any alcoholic drink
weak and unable to move well or think clearly because you are ill or very tired
Sense.TRAN: 〔因生病或劳累〕身体虚弱的﹐行走不稳的﹐头脑昏沉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt really groggy after 15 hours on the plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我乘了15个小时的飞机﹐感到昏昏沉沉的。

Sense.DEF: the place where the tops of your legs meet the front of your body

a
groyne
a small metal ring that is used around a hole in cloth or leather to make it stronger
a small piece of plastic that a doctor puts into a child’s ear in order to remove liquid from it
Sense.TRAN: 鼓室通气管﹐中耳引流管〔放入儿童耳中以除去耳内液体的塑料制品〕

Sense.DEF: to clean and brush an animal, especially a horse
Sense.TRAN: 擦洗﹐刷洗〔动物﹐尤指马匹〕

Sense.DEF: to prepare someone for an important job or position in society by training them over a long period

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tim was being groomed for a managerial position.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆正在接受培训﹐准备担任经理职位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clare’s been groomed to take her father’s place when he retires.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔一直作为父亲退休后的接班人受到培养。

Sense.DEF: to take care of your own appearance by keeping your hair and clothes clean and tidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair is always perfectly groomed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发总是梳得整整齐齐。

Sense.DEF: to develop a friendship with a child, with the intention of starting a sexual relationship. This is done by adults, and is illegal when the child is younger than 16.
Sense.TRAN: 诱骗﹐勾引〔儿童以图对其实施性侵犯〕

Sense.DEF: if an animal grooms itself or another animal, it cleans its own fur and skin or that of the other animal
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物为自己或另一动物〕梳理皮毛

Sense.DEF:
a
bridegroom
someone whose job is to feed, clean, and take care of horses
the process in which an adult develops a friendship with a child, with the intention of having a sexual relationship. This is illegal when the child is younger than 16.
Sense.TRAN: 〔以实施性侵犯为目的的〕儿童诱骗

Sense.DEF: the process of cleaning and brushing an animal, especially a horse

a friend of a
bridegroom
who has special duties at a wedding
a thin line cut into a hard surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bolt slid easily into the groove.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 插销顺畅地滑入凹槽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shallow groove cut into the cliff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悬崖上的一道浅槽

Sense.DEF: to do something in the same way for a long time so that it becomes boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our product range was stuck in a groove.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的产品线一成不变。

Sense.DEF: the beat of a piece of popular music
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hypnotic dub groove
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷幻的强节奏音乐

Sense.DEF: having a groove or several grooves
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slightly grooved surface
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有浅槽的表面

Sense.DEF: a word meaning fashionable, modern, and fun, used especially in the 1960s
Sense.TRAN: 时髦的﹐新潮的﹐有趣的〔此词尤用于20世纪60年代〕

Sense.DEF: to try to find something that you cannot see by feeling with your hands

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ginny groped for her glasses on the bedside table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 金尼在床头柜上摸着找眼镜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We groped around in the darkness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在黑暗中摸索。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere by feeling the way with your hands because you cannot see

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was groping my way blindly through the trees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我像瞎子似的在树丛中摸索着往前走。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ally groped steadily towards the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽摸索着稳步朝门口走去。

Sense.DEF: to try hard to find the right words to say or the right solution to a problem but without any real idea of how to do this
Sense.TRAN: 努力寻找〔恰当的言辞或正确的解决办法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hesitated, seeming to grope for words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她犹豫了一下﹐像是在寻找恰当的词语。

Sense.DEF: to move your hands over someone’s body to get sexual pleasure, especially when they do not want you to do this
Sense.TRAN: 爱抚〔尤指当对方不愿意的时候〕

Sense.DEF: touching someone’s body to get sexual pleasure, especially when they do not want you to do this
Sense.TRAN: 爱抚〔尤指当对方不愿意的时候〕

Subsense.DEF: a gross sum of money is the total amount before any tax or costs have been taken away
Subsense.TRAN: 〔扣除税或成本之前〕总的﹐毛的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a gross profit of $5 million
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 500万美元的毛利

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a family with gross earnings of just £75 per week
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 税前收入每周仅75英镑的家庭

Subsense.DEF: a gross weight is the total weight of something, including its wrapping

Sense.DEF: clearly wrong and unacceptable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: soldiers accused of gross violations of human rights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被指控严重侵犯人权的士兵
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company described reports of environmental disaster as gross exaggeration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司称﹐关于环境灾害的报道过于夸大其词。

GramExa.GLOSS: the crime of doing something that is sexually offensive

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant to look at or think about
Sense.TRAN: 令人讨厌的﹐令人厌恶的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ooh, gross! I hate spinach!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呃﹐恶心！我讨厌吃菠菜！

Sense.DEF: extremely fat and unattractive

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Medical records were found to be grossly inadequate.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 病史记录被发现很不完善。

Sense.DEF: to earn £20,000 etc before tax has been taken away
Sense.TRAN: 税前收入两万英镑/三万美元等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a junior executive earning $50,000 gross
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 税前收入为五万美元的初级行政人员

Sense.DEF: to gain an amount as a total profit, or earn it as a total amount, before tax has been taken away
Sense.TRAN: 获得…的总利润[毛利﹐税前收入]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie has already grossed over $10 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影票房总收入已经超过1,000万美元。

Sense.DEF: to make someone wish they had not seen or been told about something because it is so unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: His dirty fingernails really gross me out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脏指甲让我觉得很恶心。

Sense.DEF: a quantity of 144 things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: two gross of candles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两罗蜡烛

Sense.DEF: the difference between what something costs to produce and what it is sold for
unpleasant, shocking, and offensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s grotesque to portray peace campaigners as unpatriotic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把和平运动的倡导者说成是不爱国﹐这很荒唐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By modern standards, the treatment of prisoners was grotesque.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照现代标准来看﹐这样对待囚犯很荒唐。

Sense.DEF: extremely ugly in a strange or unnatural way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grotesque figure with a huge head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有着硕大脑袋的怪异人像

Sense.DEF:
a picture,
sculpture
etc of someone who is strangely ugly
a grotesque style in art

a small attractive
cave
nasty, dirty, or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 令人厌恶的﹔肮脏的﹔令人不快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grotty little bar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家脏兮兮的小酒吧

Sense.DEF: ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next day I felt a bit grotty .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天我觉得有点不舒服。

Sense.DEF: someone who is always complaining
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old grouch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱发牢骚的老头

Sense.DEF: something unimportant that you complain about
to complain in a slightly angry way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always grouching about something!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是发牢骚！

Sense.DEF: in a bad temper, especially because you are tired

Subsense.DEF: the surface of the earth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The leaves were slowly fluttering to the ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 树叶慢慢飘落到地上。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: He lay on the ground and stared up at the sky.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他躺在地上仰望天空。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The ground was frozen solid.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大地冻实了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At night, badgers feed above ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜间﹐獾来到地面上觅食。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: These youngsters work 70 metres below ground level .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年轻人在地下70米作业。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A raised platform stood two metres off the ground.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个凸起的平台离地面有两米高。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The air raids were followed by military action on the ground on land .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空袭之后是地面军事行动。
地面部队

Subsense.DEF: the soil on and under the surface of the earth
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Dig the ground over in the autumn.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋天的时候翻土。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Plant the seeds 2 cm deep in the ground.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把种子栽入两厘米深的地里。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The ground was dry, far too dry for growing corn.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土地太干﹐干得无法种庄稼。

Subsense.DEF: an area of land without buildings, fences, woods etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔无建筑物﹑栅栏或树木的〕空地
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The landscape is a mixture of open ground and woodland.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一带有空地﹐也有林区。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They were standing on the waste ground land in a town that is not being used behind the car park.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们站在停车场后面的荒地上。

Subsense.DEF: an area of land or sea that is used for a particular purpose
Subsense.EXAMPLE: fishing grounds
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渔场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These fields served as a hunting ground for the local people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些田地被用作当地人的狩猎场。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rivers are used as dumping grounds for industrial waste.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些河流被用作倾倒工业废料的地方。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: He is buried in sacred ground.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被安葬在神圣的土地上。

Subsense.DEF: the land or gardens surrounding a large building
Subsense.TRAN: 〔大型建筑物周围的〕场地﹐庭园
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We decided to take a stroll in the hotel grounds.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定在酒店的庭院里散散步。

Sense.DEF: a good reason for doing, believing, or saying something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mental cruelty can be grounds for divorce .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神折磨可以作为离婚的理由。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are strong grounds for believing his statement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有充分的理由可以相信他的话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did the police have reasonable grounds to arrest him?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方有充分的理由逮捕他吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proposal was rejected on environmental grounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个提议出于环保的原因被否决。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Flying was ruled out on grounds of cost.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因费用的缘故而不考虑乘飞机。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re under arrest.’ ‘On what grounds?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你被捕了。”“理由是什么？”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We oppose the bill, on the grounds that it discriminates against women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们反对这个议案﹐理由是它歧视女性。

Sense.DEF: a subject or area of knowledge
Sense.EXAMPLE: At meetings, we just keep going over the same ground talking about the same things .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开会时我们只是反复谈论同一个话题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His latest movie looks set to break new ground introduce new and exciting ideas .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最新的影片看来会有新的突破。

GramExa.GLOSS: a subject etc that you know something about
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In his latest book, McManus returns to more familiar ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克马纳斯在他最近的著作中又回到了较熟悉的话题上。

Sense.DEF: a general opinion or set of attitudes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Often parents and teenagers find they have little common ground they do not share the same attitudes etc .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长和十几岁的青少年往往会发现他们之间鲜有共同的观点。

GramExa.GLOSS: opinions that are not extreme that most people would agree with
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both parties are battling to occupy the centre ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两党都在争取占领中间阵地。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Careful, Laura. You could be treading on dangerous ground expressing opinions etc that might offend someone .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心啊﹐劳拉﹐你的观点可能会冒犯到某些人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each side was unwilling to give ground change their opinion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各方都不愿作出让步。

Sense.DEF: the place where a particular sport is played
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new football ground
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新建的足球场
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s their first defeat at their home ground the ground that belongs to a particular team all season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他们在整个赛季中第一次主场失利。

Subsense.DEF: to stay where you are when someone threatens you, in order to show them that you are not afraid
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The men threatened him, but he stood his ground and they fled.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些人威胁他﹐但是他没有退却﹐他们便溜走了。

Subsense.DEF: to refuse to change your mind about something, even though people are opposing you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jason vowed to stand his ground, even if it meant losing his job.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾森发誓哪怕是丢掉工作也要坚守立场。

Sense.DEF: to start to be successful
