Sense.TRAN: 开始获得成功﹐取得进展
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her show never really got off the ground in the UK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的节目在英国一直没有火起来。

Subsense.DEF: to become more successful
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was feared that the extreme right would gain ground in the election.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们担心极右翼势力会在选举中得势。

Subsense.DEF: if an idea, belief etc gains ground, more people start to accept it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His theories gradually gained ground among academics.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的理论渐渐被学者们接受了。

Subsense.DEF: to get closer to someone or something that you are competing with

Sense.DEF: to become less successful compared with someone or something you are competing with
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Indian team seem determined to regain the ground they lost in the last game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度队在上一场比赛中失利﹐这次似乎下定决心要扳回一城。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something develops quickly or successfully
Sense.EXAMPLE: The region, with its widespread poverty, provided fertile ground for revolutionary activists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区普遍贫困﹐是产生革命活动家的沃土。

GramExa.GLOSS: to provide the situation or conditions in which something can develop successfully
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My task was to prepare the ground for the recruitment of support workers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的任务是为支援人员招聘做准备工作。

Sense.DEF: to destroy a city, building etc completely by fire, bombs etc
Sense.TRAN: 把某物烧成平地/夷为平地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city of Tortona was burnt to the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尔托纳城被焚为平地。

Sense.DEF: to work so hard that you become very tired or ill
Sense.TRAN: 使自己筋疲力尽﹐把自己累垮
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kay’s working herself into the ground trying to meet her deadlines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯在拼命工作﹐想如期完成任务。

Sense.DEF: in the place or situation where something important is happening, rather than somewhere else – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 在现场〔指重大事件发生的现场﹔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: While the politicians talk of peace, the situation on the ground remains tense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政客们在大谈和平的时候﹐战场局势依然紧张。

Sense.DEF: someone’s stamping ground is an area where they are known or have a lot of influence
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人的〕势力范围﹐有影响力的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: I guess he’ll try to reach his old stomping ground to drum up support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我猜他是想到他的老地盘去争取支持。

Sense.DEF: a wire that connects a piece of electrical equipment to the ground for safety
small pieces of solid material that sink to the bottom of a liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: coffee grounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡渣

Sense.DEF: to make it hard for people to find you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man has gone to ground since his photograph was published in a national newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从照片上了一家全国性的报纸以后﹐那人就销声匿迹了。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in finding someone or something after a long search
Sense.TRAN: 费尽周折找到某人/某物

Sense.DEF: the colour used as the background for a design

Crossrefto.REFLEX: cut the ground from under sb’s feet
have/keep both feet on the ground
suit sb down to the ground

Exponent.DEF: the surface of the earth, or the soil on its surface
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He collapsed and fell to the ground.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他瘫倒在地上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ground was wet and muddy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地上潮湿泥泞。

Exponent.DEF: the ground at the bottom of the ocean, a forest, a cave etc
Exponent.TRAN: 大洋底/森林的地面/洞底等
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many wonderful creatures live on the ocean floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多奇妙的生物生活在大洋之底。

Exponent.DEF: used when talking about an area of ground that is owned by someone, or is used for an activity Also used when talking about the part of the earth’s surface that is not covered with water.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔某人拥有的〕土地﹔〔某种活动的〕用地﹔陆地
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His family owns a lot of land.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他家拥有大量土地。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: agricultural land
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业用地
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She got off the ferry, happy to be back on dry land .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从渡船上下来﹐很高兴又回到了陆地上。

Exponent.DEF: a type of land – used when talking about how easy an area of land is to cross, and whether it is rocky, flat etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Land Rover is built to go over rough terrain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 路虎是为穿越崎岖地形而设计的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The terrain gets flatter when you go further south.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 越往南地势越平坦。

Exponent.DEF: the substance that plants grow in
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The vegetables were still covered in black soil.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些蔬菜上还带着黑土。

Exponent.DEF: wet earth
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Your shoes are covered in mud.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的鞋上全是烂泥。

Sense.DEF: to stop an aircraft or pilot from flying
Sense.TRAN: 禁止〔飞机或飞行员〕飞行﹐使停飞
Sense.EXAMPLE: All planes are grounded until the fog clears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雾散之前﹐所有的飞机都停飞了。

Sense.DEF: if you ground a boat or if it grounds, it hits the bottom of the sea so that it cannot move
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both boats grounded on a mud bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两条船都在泥滩上搁浅了。

Sense.DEF: to be based on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lewis’ ideas were grounded in his Christian faith.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯的观点建立在他的基督教信仰之上。

Sense.DEF: to stop a child going out with their friends as a punishment for behaving badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got home at 2 am and Dad grounded me on the spot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我凌晨2点回家﹐爸爸当即罚我不准出去。

Sense.DEF: to make a piece of electrical equipment safe by connecting it to the ground with a wire
to teach someone the basic things they should know in order to be able to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most seven-year-olds are grounded in the basics of reading and writing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数七岁儿童都要接受读写的基本训练。

Sense.DEF: ground coffee or nuts have been broken up into powder or very small pieces, using a special machine

the past tense and past participle of
grind
food that you throw onto a river, lake etc when you are fishing in order to attract fish

beef
that has been cut up into very small pieces, often used to make
hamburgers
groundbreaking work involves making new discoveries, using new methods etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: groundbreaking research
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具开拓性的研究

Sense.DEF: a piece of material that water cannot pass through, which people sleep on when they are camping
Sense.TRAN: 〔野营时睡觉用的〕铺地防潮布

Sense.DEF: the people on the ground who are responsible for guiding the flight of spacecraft or aircraft
Sense.TRAN: 〔航天或航空的〕地面控制人员

Sense.DEF: the group of people who work at an airport looking after the aircraft
reasonable and in control of your emotions, even when this is difficult
Sense.TRAN: 理性的﹐有理智的﹐克制的

Sense.DEF: someone who is grounded understands their own character and knows what is really important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simmons says that her family keeps her grounded .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙斯说她的家人使她对自己保持着清醒的认识。

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a child, who is grounded is kept indoors as a punishment

a ball that is hit along the ground in a game of
baseball
the floor of a building that is at ground level
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ground floor flat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套底层的公寓房
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dining room is on the ground floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐厅在一楼。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/get in on the ground floor
Sense.DEF: to become involved in a plan, business activity etc from the beginning
Sense.TRAN: 从一开始便参加〔某计划﹑商务活动等〕

Sense.DEF: soldiers who fight on the ground rather than at sea or in the air
glass that has been made into a powder
glass that has been rubbed on its surface so that you cannot see through it, but light passes through it – used for example on a camera
a small North American animal that has thick brown fur

(in the US) 2nd February. On this day, according to old stories, the groundhog comes out of its hole for the first time since winter began. If it sees its shadow, it is frightened back into its hole and there will be six more weeks of winter, but if it is cloudy and the groundhog cannot see its shadow, there will be an early spring. If one day seems very like another, people sometimes say that it’s like Groundhog Day, a film in which the main character has the chance to live the same day several times.
Sense.TRAN: 土拨鼠日〔2月2日在美国为土拨鼠日﹐传说是土拨鼠冬末第一次出洞的日子。如果它看到自己的影子﹐被吓回洞里﹐那么冬天还将持续六周。如果是阴天﹐它看不到自己的影子﹐那就将迎来早春。假如某一天与另一天很相似﹐人们有时就会说这一天像土拨鼠日。这一用法来自电影Groundhog Day（《偷天情缘》）﹐影片中的主人公重复生活在同一天里〕

Sense.DEF: a training in the basic parts of a subject or skill

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A basic grounding in math is essential for the economics course.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对经济学这门课程来说﹐基本的数学功底是必不可少的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Applicants must have a good grounding in human resources management.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请者必须在人力资源管理方面具有良好的基础。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The aim of the course is to give students a thorough grounding in English pronunciation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课的教学目标是让学生彻底掌握英语发音的基本功。

Sense.DEF: a punishment for a child’s bad behaviour in which they are not allowed to go out with their friends for a period of time
the process of officially stopping an aircraft from flying, especially because it is not safe to fly
when someone knows what their own character is like and understands what is really important and what is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sense of grounding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自我认识感

Sense.DEF: not based on facts or reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fortunately my suspicions proved groundless .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好我的猜疑后来证明是没有根据的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Kay’s lawyer said the accusations were groundless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯先生的律师说这是无端的指控。

Sense.DEF: the same level as the surface of the earth, rather than above it or below it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flats are set around a courtyard with shops at ground level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公寓楼中央是一个庭院﹐底层是店铺。

Sense.DEF:
a
peanut
or peanut plant
a drawing of how a building is arranged at ground level, showing the size, position, and shape of walls, rooms etc
a plan for doing something in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: documents which formed the ground plan for the welfare state
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为福利国家制度草案的文件

Sense.DEF: rent that you pay to the person who owns the land that your house, office etc is built on
the basic rules or principles on which future actions or behaviour should be based

GramExa.PROPFORM: lay down/establish ground rules for sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our book lays down the ground rules for building a patio successfully.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书为怎样成功建造露台定下了基本原则。

Sense.DEF: a piece of material that water cannot pass through which people sleep on when they are camping
Sense.TRAN: 〔野营时睡觉用的〕铺地防潮布

Sense.DEF: a man whose job is to take care of a large garden or sports field
Sense.TRAN: 大花园管理员﹔运动场地管理员

Sense.DEF:
a
gopher
the people who take care of the grass and equipment at a sports ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动场草坪和运动器材〕管理人员

Sense.DEF: the group of people who work at an airport looking after the aircraft
a way of hitting the ball after it has hit the ground in tennis and similar games
a sudden increase in a particular feeling among people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a groundswell of opinion that tougher laws are needed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求从严立法的舆论高涨。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a groundswell of support for the Prime Minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相支持率的大幅上升

Sense.DEF: water that is below the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are fears that groundwater might become contaminated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人担心地下水可能会遭污染。

Sense.DEF: something that has to happen before an activity or plan can be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: His speech laid the groundwork for independence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演说为独立打下了基础。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much of the groundwork has already been done .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 准备工作已经完成了很多。

Sense.DEF: the exact place where a bomb explodes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buildings within 25 km of ground zero would be flattened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 着地点25公里以内的建筑物都将被夷为平地。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: several people or things that are all together in the same place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a group of children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群孩子
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small group of islands
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小群岛屿
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Get into groups of four.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 分成四个人一组。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was surrounded by a group of admirers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的身边围了一群仰慕者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dolphins travel in small groups.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海豚结成小群活动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A group of us are going to London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有一群人要去伦敦。

Sense.DEF: several people or things that are connected with each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或物彼此之间有某种联系的〕团体﹐群体
Sense.EXAMPLE: a left-wing terrorist group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个左翼恐怖组织

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is one of a group of women who have suffered severe side-effects from the drug.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群女性服用此药后受到严重副作用影响﹐她是其中的一个。

GramExa.GLOSS: people of the same age, race etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 年龄段/族群/收入群体等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Minority groups are encouraged to apply.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼓励少数民族前来申请。

Sense.DEF: several companies that all have the same owner
Sense.EXAMPLE: a giant textiles group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庞大的纺织集团

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He owns a group of hotels in southern England.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在英格兰南部拥有一个酒店集团。

Sense.DEF: a number of musicians or singers who perform together, playing popular music
Sense.TRAN: 〔演奏流行音乐的〕乐团﹐乐队﹐组合

Exponent.DEF: several people together in the same place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A group of boys stood by the school gate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群男孩站在学校门口。

Exponent.DEF: a large group of people who have come to a place to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were crowds of shoppers in the streets.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上是成群的购物者。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The crowd all cheered.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群齐声喝彩。

Exponent.DEF: a large, noisy, and perhaps violent crowd
Exponent.EXAMPLE: An angry mob of demonstrators approached.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群愤怒的示威者走过来。

Exponent.DEF: a large group of people all close together in one place, so that they seem like a single thing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The square in front of the station was a solid mass of people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 车站前面的广场上﹐人群挤得水泄不通。

Exponent.DEF: a group of people who are all similar in some way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’re a nice bunch of kids.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是一伙可爱的小孩子。

Exponent.DEF: a group of young people, especially a group that often causes trouble and fights
Exponent.TRAN: 一帮﹐一群〔常常肇事打架的年轻人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was attacked by a gang of youths.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他遭到一帮少年的袭击。

Exponent.DEF: a noisy group of people who are behaving badly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was met by a rabble of noisy angry youths.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他碰到了一帮怒气冲冲的少年。

Exponent.DEF: a very large group of people who all go somewhere
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In summer hordes of tourists flock to the island.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天﹐成群的游客蜂拥来到这座海岛。

Exponent.DEF: a group of people who all work together, especially on a ship or plane
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指轮船或飞机上的〕全体工作人员
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the ship’s crew
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该船的船员
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The flight crew will serve drinks shortly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘务员马上就来供应饮料。

Exponent.DEF: a group of people who are travelling or working together
Exponent.TRAN: 〔一起旅行或工作的〕一群人﹐一帮人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A party of tourists stood at the entrance to the temple.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群游客站在庙宇的入口处。

Exponent.DEF: a group of people who work together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She is being cared for by a team of doctors.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正在一个医生小组的照料之下。

Exponent.DEF: a group of cows, deer, or elephants
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A herd of cows was blocking the road.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群牛把路堵塞了。

Exponent.DEF: a group of sheep or birds
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a flock of seagulls
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群海鸥
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The farmer has over 100 sheep in his flock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这农夫有100多只羊。

Exponent.DEF: a group of dogs or wolves
a group of kittens or puppies born at one time to a particular mother
Exponent.TRAN: 〔猫或狗一胎所生的〕一窝〔幼崽〕

Exponent.DEF: a group of fish or dolphins
a group of things held or tied together, especially flowers or keys
Exponent.TRAN: 一束﹐一串〔尤指花或钥匙〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He handed me a bunch of daffodils.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他递给我一束水仙花。

Exponent.DEF: several papers, clothes, or sticks held or tied together in an untidy pile
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bundles of papers and files filled the shelves.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 架子上放满了一捆捆文件和卷宗。

Exponent.DEF: a group of things of the same kind that are close together in a place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cluster of stars
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一簇星星

Sense.DEF: to come together and form a group, or to arrange things or people together in a group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The photo shows four men grouped round a jeep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 照片上是四个男人围着一辆吉普车。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Different flowers can be grouped together to make a colourful display.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以把不同的花组合在一起﹐布置得绚丽多姿。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: small producers who group together to sell their produce
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合销售产品的小生产商

Sense.DEF: to divide people or things into groups according to a system
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were grouped into six age bands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被分成六个年龄段。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve grouped the questions under three headings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把这些问题分别归在三个标题下面。

Sense.DEF: a fairly high rank in the British air force, or someone who has this rank
the way in which people in a group behave towards each other when they are working together or doing an activity together
a young woman who follows popular musicians or other famous people around, hoping to meet them
a number of people, things, or organizations that do something together or have the same interests, qualities, or features
Sense.TRAN: 〔出于共同目的或有相同特质者组成的〕团体﹐集团

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a grouping of eight opposition parties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由八个反对党组成的集团

GramExa.EXAMPLE: During this period the family unit becomes the natural social grouping.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一时期里﹐家族成了自然的社会群体。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a loose grouping informal and not well organized of anti-capitalist protesters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个由反对资本主义的抗议者组成的松散群体

Sense.DEF: the act of putting people or things into groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grouping of students by ability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按学生能力分组

Sense.DEF: a group of several doctors who all work in the same building
a method of treating people with emotional problems by getting them to meet and talk as a group
Sense.TRAN: 群体治疗〔让有情感问题或心理疾病的患者在群体里谈论自己的问题﹐以达到治疗目的〕

Sense.DEF: a small bird that is hunted and shot for food and sport, or the flesh of this bird
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grouse shooting season
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 捕猎松鸡的季节
Sense.EXAMPLE: roast grouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤松鸡

Sense.DEF: a complaint
Sense.EXAMPLE: His main grouse is that he isn’t paid enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他主要的不满就是工资不够高。

Sense.DEF: to complain about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t really got much to grouse about.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我其实没什么好抱怨的。

Sense.DEF:
a mixture of sand and water that you spread between
tiles
when you fix them to a wall
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于墙上瓷砖之间抹缝的〕勾缝剂﹐薄胶泥

Sense.DEF: a piece of land with trees growing on it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small grove of beech trees
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小片山毛榉树林

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He owns an orange grove near Tel Aviv.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在特拉维夫附近拥有一个橘园。

Sense.DEF: used in the names of roads …
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lisson Grove
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利森路

Sense.DEF: to praise someone a lot or behave with a lot of respect towards them because you think that they are important and will be able to help you in some way – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔因有求于人而〕卑躬屈膝〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had to really grovel to the bank manager to get a loan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了取得贷款﹐我只得向银行经理说了一大堆好话。

Sense.DEF: to move along the ground on your hands and knees
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw him grovelling in the road for his hat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到他趴在路上找帽子。

Subsense.DEF: to increase in amount, size, number, or strength
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Support for Mr Thompson is growing.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤普森先生的支持率在上升。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sales of new cars grew by 10% last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年新车的销量增长了10%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The number of students at the college has grown from 200 to over 500.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该学院的学生人数从200名增加到了500多名。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: A growing number of people are taking part-time jobs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的人在干兼职。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The economy has grown steadily.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济稳步增长。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Fears are growing for the crew’s safety.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对船员的安危越来越担心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a city that is still growing in size
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 规模还在扩大的城市
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Skiing has really grown in popularity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 滑雪真是越来越流行了。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: There is growing concern about climate change.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们越来越担心气候的变化。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: my growing interest in China
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对中国越来越浓厚的兴趣

Subsense.DEF: to make a business or part of a business bigger and more successful
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We want to grow the export side of the business.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想加强公司的出口业务。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say an amount or level goes up rather than grows .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示数量或程度的增加﹐人们一般说go up﹐而不说grow
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Sales went up by 10% last year.
The population of the town has gone up to almost a million.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇上的人口增加到了将近100万。

Sense.DEF: to become bigger, taller etc over a period of time in the process of becoming an adult
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve really grown since I last saw you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你比我上次见到时长了不少啊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Victor seemed to grow taller every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克托好像一天比一天高。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stan grew two inches in six months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦在六个月里长高了两英寸。

Subsense.DEF: if plants grow, they exist and develop in a natural way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a tree which will grow well in most types of soil
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大部分土壤里都能生长得很好的一种树
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The plants grow wild grow without anyone looking after them by the river.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些植物在河边自然生长。

Subsense.DEF: to make plants or crops develop and produce fruit or flowers
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Many families own plots of land to grow food.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人家都有自己的小块土地种植粮食。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Britain grows 6,000,000 tonnes of potatoes a year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国一年种植600万吨马铃薯。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The growing season is from April to September.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4月到9月是种植季节。

Subsense.DEF: if you grow your hair or nails, you do not cut them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve decided to grow my hair long .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定把头发留长。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓄胡须/胡子

Subsense.DEF: when hair or nails grow, they become longer
to change and become different quite slowly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The sound was growing louder.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 声音越来越响。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her tastes have changed as she’s grown older.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的品位随着年龄的增长而改变了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Donna has grown tired of being a model.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐娜已经厌倦了当模特。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Gradually, Fiona’s eyes grew used to the darkness she gradually became able to see a little better .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渐渐地﹐费奥娜的眼睛适应了黑暗。

Subsense.DEF: to gradually change your opinions and have a feeling that you did not have before
Subsense.TRAN: 逐渐改变看法[产生某种感觉]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After a while the kids grew to like Mr Cox.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了一会儿﹐孩子们开始喜欢上了考克斯先生。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the city he had grown to love
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他渐渐开始喜欢的城市

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say get older/tired/angry etc rather than grow older/tired/angry etc, which sounds rather literary.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说get older/tired/angry等﹐而不说grow older/tired/angry等﹐因为后者听上去有点像文学语言
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The sound was getting louder.

Sense.DEF: to gradually become better, bigger etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s grown tremendously as a musician.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一名音乐人﹐她成长了许多。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you should not waste money
Sense.TRAN: 钱不是从树上长出来的〔用以表示不可浪费金钱〕

Sense.DEF: if two people grow apart, their relationship becomes less close
Sense.EXAMPLE: The couple had been growing apart for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对夫妇多年来日渐疏远。

Sense.DEF: to develop over time and become a particular kind of person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue grew into a lovely young woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休长成了一个可爱的姑娘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two-part show has grown into a full-fledged series.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个由两部分组成的演出已经演变成一部内容丰满的连续剧。

Sense.DEF: to gradually learn how to do a job or deal with a situation successfully
Sense.TRAN: 学着适应〔某个工作或某种情形〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She will grow into her new role over the next few months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在今后的几个月里她会慢慢适应她的新角色。

Sense.DEF: if a child grows into clothes, he or she becomes big enough to wear them
Sense.TRAN: 长大可以穿〔本来嫌大的衣服〕

Sense.DEF: if something grows on you, you gradually like it more and more
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hated his music at first, but it grows on you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一开始讨厌他的音乐﹐可慢慢却越来越喜欢。

Sense.DEF: if you grow out a hairstyle, or if it grows out, you gradually grow your hair until the style disappears
Sense.TRAN: （使）头发长长而让原来的发型消失

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m growing my fringe out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我准备把刘海留长不要了。

Sense.DEF: if a child grows out of clothes, he or she becomes too big to wear them
Sense.TRAN: 因长大而穿不进〔原来的衣服〕

Sense.DEF: if someone grows out of something, they stop doing it as they get older
Sense.TRAN: 〔因年龄增长而〕戒除﹐改掉〔某习惯〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike finally seems to be growing out of his rebelliousness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克似乎终于长大﹐正慢慢改变他叛逆的性格。

Sense.DEF: to develop or happen as a result of something else that happened or existed
Sense.EXAMPLE: His art grew out of his love of nature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的艺术作品源于他对大自然的热爱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: legislation which grew out of concern over the increasing crime rate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于对犯罪率增长的担心而制定的法规

Sense.DEF: to develop from being a child to being an adult
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you want to be when you grow up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你长大以后想做什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I grew up in Chicago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在芝加哥长大。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to behave in a more responsible way, like an adult
to start to exist or develop gradually
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trading settlements grew up by the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河的两岸形成了一些贸易定居点。

Sense.DEF: a large plastic bag containing specially prepared earth for growing vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 盆栽袋﹐生长袋〔装有种植蔬菜专用土壤的大塑料袋〕

Sense.DEF: a person or company that grows fruit or vegetables in order to sell them
Sense.TRAN: 〔水果﹑蔬菜等的〕种植户﹐种植公司

GramExa.EXAMPLE: apple growers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果种植户

Sense.DEF: a plant that grows and develops in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bamboo is a very vigorous grower.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 竹子是一种生命力非常强的植物。

Sense.DEF: problems and difficulties that happen when an organization or system is new
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织或制度〕发展初期的困难
Sense.EXAMPLE: the growing pains of a new republic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新建共和国的初期困难

Sense.DEF: pain that children who are growing feel in their arms and legs
if an animal growls, it makes a long deep angry sound

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dog growled at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那狗冲着我低声吼叫。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a low angry voice
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Get out of my way,’ he growled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “滚开。”他低声咆哮道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Who are you?’ he growled at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你是谁？”他冲着我低吼道。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He heard a low growl behind him.

Sense.DEF: an adult man or woman, used especially when you think someone is not behaving as an adult should
Sense.TRAN: 成年男子/女子〔尤用于认为某人行为不像一个成年人时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who ever heard of a grown man being scared of the dark?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有谁听说过一个大男人还怕黑？

Sense.DEF: children etc who are now adults
Sense.TRAN: 已经成年的子女/女儿/儿子
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got two grown daughters and a son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有两个已经成年的女儿和一个儿子。

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
grow
fully developed as an adult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before you know it, the children will be grown-up and leaving home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 转眼之间﹐孩子们就会长大成人离家而去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got two grown-up sons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有两个已经成年的儿子。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a responsible way, like an adult
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为〕体现成年人责任的﹐成熟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You are old enough to know better, and I expect more grown-up behaviour from you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你长大了﹐该更懂事﹐我希望你能更像个大人。

Sense.DEF: an adult – used by or to children
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re frightened, tell one of the grown-ups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你害怕﹐就跟大人讲。

Sense.DEF: an increase in amount, number, or size

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve seen an enormous growth in the number of businesses using the Web.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看到使用网络的公司数量剧增。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rapid growth of world population
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界人口的迅速增长
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recent growth of interest in African music
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来对非洲音乐的兴趣增加

Sense.DEF: an increase in the value of goods or services produced and sold by a business or a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: measures to stimulate economic growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺激经济增长的措施

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a period of rapid growth in the economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济迅猛发展的时期

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is preparing for zero growth no growth this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司今年准备面对零增长。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Debt collection is a huge growth industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 收债是一个发展中的庞大产业。

Sense.DEF: the development of the physical size, strength etc of a person, animal, or plant over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vitamins are essential for healthy growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维生素是健康成长所必需的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a means of stimulating plant growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺激植物生长的方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: a growth hormone substance in the body that causes you to grow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生长激素

Sense.DEF: a gradual increase in the importance or influence that something has

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cinemas declined with the growth of television.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着电视的发展﹐电影院衰落了。

Sense.DEF: the development of someone’s character, intelligence, or emotions
Sense.TRAN: 〔性格﹑智力或情感的〕发展﹐成长
Sense.EXAMPLE: A loving home is essential for a child’s personal growth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和睦的家庭是孩子个人成长所必需的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the journey toward spiritual growth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神成长之路

Sense.DEF: a swelling on or inside a person, animal, or plant, caused by disease
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cancerous growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 癌性赘生物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a growth on his lung
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他肺部的一个赘生物

Sense.DEF: something that has grown
Sense.EXAMPLE: Feed the plants to encourage new growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要给植物施肥﹐促进新枝叶生长。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His chin bore a thick growth of stubble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的下巴上布满浓密的胡茬。

Sense.DEF: a low wall built out into the sea to prevent the sea from removing sand and stones from the shore
food
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s get some grub.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们弄点吃的吧。

Sense.DEF: an insect when it is in the form of a small soft white worm
to look for something on the ground or just under the ground, especially by moving things around
Sense.TRAN: 〔在地上或地面下〕寻找〔尤指翻动周围的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jake got on the floor and grubbed about under the desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克趴在地板上﹐在桌子下面四处找。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: chickens grubbing for worms
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 觅虫吃的鸡

Sense.DEF: to dig plants out of the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Farmers were encouraged to grub up hedgerows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼓励农民们把矮树篱挖出来。

Sense.DEF: fairly dirty
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grubby handkerchief
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脏兮兮的手帕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gang of grubby kids
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群邋遢的孩子

Sense.DEF: grubby behaviour or activity is morally unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为或活动〕肮脏的﹐不道德的﹐卑鄙的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grubby details of his financial dealings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那些金融交易中的肮脏细节

Sense.DEF: used to talk about someone touching something or becoming involved in it when you do not want them to
Sense.TRAN: 肮脏的手/爪子〔用于表示不希望某人触碰某物或卷入某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep your grubby paws to yourself!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的脏爪子拿开！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bet he can’t wait to get his grubby hands on my money!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢肯定他是迫不及待要把他那双脏手伸向我的钱！

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is provided to develop a new business in return for a share of the profits
Sense.TRAN: 〔为分红而投资开发新业务的〕资金﹐贷款

Sense.DEF: a feeling of dislike for someone because you cannot forget that they harmed you in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is there anyone who might have had a grudge against her?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有谁可能对她怀恨在心？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Gillis was not normally a man to bear grudges .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉利斯先生通常不是那种会积怨的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not harbouring some secret grudge against you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有对你暗地里怀恨在心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It could be the work of someone with a grudge against the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事可能是某些对公司怀有怨愤的人干的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You let nasty little personal grudges creep in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就由着怨恨的情绪一点一点滋长。

Sense.DEF: a fight or sports competition between two people who dislike each other a lot
Sense.TRAN: 〔打斗或体育比赛中〕冤家对头的决斗/比赛

Sense.DEF: to do or give something very unwillingly
Sense.TRAN: 勉强做〔某事〕﹔勉强给〔某物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I really grudge paying for poor service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务很差﹐我实在是不愿意付钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t grudge him his success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他的成功是应该的。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He grudgingly admitted he’d been wrong.

Sense.DEF:
a food made of
oats
cooked in water or milk, which poor people ate in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去穷人吃的〕燕麦粥﹐麦片粥

Sense.DEF: very difficult and tiring
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cast took a break from their gruelling schedule.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演员们在繁重的工作日程中忙里偷闲﹐休息了一会儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grueling journey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳累的旅途

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant or shocking, and involving someone being killed or badly injured
Sense.TRAN: 令人厌恶的﹐可怕的〔涉及有人被杀或受重伤〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police described it as a particularly gruesome attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方称这是一起极其恐怖的袭击事件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spare me the gruesome details.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别跟我讲那些可怕的细节。

Sense.DEF: speaking in a rough unfriendly voice
Sense.TRAN: 〔说话的口气〕不友好的﹐生硬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His manner can be rather gruff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的态度有时候很生硬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gruff reply
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生硬的回答
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice became gruff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的声音变得生硬了。

Sense.DEF: to keep complaining in an unhappy way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Farmers are always grumbling about the weather.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农民老是在抱怨天气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A few passengers grumbled that their cabins were too small.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个乘客抱怨座舱太小。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘This is boring,’ Kathleen grumbled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这真无聊。”凯瑟琳抱怨道。

Sense.DEF: to make a low continuous sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thunder grumbled overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头顶上雷声隆隆。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are fairly healthy and happy
Sense.TRAN: 还不错〔用来表示自己健康愉悦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How are you today?’ ‘Mustn’t grumble.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你今天好吗？”“还不错。”

Sense.DEF: a complaint about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She paid up, with some grumbling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很不情愿地嘟哝着付了钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soon, the grumblings turned to open discontent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久﹐这些牢骚就成了公开的不满。

Sense.DEF: a low continuous sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: the grumbling of distant thunder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处隆隆的雷声

Sense.DEF: bad-tempered and easily annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mina’s always a bit grumpy first thing in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明娜早上起来总是有点脾气。

Sense.DEF: a style of fashion and music popular with young people in the 1990s, involving loud electric music and dirty clothes, hair etc
Sense.TRAN: 邋遢时尚﹔邋遢音乐〔20世纪90年代年轻人中流行的一种时尚和音乐风格〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: grunge rock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邋遢摇滚乐

Sense.DEF: unpleasant dirt
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s all that grunge in the bathtub?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浴缸里那些脏兮兮的是什么东西？

Sense.DEF: to make short sounds or say a few words in a rough voice, when you do not want to talk
Sense.TRAN: 〔在不愿意讲话时〕发出哼声﹔嘟哝着说
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just grunted and carried on reading his book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是哼了一声﹐继续看他的书。

Sense.DEF: if a person or animal grunts, they make short low sounds in their throat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grunting with effort, she lifted me up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她哼哧着费力地把我抱起来。

Sense.DEF: a short low sound that a person or animal makes in their throat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris gave a grunt and went back to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯哼了一声﹐又继续睡了。

Sense.DEF: someone who does hard physical work for low pay
Sense.EXAMPLE: The grunts move the crates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们搬板条箱。

Sense.DEF:
a soldier in the
infantry
the difficult and uninteresting part of a job
Sense.TRAN: 〔某项工作中〕困难而单调的部分﹐苦活
Sense.EXAMPLE: These guys do the grunt work in preparing tax returns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些家伙干的是准备纳税申报单的苦活。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
griffin

the place in a woman’s
vagina
where she is thought to feel the most sexual pleasure
Sense.TRAN: G点〔女性阴部的最敏感点〕

Sense.DEF: a very small piece of underwear that covers only the sexual organs

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Great , used in names 大〔用于名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gt Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大不列颠

Sense.DEF:
a cold Mexican dish made with crushed
avocado
Sense.TRAN: 鳄梨色拉〔一种墨西哥凉菜〕

Sense.DEF: solid waste from sea birds, put on soil to help plants grow

Subsense.DEF: to promise to do something or to promise that something will happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I guarantee you’ll love this film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我保证你会喜欢这部电影的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you send the application form in straight away, I can guarantee you an interview.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你马上把申请表寄过去﹐我可以保证你会有一个面试的机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I cannot guarantee to work for more than a year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能保证工作一年以上。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The law guarantees equal rights for men and women.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律保障男女平等。

Subsense.DEF: to make a formal written promise to repair or replace a product if it breaks within a specific period of time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All our products are fully guaranteed .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所有的产品都有全面的质量保证。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The stereo is guaranteed against failure for a year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台立体声音响保修一年。

Sense.DEF: to promise that you will pay back money that someone else has borrowed, if they do not pay it back themselves
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bank will only lend me money if my parents guarantee the loan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有我父母作担保﹐银行才会给我贷款。

Sense.DEF: to make it certain that something will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: In movies, talent by no means guarantees success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在电影业﹐天才并不一定就能成功。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The built-in thermostat guarantees that the water remains at the same temperature all the time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 内置式的恒温器确保水温始终不变。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This latest incident is guaranteed to make the situation worse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近发生的这起事件必然会使情况更加严重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Even if you complete your training, you aren’t guaranteed a job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使你完成了培训﹐也未必就能找到工作。

Sense.DEF: a formal written promise to repair or replace a product if it breaks within a specific period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: They offer a two-year guarantee on all their electrical goods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们所有的电器产品都有两年的保修期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our computers come with a one-year guarantee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的电脑有一年的保修期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is your TV under guarantee protected by a guarantee ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的电视在保修期内吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: a money-back guarantee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退货保证

Sense.DEF: a formal promise that something will be done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid there’s no guarantee of success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕不能保证一定会成功。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I cannot give a guarantee that there will be no redundancies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能保证不会裁员。

Subsense.DEF: a promise that you will pay back money that someone else has used or borrowed, if they do not pay it themselves
something valuable that you give to someone to keep until you have done something you promised to do
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The bank is holding the airline’s assets as guarantees.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行持有航空公司的资产作为抵押物。

Sense.DEF: someone who promises to pay a debt if the person who should pay it does not

Subsense.DEF: someone whose job is to protect a place or person
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There were two security guards on duty outside the building.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼外面有两名保安在值勤。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We were stopped by border guards .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被边防哨兵拦住了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: were posted by the exit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出口驻守了武装警卫。

Subsense.DEF: someone whose job is to prevent prisoners from escaping
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The prison guards were reasonably friendly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狱警的态度还算友好。

Sense.DEF: the act or duty of protecting places or people, or of preventing prisoners from escaping

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who was on guard the night the fire broke out?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火灾发生那晚是谁在执勤？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gunmen stood guard at the camp entrance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 持枪歹徒把守着营地的入口。

GramExa.GLOSS: to be guarded by a group of people
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 在（警方/武装警卫等）看管之下
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was taken to hospital, where he is now under police guard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被送进了医院﹐现在由警方看守。

Subsense.DEF: a group of soldiers who guard someone or something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The President has called in the National Guard.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统调集了国民警卫队。

Subsense.DEF: a group of soldiers who protect the king or queen
Subsense.TRAN: 〔保护国王或女王的〕御林军﹐近卫军﹐禁军

Sense.DEF: something that is used to protect someone or something from damage or injury
Sense.EXAMPLE: a face guard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面罩
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fire guard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火炉栏﹐防火隔栏

Sense.DEF: a person whose job is to be in charge of a train
to be paying attention to what is happening in order to avoid danger, being tricked etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: These men are dangerous so you’ll need to be on your guard .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人很危险﹐所以你要提防着点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Something in his tone put her on her guard .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话的语气使她提高了警惕。

Sense.DEF: to surprise someone by doing something that they are not ready to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 趁某人不备﹐使某人猝不及防
Sense.EXAMPLE: Senator O’Hare was caught off guard by the question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题让奥黑尔参议员猝不及防。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who walk or stand together at a special occasion in order to show respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police colleagues formed a guard of honour at her funeral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警队的同事在她的葬礼上组成了一个仪仗队。

Sense.DEF: a group of people in an organization who want to do things in the way they were done in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Communist old guard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共产党的保守派

Sense.DEF: the position of holding your arms or hands up in a fight in order to defend yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: He swung at me and I brought my guard up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挥拳向我打来﹐我摆出了防御的姿势。

Subsense.DEF:
one of two players on a
basketball
team who is responsible for moving the ball to help their team gain points
one of two players on an American football team who plays either side of the centre

Sense.DEF: to protect a person, place, or object by staying near them and watching them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Sergeant told Swift to guard the entrance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中士叫斯威夫特守着入口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lioness guarding her cubs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 守护着幼狮的母狮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no one to guard these isolated farms against attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人守卫这些孤立的农场抵御袭击。

Sense.DEF: to watch a prisoner to prevent them from escaping
to protect something such as a right or a secret by preventing other people from taking it away, discovering it etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: chiefs who jealously guarded their independence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心翼翼地捍卫着独立地位的首领
Sense.EXAMPLE: a closely guarded secret
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严守的秘密

Sense.DEF: to prevent another sports player from gaining points, getting the ball etc
to prevent something from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exercise can guard against a number of illnesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动可预防许多疾病。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nurses should guard against becoming too attached to their patients.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士应该避免对病人产生过多的感情纠葛。

Sense.DEF: a dog that is trained to guard a place
not giving very much information or showing your feelings about something
Sense.TRAN: 谨慎的﹐有保留的﹐提防的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister was quite guarded in his comments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长说话很小心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave the proposal a guarded welcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他欢迎这个提议﹐但有所保留。

Sense.DEF: a building for soldiers who are guarding the entrance to a military camp
someone who is legally responsible for looking after someone else’s child, especially after the child’s parents have died

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His aunt is his legal guardian .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他姑妈是他的法定监护人。

Sense.DEF: someone who guards or protects something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The US sees itself as the guardian of democracy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国以民主制度的捍卫者自居。

Sense.DEF:
a good
spirit
who is believed to protect a person or place
someone who helps or protects someone else when they are in trouble
the position of being legally responsible for someone else’s child
a bar that is intended to prevent people from falling from a bridge, cliff etc
a bar that is intended to prevent cars from going off the road in an accident
Sense.TRAN: 〔防止汽车在交通事故中冲出公路的〕防撞护栏

Sense.DEF: a room for soldiers who are guarding a military camp

a soldier who is a member of a
guard
the part of a train where the person in charge of it travels
a tropical fruit with pink flesh and a lot of seeds
a group of things that you do not need, do not know much about, or do not know the exact name of
Sense.TRAN: 〔无用的﹑不很了解的或不知确切名称的〕东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want a nice simple camera without all that gubbins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想要一个简简单单的照相机﹐不要那么多花样。

Sense.DEF:
relating to the position of being a
governor
Sense.EXAMPLE: gubernatorial elections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长选举

Sense.DEF: a member of a small unofficial military group that fights in small groups

GramExa.EXAMPLE: American troops found themselves fighting a guerrilla war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美军发现自己是在打游击战。

Sense.EXAMPLE: left-wing guerrillas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 左翼游击队员

Sense.DEF: the activity of growing plants or vegetables on any piece of land in a city that you do not own, especially land that is in bad condition because it has not been used for a long time. People do this so that cities will have more green areas and be better places to live.
Sense.TRAN: 游击园艺〔指在城市里非自有土地上种植植物或蔬菜﹐以改善居住环境的活动〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Guerrilla gardeners came late in the night and turned the area outside the building into a vegetable patch.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 游击园丁深夜到来﹐把大楼外面的地方变成了一块菜地。

Sense.DEF:
marketing the activity of deciding how to advertise a product, what price to charge for it etc
that uses new, clever, and unusual methods to sell a product, rather than spending a lot of money to sell it
Sense.TRAN: 游击营销〔指省钱的新颖营销策略〕

Sense.DEF: to try to answer a question or form an opinion when you are not sure whether you will be correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d say he’s around 50, but I’m only guessing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想他50岁左右﹐不过也只是猜测。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you guess correctly, you have another turn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果猜对了﹐还会有一次机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can guess what happened next.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以猜猜接下来发生了什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can only guess at the cause of the crash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只能猜测这次撞车事故的原因。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What star sign are you? No, let me guess .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是什么星座的？别说﹐让我来猜猜看。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to guess his age because he dyes his hair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的年龄不好猜﹐因为他染了头发。

Sense.DEF: to realize that something is true even though you do not know for certain

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I guessed that you must be related because you look so similar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我猜你们肯定是亲戚﹐你们长得这么像。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I guessed from his expression that he already knew about the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从他的表情猜得出来﹐他已经知道出事了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you guess the identity of this week’s special guest?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们猜得出本周的特邀嘉宾是谁吗？

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel excited or not sure about what will happen next
Sense.TRAN: 〔不告诉某人下一步将发生什么〕让某人捉摸不定
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thriller that keeps audiences guessing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悬念迭起的惊险影片

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you think something is true or likely, although you are not sure
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His light’s on, so I guess he’s still up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的灯亮着﹐所以我猜他还没睡。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you will do something even though you do not really want to
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m tired, so I guess I’ll stay home tonight.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我累了﹐所以我想今晚待在家里。

Sense.DEF: used to agree or disagree with a statement or question
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re one lucky guy.’ ‘I guess so.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你是个幸运的家伙。”“我想是的。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t really have any choice, do I?’ ‘I guess not.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我其实没有任何选择﹐是不是？”“我想是的。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: guess what/you’ll never guess who/what etc
Sense.DEF: used before you tell someone something that will surprise them
Sense.TRAN: 猜猜看/你永远也猜不出是谁/是什么等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guess what! Bradley’s resigned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你猜怎么着﹐布拉德利辞职了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll never guess who I saw today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你永远也猜不出我今天见到谁了。

Sense.DEF: an attempt to answer a question or make a judgement when you are not sure whether you will be correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d say she’s about 35, but that’s only a guess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说她大约35岁﹐不过那只是猜测。

Sense.DEF: to be something that no one knows
Sense.TRAN: 谁也不知道﹐谁也拿不准
Sense.EXAMPLE: What she’s going to do with her life now is anybody’s guess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在她打算怎么生活谁也不知道。

Sense.LEXUNIT: your guess is as good as mine
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you do not know any more than they do about something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most farmers can make a good guess at what the weather will be like.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数农民都能对天气情况猜个八九不离十。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Go on, have a guess at how much it cost.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐猜猜它是多少钱买的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: guess something, when you feel very uncertain
Collocate.EXAMPLE: No one at this stage is prepared to hazard a guess about the outcome of the elections.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一阶段没人敢贸然猜测选举的结果。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is not exact
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This is just a rough guess, but I think it would cost about $50.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 只是大致猜一下﹐我想它在50元左右。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one made without much thought
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I made a wild guess and got the answer right first time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我瞎猜了一下﹐一次就猜对了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘How did you know?’ ‘It was just a lucky guess.’
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “你是怎么知道的？”“只是运气好猜中的。”

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is likely to be right
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure how old she is, but I can make a good guess!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道她的年龄﹐但可以猜个差不离！

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you think is most likely to be right
a guess based on things that you know are correct

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My guess is there won’t be many people there.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我猜那里不会有许多人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when saying that you are making a guess
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was built around the turn of the century, at a guess.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 据猜测﹐它大约建于世纪之初。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to say that someone will easily be able to guess something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 我让你猜三次〔用于表示很容易猜中〕

Sense.DEF: an attempt to judge a quantity by guessing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you give us a guesstimate of the numbers involved?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能给我们大致估计一下相关数字吗？

Sense.DEF: the method of trying to find the answer to something by guessing
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a lot of guesswork in these calculations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些计算中有多处都是推测。

Sense.DEF: someone who is invited to an event or special occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: a banquet for 250 distinguished guests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 250位贵宾出席的宴会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You are here as my guests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们是我请来的客人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the wedding guests had left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出席婚礼的宾客大部分都已离去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Among the invited guests were Jerry Brown and Elihu Harris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受邀的嘉宾中有杰里·布朗和伊莱休·哈里斯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The actress was guest of honour the most important guest at the launch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位女演员是首发式上的贵宾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve nearly finished the guest list for the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加婚礼的嘉宾名单我差不多准备好了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually talk about having friends/people over (for a meal, short visit etc) or having friends/people to stay rather than saying that they have guests .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说have friends/people over或have friends/people to stay﹐而不说have guests
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We’ re having some people over for dinner this evening.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我们有几个客人要来吃饭。

Sense.DEF: someone you have invited to stay in your home for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have guests staying right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们家这会儿有客人。

Sense.DEF: someone who is paying to stay in a hotel
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use of the sauna is free to guests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑拿浴室供住店客人免费使用。

Sense.DEF: someone famous who is invited to take part in a show, concert etc, in addition to those who usually take part
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have some great guests for you tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我们为大家邀请了几位特别的嘉宾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fontaine appeared as a guest on the show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芳登以嘉宾身份出现在节目中。

Sense.DEF: used to give someone permission to do what they have asked to do
Sense.TRAN: 请吧〔用于同意别人的请求〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you mind if I look at your notes?’ ‘Be my guest.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我看一下你的笔记﹐行吗？”“随便看吧。”

Sense.DEF: for guests to use
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was still asleep in the guest bedroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还在客房里睡着。

Sense.DEF: a guest star, speaker etc is someone famous or important who is invited to take part in an event, in addition to the people who usually take part
Sense.TRAN: 〔明星﹑演讲者等〕特邀的﹐客串的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Camfield was lucky in getting Cage and Rampling as guest stars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡姆菲尔德有幸请到了凯奇和兰普林两位明星嘉宾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He will make a special guest appearance on next week’s show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将作为特邀嘉宾在下星期的节目中亮相。

Sense.DEF: to take part in a show, concert etc as a guest
Sense.TRAN: 做特邀嘉宾﹔客串﹔担任特约演员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She guested on a comedy show last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去年客串过一个喜剧节目。

Sense.DEF: a book in which everyone who comes to a formal occasion or stays at a hotel signs their name
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式场合或宾馆的〕客人登记簿

Sense.DEF: a private house where people can pay to stay and have meals
a bedroom for a visitor or visitors to use
a worker from one country who works in another country for a short time
remarks that are stupid and untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t believe any of that guff!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种蠢话我不信！

Sense.DEF: to laugh loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We guffawed at what Graham had written.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对格雷厄姆写的东西狂笑不已。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The announcement was greeted with loud guffaws.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事一宣布﹐大家一阵哄笑。

Sense.DEF: a way of showing and organizing information on a computer screen that is easy to use and understand
help and advice that is given to someone about their work, education, or personal life

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I went to a counselor for guidance on my career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去找了一位顾问给我作职业指导。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was looking forward to working under her expert guidance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我期待着能在她的专业指导下工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children need moral guidance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童需要道德上的引导。

Sense.DEF:
the process of directing a
missile
while it is flying through the air
Sense.TRAN: 〔导弹在飞行过程中的〕制导﹐导航
Sense.EXAMPLE: a missile with a sophisticated electronic guidance system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有精密电子制导系统的导弹

Sense.DEF: something that provides information and helps you to form an opinion or make a decision
Sense.TRAN: 指导的事物﹔判断的根据
Sense.EXAMPLE: The polls are not a reliable guide of how people will vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据这些民意测验来判断人们将如何投票并不可靠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The figures are only a rough guide .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据只是一个大致的参考。

Subsense.DEF: someone whose job is to take tourists to a place and show them around
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a tour guide
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导游
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an experienced mountain guide
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位有经验的登山向导

Subsense.DEF: someone who advises you and influences the way you live
Subsense.TRAN: 〔生活上的〕指导者﹐指引者﹐导师
Subsense.EXAMPLE: my spiritual guide
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的精神导师

Subsense.DEF: a book or piece of writing that provides information on a particular subject or explains how to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a guide to North American birds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 北美鸟类指南

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Follow our step-by-step guide .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跟着我们的分步指南去做。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Details of how to use the various programs are in the user guide .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何使用各种程序﹐在用户指南里都有详细的说明。

Subsense.DEF: a guidebook
the Guides Association, which teaches girls practical skills
a member of the Guides Association

Sense.DEF: to take someone to a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He guided us through the narrow streets to the central mosque.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他引领我们穿过几条狭窄的街道﹐来到中央清真寺。

Sense.DEF: to help someone or something to move in a particular direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He guided her firmly towards the sofa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他领着她稳步走向沙发。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Searchlights were used to guide the ship into the harbour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用探照灯引领轮船进港。

Sense.DEF: to influence someone’s behaviour or ideas
Sense.TRAN: 引导﹐指导〔某人的行为或观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teenagers need adults to guide them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十几岁的青少年需要大人来引导。

Sense.DEF: to show someone the right way to do something, especially something difficult or complicated
Sense.TRAN: 指引﹐指导〔尤指做困难或复杂的事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Guide your students through the program one section at a time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 指导学生分节学习这一课程。

Sense.DEF: a book about a city, country etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: travel guidebooks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游手册

Sense.DEF:
a
missile
that is controlled electronically while it is flying
a dog trained to guide a blind person
if someone takes you on a guided tour, they show you around a place of interest and tell you all about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You will be taken on a guided tour of the palace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 导游将带你参观皇宫。

Sense.DEF: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new set of guidelines for teachers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给老师的一套新的教学准则

GramExa.EXAMPLE: guidelines on the employment of children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇用童工的相关准则

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hospital has issued new guidelines on the treatment of mentally ill patients.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院就精神病患者的治疗发布了新的指导原则。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This chapter gives you some guidelines to help you in your work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本章将介绍一些指导性原则﹐为你的工作提供帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Today most planning authorities enforce fairly strict guidelines on new houses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在﹐大多数建筑规划当局都对建设新住房实行比较严格的标准。

Sense.DEF: something that helps you form an opinion or make a decision
Sense.TRAN: 〔帮助某人形成观点或作出决定的〕指导原则﹐参考
Sense.EXAMPLE: When starting a new business, try to follow these general guidelines .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开办新公司时﹐应尽量遵循这些一般性指导原则。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teachers can choose books within certain broad guidelines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师可以在某些大的指导原则下自己选择教材。

Sense.DEF: something that helps you decide what to do in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fairness, rather than efficiency, is the guiding principle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 指导原则是公平﹐而不是效率。

Sense.DEF: someone whose ideas and advice people follow
Sense.TRAN: 指路明灯/指导者/引路明星
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eddie was his hero – his guiding light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃迪是他的英雄﹐他的指路明灯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He really needed a guiding hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很需要有人指引。

Sense.DEF: an organization of people who do the same job or have the same interests
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Women’s Guild
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女协会

Sense.DEF:
the standard unit of money used in the Netherlands before the
euro
Sense.TRAN: 荷兰盾〔荷兰使用欧元之前的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: a large building in which members of a guild met in the past
the use of clever but dishonest methods to deceive someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a little guile she might get what she wanted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她略施小计﹐也许就能得到自己想要的东西。

Sense.DEF: behaving in an honest way, without trying to hide anything or deceive people
a black and white sea bird with a narrow beak
a piece of equipment used to cut off the heads of criminals, especially in France in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指法国旧时使用的〕断头台

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used to cut large sheets of paper
the setting of a time limit on a discussion in the British Parliament
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opposition leaders accused the government of introducing a guillotine motion to stifle debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对党领袖指责政府推行规定辩论时限的动议来压制辩论。

Sense.DEF: to cut off someone’s head using a guillotine
to limit the period of time allowed for the discussion of a possible new law in the British Parliament
a strong feeling of shame and sadness because you know that you have done something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used to buy them expensive presents, out of guilt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于内疚﹐他以前总是给他们买昂贵的礼物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t you have any feelings of guilt about leaving David?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你离开戴维难道就没有一点内疚吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt an enormous sense of guilt when he thought about how he’d treated her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想到自己那样对待她﹐心里非常歉疚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was racked with guilt at my part in making her this unhappy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她这么不开心也有我的原因﹐我为此深感内疚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I felt little pangs of guilt .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我也会有一点点的内疚。

Sense.DEF: the fact that you have broken an official law or moral rule
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did not deny his guilt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有否认自己有罪。

Sense.DEF: responsibility and blame for something bad that has happened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Guilt for poorly behaved children usually lies with the parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子行为不良﹐责任通常在父母。

Sense.DEF: to have a feeling of guilt about something when it is unreasonable

Sense.LEXUNIT: lay a guilt trip on sb
Sense.DEF: to make someone feel bad about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish my parents would stop laying a guilt trip on me for not going to college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望父母不要因为我没上大学而老是让我觉得难受。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel guilty, so they will do what you want
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕产生内疚而去做〔某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her parents guilted her into not going to the concert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母让她觉得内疚而不去听音乐会。

Sense.DEF: not responsible for a crime or for having done something wrong
feeling so guilty about something that you cannot think about anything else
Sense.TRAN: 深感歉疚的﹐深受良心谴责的

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel guilty
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother tried to guilt-trip me by crying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲试图用眼泪让我感到内疚。

Sense.DEF: feeling very ashamed and sad because you know that you have done something wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I feel really guilty at forgetting her birthday again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我又忘记了她的生日﹐心里非常内疚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked self-conscious and guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去很不自然﹐很内疚的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was his guilty conscience that made him offer to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是因为良心上过意不去才提出帮忙的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that they feel bad about something rather than say that they feel guilty about it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常说feel bad about something﹐而不说feel guilty about something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I feel bad about leaving him on his own.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 让他独自一人留下我感到内疚。

Sense.DEF: having done something that is a crime

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The jury found her guilty of murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团裁定她谋杀罪名成立。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was found not guilty of the death of PC Jones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于警员琼斯的死﹐他被判无罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pleaded guilty to two charges of theft.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认两项盗窃罪名。

Sense.DEF: responsible for behaviour that is morally or socially unacceptable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some journalists are guilty of reporting scandal in order to sell papers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些记者为增加报纸销量而去报道丑闻﹐这种做法不对。

Sense.DEF: the person who has done something illegal or wrong

ThesBox.HEADING: THESAURUS 词语辨析 – MEANING 义项 2

Exponent.DEF: if someone is guilty of a crime or doing something wrong, they did it, and they should be punished for it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was found guilty of murder.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被裁定犯有谋杀罪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was guilty of serious misconduct.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他犯有严重失职罪。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying who should be blamed for something bad that has happened
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对坏事〕负有责任的﹐应承担责任的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police believe a local gang is responsible for the burglaries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为这几起入室盗窃案是当地一个团伙所为。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: As manager, he is ultimately responsible for the failure of the project.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 身为经理﹐他应当对项目的失败承担最终责任。

Exponent.DEF: if someone is to blame for a bad situation, they are responsible
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government is partly to blame for the crisis.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对这场危机负有部分责任。

Exponent.DEF: responsible for something bad or illegal, so that you deserve to be blamed or punished
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The people who helped the terrorists are equally culpable for what happened on July 7th.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于7月7日发生的事件﹐为恐怖分子提供帮助的人同样罪责难逃。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He pleaded guilty to culpable homicide (=being guilty of causing someone’s death).
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认自己犯了杀人罪。

Exponent.DEF: responsible for something bad that has happened, because you did not take enough care, or you did not try to stop it from happening
Exponent.TRAN: 玩忽职守的﹐疏忽大意的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The court decided that the railway company was negligent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭判定铁路公司疏忽失职。

Exponent.DEF: to be responsible for an accident, mistake etc – used when deciding which person, group etc should be blamed
Exponent.TRAN: 有责任的﹐犯错的〔用于判定过错责任时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The other driver was clearly in the wrong.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一名驾驶者显然负有责任。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She always thinks it’s me who is in the wrong.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是认为过错在我。

Exponent.DEF: used about things which seem to show that someone is guilty of a crime
Exponent.EXAMPLE: incriminating evidence
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 罪证
Exponent.EXAMPLE: incriminating documents
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 证明有罪的文件
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He didn’t want to say anything incriminating.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想说任何可能会表明自己有罪的话。

Sense.DEF:
a British gold coin or unit of money used in the past, worth one pound and one
shilling
(£1.05). Prices are sometimes still given in guineas when buying or selling
racehorses .
Sense.TRAN: 几尼〔英国旧时的一种金币或货币单位﹐合1.05英镑。现在赛马交易中有时仍用几尼计算〕

Sense.DEF: a grey bird that is often eaten as food
Sense.TRAN: 珍珠鸡〔常供食用的一种灰色禽类〕

Sense.DEF: a small furry animal with short ears and no tail, which is often kept as a pet
someone who is used in a scientific test to see how successful or safe a new product, system etc is
the way someone or something appears to be, which hides the truth or is only temporary

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They operated a drug-smuggling business under the guise of an employment agency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们挂着职业介绍所的牌子从事毒品走私活动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the same idea in a different guise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还是一样的观点﹐只是形式不同。

Sense.DEF:
a musical instrument usually with six strings that you play by pulling the strings with your fingers or with a
plectrum small piece of plastic, metal etc

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 原声吉他/电吉他/古典吉他

Sense.DEF: someone who plays the guitar
one of a group of prison camps in the former USSR, where conditions were very bad
a narrow deep valley formed in the past by flowing water, but usually dry now
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去由流水冲刷形成﹐但现在通常已干涸的〕峡谷﹐沟壑

Sense.DEF: a large area of sea partly enclosed by land
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Gulf of Mexico
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨西哥湾

Sense.DEF: a great difference and lack of understanding between two groups of people, especially in their beliefs, opinions, and way of life

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the huge gulf between management and unions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 资方和工会之间的巨大分歧
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a growing gulf between old and young
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人和年轻人之间越来越大的隔阂

Sense.DEF: a current of warm water that flows across the Atlantic Ocean from the Gulf of Mexico towards Europe
Sense.TRAN: 墨西哥湾流〔从墨西哥湾经大西洋流向欧洲的暖流〕

Sense.DEF: a large common black and white sea bird that lives near the sea
the tube at the back of your mouth through which food goes down your throat

another spelling of
gully
too ready to believe what other people tell you, so that you are easily tricked
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plastic replicas of the Greek pottery are sold to gullible tourists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仿古希腊陶器的塑料复制品被卖给易受骗的游客。

Sense.DEF: a small narrow valley, usually formed by a lot of rain flowing down the side of a hill
Sense.TRAN: 〔山坡上被雨水冲成的〕隘谷﹐沟壑

Sense.DEF:
a deep
ditch
to swallow large quantities of food or drink quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gulped down her breakfast and ran for the bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她狼吞虎咽地吃完早饭﹐跑去赶公交车了。

Sense.DEF: to swallow suddenly because you are surprised or nervous
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gulped when I saw the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到账单时我倒吸了一口气。

Sense.DEF: to breathe in large amounts of air quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We rushed outside and gulped in the sweet fresh air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们跑到外面﹐大口呼吸纯净的新鲜空气。

Sense.DEF: to breathe in large amounts of air quickly because you do not have enough air in your body
to stop yourself from expressing your feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sandra tried to gulp back her tears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德拉竭力忍住泪水。

Sense.DEF: a large amount of something that you swallow quickly, or the action of swallowing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took a huge gulp of brandy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝了一大口白兰地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Charlie drank the whisky in one gulp.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 查理一口就把威士忌喝了。

Sense.DEF: a large amount of air that you breathe in quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: gulps of fresh air
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大口大口的新鲜空气

Sense.DEF: your gums are the two areas of firm pink flesh at the top and bottom of your mouth, in which your teeth are fixed
a type of glue used to stick light things such as paper together
a sticky substance found in the stems of some trees

a
gum tree
used to express surprise
to stick things together using glue

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A large label had been gummed to the back of the photograph.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 照片的背后贴了一张大标签。

Sense.DEF: to prevent a machine from moving and working properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dirt had got inside the watch and gummed up the works.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手表里进了污垢﹐把机件卡住了。

Sense.DEF:
chewing gum
in the form of a small round brightly coloured sweet

a thick soup made with meat, fish, and
okra a small green vegetable
Sense.TRAN: 秋葵汤〔用肉﹑鱼和秋葵制作的浓汤〕

Sense.DEF:
a word used in some parts of the US for
okra
Sense.TRAN: 秋葵〔美国部分地区用语〕

Sense.DEF: a tall boot made of rubber that you wear to keep your feet dry
a small sweet that you chew
sticky or covered in glue

a gummy smile shows the
gums
in someone’s mouth when they have no teeth
the ability and determination to decide what needs to be done and to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least she had the gumption to phone me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少她有这个头脑﹐给我打了电话。

Sense.DEF:
a
detective
when you try to find out information about something
a tall tree which produces a strong-smelling oil that is used in medicine
to be in a very difficult situation

a metal weapon which shoots bullets or
shells

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could see he was carrying a gun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到他带着一把枪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never fired a gun in my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这辈子从来没开过枪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jake was pointing a gun at the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克用枪对着门口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two policemen were killed in a gun battle .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名警察在一次枪战中丧生。

DEF.b: put/hold a gun to sb’s head

Subsense.DEF: to put a gun very close to someone’s head to shoot them or to force them to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He put a gun to her head and told the cashier to hand over the money.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用枪指着她的头﹐叫出纳员把钱交出来。

Subsense.DEF: to force someone to do something they do not want to do
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You chose to live here. Nobody put a gun to your head.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是你自己要住在这里﹐又没有人强迫你。

Sense.DEF: a tool that forces out small objects or a liquid by pressure
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paint gun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喷漆枪
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nail gun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 射钉枪

Sense.DEF: a gun which is fired into the air at the start of a race
someone who is very important within an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jed wanted to impress a Harvard professor and some other big guns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰德想给一位哈佛教授以及其他几位大人物留个好印象。

Sense.DEF: someone who is paid to shoot someone else
if you do something with all guns blazing, you do it with a lot of energy, determination, and noise
to be trying to find an opportunity to criticize or harm someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why is he gunning for me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为什么总是跟我过不去？

Sense.DEF: to be trying very hard to obtain something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s gunning for your job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他竭力谋取你的职位。

Sense.DEF:
to make the engine of a car go very fast by pressing the
accelerator
very hard
to shoot someone and badly injure or kill them, especially someone who cannot defend themselves
Sense.TRAN: 开枪击伤[击毙]〔尤指不能自卫的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A policeman was gunned down as he left his house this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晨一名警察离家时遭到枪击。

Sense.DEF: a small ship that carries several large guns
the practice of threatening to use force against another country to make them agree to your demands
Sense.TRAN: 炮舰外交〔指用武力威胁使另一国家屈从的做法〕

Sense.DEF: a frame with wheels on which a large heavy gun is moved around
laws that limit the ways in which guns can be sold, owned, and used
a dog that is trained to find and bring back dead birds that have been shot for sport
a fight between people using guns
the repeated shooting of guns, or the noise made by this
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard a burst of distant gunfire .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到远处一阵炮响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two men were shot in an exchange of gunfire with the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子在与警方的交火中被击中。

Sense.DEF: any substance that is dirty, sticky, or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 肮脏讨厌的东西﹐黏糊糊的东西

Sense.DEF: to be blocked with a dirty sticky substance
Sense.TRAN: 被〔肮脏黏糊的东西〕堵塞
Sense.EXAMPLE: The waste pipe is all gunged up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排污管全堵住了。

Sense.DEF: very eager to do something dangerous or violent
Sense.TRAN: 非常急切的﹐莽撞的﹐冒险的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sporting opportunities here should suit the most gung-ho of tourists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的体育活动应该能满足那些极喜欢冒险的游客的口味。

Sense.DEF: any substance that is dirty, sticky, or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 肮脏讨厌的东西﹐黏糊糊的东西

Sense.DEF: to be blocked with a dirty sticky substance
Sense.TRAN: 被〔肮脏黏糊的东西〕堵塞
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s your problem. The fuel line’s all gunked up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的问题出在这里﹐燃油管全给污垢堵塞了。

Sense.DEF: a criminal who uses a gun

a dull grey-coloured metal which is a mixture of
copper
,
tin
, and
zinc
Sense.TRAN: 炮铜﹐炮合金〔铜﹑锡﹑锌的合金〕

Sense.DEF: a dull blue-grey colour

a
gunwale
a soldier, sailor etc whose job is to aim or shoot a large gun

a soldier in the British
artillery part of the army which uses heavy guns
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gunner Smith
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炮兵史密斯

Sense.DEF: the skill of shooting with large heavy guns
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gunnery officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火炮射击军官

Sense.DEF: a large bag made from rough material and used for storing grain, coal, potatoes etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔装谷物﹑煤﹑马铃薯等用的〕黄麻袋

Sense.DEF: while threatening someone or being threatened with a gun
Sense.TRAN: 用枪威胁﹔在枪口威胁下
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was held at gunpoint for 37 hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在枪口下过了37个小时。

Sense.DEF:
an explosive substance used in bombs and
fireworks
the activity of taking guns into a country secretly and illegally, especially so that they can be used by people who want to fight against their government
Sense.TRAN: 私运军火〔尤指供反政府分子使用〕

Sense.DEF:
a military
helicopter
used to protect other helicopters and to destroy enemy guns
the action of shooting a gun, or the sound that this makes
Sense.EXAMPLE: She says she heard a gunshot at about midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说她大约在午夜时分听到了一声枪响。

Sense.DEF: the bullets fired from a gun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪伤

Sense.DEF: someone who is very skilful at using guns, especially a criminal
someone who makes and repairs guns
carrying a gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: gun-toting gangs on the street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上带枪的流氓团伙

Sense.DEF: the upper edge of the side of a boat or small ship
a small brightly-coloured tropical fish
Sense.TRAN: 虹﹐孔雀鱼〔一种色彩亮丽的小型热带鱼〕

Sense.DEF: if water gurgles, it flows along gently with a pleasant low sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could hear the stream gurgling down in the valley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到山谷里涧水汩汩流淌。

Sense.DEF: if a baby gurgles, it makes a happy low sound in its throat
the happy low sound that someone makes in their throat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gurgle of laughter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵咯咯的笑声

Sense.DEF: the pleasant low sound of water moving along gently
a long narrow table with wheels used for moving sick people in a hospital
someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, and gives advice to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a management guru
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理大师
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fashion guru
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时尚权威

Sense.DEF: a Hindu religious teacher or leader
Sense.TRAN: 古鲁〔印度教的宗教导师或领袖〕

Subsense.DEF: if a liquid gushes, it flows or pours out quickly and in large quantities

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Water gushed from the broken pipe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水从破裂的管子中喷涌而出。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He opened the door and smoke gushed out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开门﹐烟喷涌而出。

Subsense.DEF: if something gushes a liquid, the liquid pours out quickly and in large quantities
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The wound gushed blood.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤口大量出血。

Sense.DEF: to express your praise, pleasure etc in a way that other people think is too strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I simply loved your book,’ she gushed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我真是喜欢你的书。”她吹捧道。

Sense.DEF: if words or emotions gush out, you suddenly express them very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: All that pent-up frustration gushed out in a torrent of abuse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有压抑着的失望与不快通过一阵痛骂全都发泄了出来。

Sense.DEF: a large quantity of something, usually a liquid, that suddenly pours out of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gush of ice-cold water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一股冰冷的水

Sense.DEF: a sudden feeling or expression of emotion
a place in the ground where oil or water comes out very forcefully, so that a pump is not needed
expressing praise, pleasure etc in a way that other people think is too strong
Sense.TRAN: 夸大其词的﹔过分吹捧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gushing praise of the New York critics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约评论家的夸张吹捧

Sense.DEF: a piece of material that is stitched into a piece of clothing to make it stronger, wider, or more comfortable in a particular place
to make someone look attractive by dressing them in their best clothes, or to make something look attractive by decorating it
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人〕打扮得漂漂亮亮﹔把〔某物〕装饰得很漂亮
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the girls will be gussied up for the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的女孩都会打扮得漂漂亮亮的去参加派对。

Sense.DEF: a sudden strong movement of wind, air, rain etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A sudden gust of wind blew the door shut.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵狂风把门吹得关上了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gusts of up to 200 kph may be experienced.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能遭遇时速高达200公里的强风。

Sense.DEF: a sound of loud laughter
if the wind gusts, it blows strongly with sudden short movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: winds gusting at up to 45 miles per hour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时速高达45英里的狂风

Sense.DEF: if you do something with gusto, you do it with a lot of eagerness and energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sang hymns with great gusto.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们满怀热情地唱赞美诗。

Sense.DEF: with wind blowing in strong sudden movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cold, gusty October night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 10月里一个狂风呼啸的寒夜

Sense.DEF: a reaction or feeling that you are sure is right, although you cannot give a reason for it
Sense.TRAN: 本能的反应/本能的感觉/直觉
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a gut feeling that Sarah was lying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他凭直觉感到萨拉在撒谎。

Sense.DEF: the courage and determination you need to do something difficult or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔做困难或不愉快的事情所需要的〕勇气﹐魄力﹐决心
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes guts to start a new business on your own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自己开公司是需要勇气的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one had the guts to tell Paul what a mistake he was making.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人敢告诉保罗他这是在犯什么样的错误。

Subsense.DEF: all the organs in someone’s body, especially when they have come out of their body
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There were blood and guts all over the place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满地都是血和内脏器官。

Subsense.DEF: the tube through which food passes from your stomach
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It can take 72 hours for food to pass through the gut.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物通过肠道有时需要72个小时。

Sense.DEF: someone’s stomach, especially when it is large
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt as if someone had just kicked him in the gut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感觉好像有人踢了他肚子一脚。
