Sense.EXAMPLE: Phil has a huge beer gut unattractive fat stomach caused by drinking too much beer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔有个很大的啤酒肚。

Sense.DEF:
a type of strong string made from the
intestine
of an animal, and used for musical instruments such as
violins
Sense.TRAN: 肠线〔用动物肠子制成的十分结实的线﹐用于制作小提琴等乐器的弦〕

Sense.DEF: the parts inside a machine or piece of equipment
the most important or basic parts of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the guts of the problem
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题的核心

Sense.DEF: to work very hard
if you know something at gut level, you feel sure about it, though you could not give a reason for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew at gut level that he was guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直觉告诉她﹐他有罪。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’ll have sb’s guts for garters
Sense.DEF: used to say that you would like to punish someone severely for something they have done
Sense.TRAN: 我要抽某人的筋﹐我要扒某人的皮〔表示要严惩某人〕

Sense.DEF: to completely destroy the inside of a building, especially by fire
Sense.TRAN: 毁坏〔建筑物〕的内部〔尤指烧毁〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building was completely gutted by fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼被火烧空了。

Sense.DEF: to remove the organs from inside a fish or animal in order to prepare it for cooking
to change something by removing some of the most important or central parts
lacking courage or determination
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should have had the support of my team, but they were really gutless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我本应该得到我的团队的支持﹐但他们实在太没胆量了。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s behaviour is gutsy, it is brave and determined
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a gutsy performance by McTaggart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是麦克塔格特的一次无畏之举。

Sense.DEF: if something is gutsy, it is strong and interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gutsy full-bodied wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烈性﹑浓郁的葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: seriously damaged or completely destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 严重受损的﹔完全毁坏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We drove slowly past the gutted buildings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们缓缓地开车经过一幢幢破败的楼房。

Sense.DEF: very shocked or disappointed
Sense.TRAN: 十分吃惊的﹔非常失望的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was gutted when I lost my job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业对我的打击很大。

Sense.DEF: the low part at the edge of a road where water collects and flows away
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gutters were blocked and overflowing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排水沟堵住了﹐水都溢出来了。

Sense.DEF: an open pipe fixed to the edge of a roof to collect and carry away rainwater
the bad social conditions of the lowest and poorest level of society
Sense.TRAN: 社会最底层的恶劣环境
Sense.EXAMPLE: Men like him usually ended up in jail – or the gutter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像他这样的男人﹐下场通常是坐牢——要不就是穷困潦倒。

Sense.DEF: the newspapers that print shocking stories about people’s personal lives – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔刊登耸人听闻的个人私生活新闻的〕低级趣味的报纸〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
if a
candle
gutters, it burns with an unsteady flame
the open pipes that are fixed to the edge of the roof of a house to collect and carry away rainwater
a dirty untidy badly behaved child from a poor home
Sense.TRAN: 又脏又野的穷人家孩子

Sense.DEF: a guttural voice or sound is or seems to be produced deep in someone’s throat
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音〕喉中发出的﹐像喉中发出的

Sense.DEF: making you feel very upset or anxious
Sense.TRAN: 令人断肠的﹐极度痛苦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gut-wrenching description of life in the war zone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对战区生活令人揪心的描述

Sense.DEF: used by men, as a way of talking to a male customer in a shop, taxi etc
Sense.TRAN: 先生〔男性用语﹐用于称呼商店的男性顾客﹑出租车的男性乘客等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where to, guv?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上哪儿﹐先生？

Sense.DEF: a man who is in a position of authority over you, usually your employer
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to speak to the guvnor about that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事你得跟老板说。

Sense.DEF: used as a way of talking to a man of a higher social class than you
Sense.TRAN: 先生〔用来称呼地位比自己高的男人〕

Sense.DEF: a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave’s a nice guy when you get to know him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫是个好人﹐你了解他后就知道了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jake’s a real tough guy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克是个很厉害的家伙。

Sense.DEF: a model of a man burnt every year on Guy Fawkes Night, in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国每年在盖伊·福克斯之夜焚烧的〕盖伊·福克斯模拟像

Sense.DEF: a rope that stretches from the top or side of a tent or pole to the ground to keep it in the right position
Sense.TRAN: 〔帐篷或杆柱的〕固定拉绳﹐牵索

Sense.DEF: used when talking to or about a group of people, male or female
Sense.TRAN: 大家﹐各位〔用于对同一群人讲话或指一群人时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey you guys! Where are you going?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗨﹐你们这些人！要上哪儿去？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will stop trying to behave honestly and fairly

November 5th, when people in Britain light
fireworks
and burn a
guy
on a fire
Sense.TRAN: 盖伊·福克斯之夜〔即11月5日﹐英国人会燃放焰火并焚烧盖伊·福克斯模拟人像〕

Sense.DEF: to eat or drink a lot of something, eagerly and quickly – usually showing disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve been guzzling beer all evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们整个晚上都在狂饮啤酒。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle guzzles petrol, it uses a lot of it in a wasteful way
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车〕费油﹐耗油﹔大量消耗〔汽油〕

Sense.DEF: a special building or room that has equipment for doing physical exercise

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I try and work out at the local gym once a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽量每星期到当地的体育馆去运动一次。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I go to the gym as often as I can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一有空就去健身房健身。

Sense.DEF: exercises that people do indoors for physical development and as a sport, especially at school
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got gym this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今天下午有体育课。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where’s my gym kit ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的健身用品呢？

Sense.DEF: someone who spends a lot of time exercising at the gym in order to look attractive
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了体形而花费大量时间健身的〕健身狂

Sense.DEF: a sporting event at which people on horses compete in races and jumping competitions

a
gym
someone who is good at gymnastics and competes against other people in gymnastics competitions
a sport involving physical exercises and movements that need skill, strength, and control, and that are often performed in competitions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gymnastics display
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体操表演
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t do gymnastics at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们学校没有体操训练。

Sense.DEF: very clever thinking
using words in a very clever way

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The girls went through their gymnastic routine.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩子们完成了她们整套的体操动作。

Sense.DEF: a light shoe with a cloth top and a flat rubber bottom that children wear for games and sport at school
Sense.TRAN: 〔在学校里穿的〕体操鞋﹐运动鞋﹐球鞋

Sense.DEF: a type of dress without sleeves that girls wore in the past over a shirt as a part of their school uniform
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去女生穿在衬衫外作为校服的〕无袖外衣﹐吉姆衫

Sense.DEF: the study and treatment of medical conditions and illnesses that affect only women, and usually relating to a woman’s ability to have babies

Subsense.DEF: to be painful
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My bad leg is really giving me gyp today.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受伤的腿今天实在疼得不行。

Subsense.DEF: to punish someone or be angry with them because of something they have done
something that you were tricked into buying
a situation in which you feel you have been cheated
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What a gyp!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好一场骗局！

Sense.DEF: to cheat someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ten bucks? You’ve been gypped!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十美元？你被骗了！

Sense.DEF:
a soft white substance that is used to make
plaster of paris

a member of a group of people originally from India, who traditionally live and travel around in
caravans
, and who now live all over the world. Most gypsies prefer to be called
romanies
.
someone who does not like to stay in the same place for a long time
to turn around fast in circles
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dancers gyrated wildly to the beat of the music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞蹈员随着音乐的节奏疯狂地旋转起舞。

Sense.DEF: if the value of money in business gyrates, it moves up and down a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stock and bond markets have gyrated in recent weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 证券市场近几周波动很大。

Sense.DEF: a wheel that spins inside a frame and is used for keeping ships and aircraft steady. It can also be a child’s toy.
